loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha is a woman who has dedicated herself to agriculture from a young age. She learned to farm at her parent’s side, and today she is the mother of 4 children to whom she tries to teach these ways and they too work the land. Nevertheless, she also wishes that her children acquire a profession, and therefore she works day after day to better her agricultural products, as well as increase the number of chickens that she raises to later sell in the markets. But her priority is growing potatoes. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of 500 soles to buy items needed to take care of her land, items like manure and fertilizer. She hopes that you can help her improve her land.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Martha es una mujer que desde muy pequeña se dedicó a la agricultura, junto a sus padres aprendió las tareas del campo, hoy al ser madre de 4 pequeños trata de enseñarles esas labores para también trabajen la tierra. Sin embargo, ella también desea que sus hijos tengan una profesión, y para ello se dedica día a día a mejorar sus productos agrícolas, como también a incrementar el número de gallinas que cría para luego venderlas en los mercados. Pero su prioridad es el cultivo de la papa.Por ello, solicita un préstamo de 500 soles para comprar lo necesario para el cuidado de sus terrenos, tales como abonos y fertilizantes. Ella espera que usted pueda ayudarla para la mejora de sus tierras.

loans.use: Buy manure and fertilizer for her farming land

loans.name: Bernabé

texts.es:
Bernabé is a father who with much effort was able to educate his children, who now work in the city of Lima, thanks to his labor as a farmer, a profession that has given him much pleasure during his lifetime. Nevertheless now they have the responsibility of educating their two younger children, and for them he wishes to keep on working and improving his agricultural products. In order to do that he needs fertilizer and chemicals for his land. At the moment he doesn’t have the ability to buy these products, so he is asking for a loan to be able to invest in purchasing fertilizer and seeds. He hopes that you are the person who can help him.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Bernabé es un padre que con mucho esfuerzo logró educar a sus hijos, quienes se encuentran trabajando en la ciudad de Lima, esto gracias a su labor como agricultor que le dio en la vida, mucha satisfacción.Sin embargo ahora tienen la responsabilidad de educar a sus 2 menores hijos, por ellos desea seguir trabajando y mejorando sus productos agrícolas, para ello requiere de abono y medicamentos para sus terrenos de cultivo.En estos momentos no cuenta con la capacidad para adquirir estos productos, por ello solicita un préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de fertilizantes y semillas.Él espera que usted sea la persona que lo pueda ayudar.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and seeds for his crops

loans.name: Armanda

texts.es:
Armanda is an enterprising woman. Ever since she married she saved the maximum she could in order to acquire a small plot of land where she could live comfortably. She was able to acquire it and build a house, and she began a business selling food upon seeing that there wasn’t a similar business in her area. In addition, she sells bread in the afternoon. These activities help them meet their family’s expenses. Nevertheless her wishes to grow as a businesswoman have not diminished. Armanda is asking for a loan, money that will help her expand her business and equip her location where she sells food, making it more welcoming for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Armanda es una mujer emprendedora, desde que se casó ahorro al máximo para poder adquirir un pequeño terreno donde pueda vivir cómodamente, logró adquirirlo y construir su casa, ahí instaló un negocio de venta de comida, viendo que en su localidad no había tal, adicionalmente vende pan por las tardes.Estas actividades le ayudan a solventar los gastos de su familia. Sin embargo sus deseos de crecer como negociante no han menguado.Armanda solicita un préstamo, dinero que le ayudará a ampliar su negocio y acondicionar el lugar donde vende comida, hacerlo más acogedor para sus clientes.

loans.use: Increase capital to expand and equip her bread and food business.

loans.name: Sixto

texts.es:
Sixto is a farmer who works growing a diverse variety of potatos, products that up to today have helped him cover his home’s necessities, above all, his daughter’s medicines. She is the only child that still lives at home and she suffers from epilepsy, and she takes medicine to control her sudden seizures. Sixto needs to give her pills which are very expensive. For these reasons, the longing to provide economic stability is a priority for this father. He presents his case for soliciting a loan, and the loan will be invested in his farm, with the purchase of manure and fertilizers needed for crop production.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Sixto es un agricultor que trabaja sembrando papas de diversas variedades, productos que hasta hoy le han ayudado a cubrir las necesidades de su hogar, sobre todo con las medicinas de su hija, quien es la única que vive aún en su hogar y sufre de epilepsia, para controlar sus repentinas convulsiones, Sixto debe suministrarle unas pastillas que son muy costosas.Por estas razones, las ansias de creer económicamente es una necesidad prioritaria para este padre. Presenta su caso en este medio para solicitar este préstamo, monto que será netamente invertido en sus chacras, con la compra de abono y fertilizantes necesarios para su producción.

loans.use: Buy fertilizers for his crops, thereby increasing his earnings and enable him to take care of his daughter who suffers from epilepsy

loans.name: Edwing

texts.es:
Edwing is a young entrepreneur who grows flowers (gladiolas) and other agricultural products as a way of having his own income. Not only has he made earnings for himself, he also contributes to his parent’s household expenses. In order to increase these earnings he needs flower and agricultural product seeds, which is why he is asking for a 1200 soles loan, with the hope that you can respond to his request. He promises to be responsible with his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Edwing es un joven emprendedor, incursionó en el cultivo de flores (gladiolos) y otros productos agrícolas, buscando la manera de tener recursos propios.No solo ha obtenido ganancias personales, sino que también aporta para el hogar de sus padres.Para incrementar estas ganancias requiere de semillas de flores y de productos agrícolas, el monto que solicita en calidad de préstamo es de 1200 soles, con la esperanza de que puedan responder su pedido, promete ser responsable con sus pagos.

loans.use: Buy seeds to grow and sell flowers.

loans.name: Srean

texts.en:
Mrs. Srean P., 38, is a farmer as well as raising pigs and earns around $1 per day. She is married and the mother of three children. Her husband, Mr. Saro Saran, 42, works growing rice with his wife. They both live in Anlong Snok Village, Kampong Cham Province. Mrs. P. is requesting a loan of $150 to fix their pig pen and purchase pig feed with any remainder from the loan money. The loan will allow her to improve her pig-raising business and increase the family’s income. In the photo, beside Mrs. P. is her husband.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL):

HKL is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To fix pig pen and purchase pig feed

loans.name: Ouch

texts.en:
Mrs. Ouch K., 31, is a farmer as well as grocery seller in Tasas Village, Pursat Province. She earns around $1.50 per day. Her husband, Mr. Sang Soeurm, works growing rice with his wife. K. buys grocery inventory from the town market and transports everything by bicycle to sell around her village. In order to grow her business, she wants to make more profit and so she is asking for a loan of US$ 500 to purchase a secondhand motorcycle to use as transportation for her business. The loan will allow her to increase their income through transporting more groceries to sell and saving time.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL):

HKL is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase a secondhand motorcycle to use as transportation for her business

loans.name: Mann

texts.en:
Mrs. Mann S., 36, sells dried fish in the market and she makes around $10 per day. Her husband, Mr. Ty Map, 38, makes dried fish for his wife to sell. He goes to buy fish from stock places and fishmongers to dry at his house, and he spends one day or two days drying them. They have three children, one of whom is married and lives in the family’s home. They live in Sesin Village, Banteay Meanchey Province.

Because of growing customer demand, Mrs. S. needs to have her husband dry more fish to sell, and now she is requesting a loan of US$ 1200 to purchase more fish to dry for sale. The loan will allow her to increase her family’s income. (Mrs. S.'s husband is pictured.)

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL):

HKL is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to dry for sale

loans.name: Manzura

texts.en:
Manzura B. is 42 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband is currently unemployed so Manzura is the only bread-winner in her family. Manzura sells dried apricots in the local central market. As a rule, she purchases apricots in the market and dries them herself. She has been in this business for 8 years already. Dried fruit, especially dried apricots, are very popular in Tajikistan. Besides they are very useful for the health.

Considering the constant demand for this kind of goods, Manzura's business is quite successful and brings in stable income for the family. Today Manzura is requesting US$ 600 for a term of 7 months. She is going to spend the loan purchasing apricots with the purpose of drying them in order increase the quantity of goods for sale. Manzura expresses her gratitude to everyone who supports her.

loans.use: Purchasing apricots to dry for sale

loans.name: Marhamat

texts.en:
Marhamat N. is 60 years old. She is a widow and has eight adult and independent children. Marhamat has been working the land for 27 years already. Her younger son helps Marhamat with the business. On her plot of land, she grows such vegetables as tomatoes, cucumbers, pumpkins, maize, and other vegetables according to the season. Over the years of her activity Marhamat has acquired the knowledge and skills required for the business. For instance, she knows how to store vegetables so that they keep their marketable condition and do not to lose their taste and useful properties.

Each year Marhamat grows enough for family consumption and for selling. The business is their main source of income and even while generating a stable income, it requires considerable funding. Today Marhamat is requesting US$ 300 for a term of 7 months. Marhamat plans to spend the loan purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing vegetables. She would like to thank all who support her and promises to manage the loan correctly.

loans.use: Purchasing of  seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Muso

texts.en:
Muso C. is 49 years old. He is married with four children. Muso sells foodstuffs such as cookies, candies, tea, and soft drinks in a store which he has recently opened. Until he opened his store, he was selling his goods in the market. He has been in this business for 10 years already. Muso is very polite and his shop is very popular with the local inhabitants so he has a faithful clientele. The business generates the main income for the family.

Muso wants to keep on growing his business and to increase the variety of products that he offers. With this purpose in mind, today Muso is requesting 3400 Somoni (US$ 1000) for a term of 12 months. He is going to spend the loan for purchasing foodstuffs to expand the range of goods for sale. This purchase will enable him to increase his sales, to earn more, and to meet the needs of his family fully. Muso thanks everyone for support and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: Purchasing of  foodstuffs to expand the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Sohibjon

texts.en:
Sohibjon C. is 26 years old. He has been married for about two years. His wife is a teacher in the local school. Currently, Sohibjon does not work within his profession, but tries to feed his family by running a retail store. Sohibjon has been running his business for about 3 years. He rents a retail store where he sells different kinds of housewares. His business is the family's main source of income.

As a rule, Sohibjon travels to the neighboring town of Khujand 2-3 times a month to purchase his goods. Sohibjon is trying to have a wide range of goods with good quality to meet the requirements of his customers and to satisfy the needs of customers with different levels of income.

Today, Sohibjon is requesting 3400 Somoni (US$ 1000) for a term of 12 months. This is the second time that he has asked for a loan through IMON. It will be used to buy more housewares in order to increase the range of his inventory. Due to the profitability of his business, the determination of this micro-entrepreneur, and his experience in the business, Sohibjon is qualified to receive such a loan.

loans.use: Purchasing new housewares to expand the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Lola

texts.en:
Lola S. is 32 years old. She’s married and the loving mother of two children. Lola sells clothing for kids and shoes for men in the local market. She has been in this business for 6 years. Her husband also is a market vendor and he has another stall at the same market.

Like any mother Lola wants her children to have everything they need now and dreams that all of them shall have a higher education. Considering that such goods as clothes and shoes are in demand regardless the season of the year, Lola's business is rather stable, generating considerable income and allowing Lola to support her family.

Now Lola needs to increase her working capital so as to be able to purchase new summer clothes for kids and shoes for men for re-sale. For this purpose, she is requesting US$ 600 for a term of 6 months. Lola thanks everyone for supporting her and promises to be accurate in the loan repayment.

loans.use: Increasing working capital to purchase new clothing and shoes for re-sale

loans.name: Zarofat

texts.en:
Zarofat S. is 36 years old. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a taxi driver. In order to help her husband support the family, Zarofat has been running her own business for 10 years. She sells clothes and shoes for kids and women. She rents a store that is located in her home town. At the same time, she sells her goods each Friday at the large market in a neighboring city. Those days she works from 5 a.m. till late evening. Zarofat's husband helps her on Fridays.

Now Zarofat is planning to increase her working capital by purchasing goods for the summer season. She hopes to raise her income in order to pay her children’s school fees. With this purpose in mind, she requests US$ 600 for a term of 6 months. Having proved herself to be an honest, reliable client, Zarofat promises to repay the current loan promptly. Zarofat expresses her gratitude to everyone who supports her, thus allowing her to develop her business.

loans.use: Purchasing of new clothes and shoes for kids for the summer season

loans.name: An

texts.en:
Mrs. An S. is a villager in Totoeng Thngai Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is a farmer. She is a 43-year-old widow with two children who are attending school. Her family members live in poor conditions because Mrs. An S. has only one business activity.

Therefore, Mrs. An S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding business. Previously, Mrs. An S. obtained a loan from AMK to buy fertilizers for her field and she has fully paid it back.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start a breeding business.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Mrs. Pov O. is a farmer in Trapaing Pour Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is a 53-year-old widow without any children. Being the only earner, she lives in poor conditions. Mrs. Pov O. wants to improve her standard of living so  she decided to ask for a loan to build a new house to replace the old one.

loans.use: Build a new house to replace the old one.

loans.name: Kunthea

texts.en:
Mrs. Kunthea K. is a 39-year-old widow with three children, one of whom is a security guard while the remaining two are attending school.

Mrs. Kunthea K. is a farmer in Prey Chap Lech Village in Kampong Speu Province. Besides this business, she is also a construction worker and pig breeder. Despite her three businesses, Mrs. Kunthea K. cannot support her family as she would like. She decided to ask for a loan to start a cow breeding business in order to improve her living conditions. Previously, Mrs. Kunthea K. had obtained a loan from AMK to buy piglets and she has fully paid it back.

loans.use: To start a cow breeding business.

loans.name: Rim

texts.en:
Mrs. Rim S. lives in Taing Bonteay Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is a farmer and she sells second-hand clothes in the local village. She is a 52-year-old widow without any children and she now lives in hard conditions because she does not have anybody to help her in her business activities.

Mrs. Rim S. has difficulties traveling to buy clothes to re-sell in the village. Thus she decided to buy a motorbike for traveling to purchase clothes. Previously, Mrs. Rim S. obtained a loan from AMK to start her clothes selling business and she has fully paid it back.

loans.use: Buy a motorbike for traveling to purchase clothes to resell.

loans.name: Hurshed

texts.ru:
Hurshed H. lives in the city of Vahdat, is married, and has 2 children. He works out of a spot in the city market selling shoes, which he brings in from the city of Dushanbe. He has been doing this for 5 years. He wants to take out a loan to bring in more goods for the upcoming season. He plans on repaying the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Dan Ostrovsky, Kiva volunteer.

Холбоев Хуршед житель города Вахдат. Женат . Имеет двоих детей. Занимается бизнесом в сфере торговли . Имеет торговую точку на рынке города. Продает обувь. Привозит товар из города Душанбе. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже пять лет.Хочет получить кредит и привезти новый товар к новому сезону. Погашать кредит планирует в течении 6 месяцев

loans.use: Buy goods

loans.name: Sao

texts.en:
Mrs. Sao R. is 54 and the mother of six children, one of whom is a construction worker while four others are attending the local school. The last one is too young to work or study.

Mrs. Sao R. is a farmer in Au Krosa Village in Kampong Speu Province. Her husband, Mr. Thon Phan, is a farmer and a bed maker. Since his business is now going well, Mrs. Sao R. decided to ask for a loan to buy wood to make beds. Previously, Mrs. Sao R. obtained a loan from AMK to start her husband's business and she has fully paid it back. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy wood to make beds.

loans.name: Zebo

texts.ru:
Zebo O. is a 52 year old dressmaker living in the city of Vahdat. She is married and has 5 children. She has been making an income tailoring dresses to order for 10 years. In addition, she owns a plot of land where she grows wheat and vegetables, most of which she ends up selling, but keeps some for herself. Because of this, her business provides her family with an additional source of income. It will soon be time to re-sow her plot, which is why it is essential for her to prepare the land. She has decided to take out a loan in order to buy seeds and fertilizer. In addition, it is essential for her to buy fuel for her to be able to plow the land. She will repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Dan Ostrovsky, Kiva volunteer.

Ойматова Зебо портниха. Возраст 52 года . Замужем , имеет пятерых детей. Живет в городе Вахдат.10 лет зарабатывает пошивом платьев на заказ. Кроме того имеет участок земли , который засеивает пшеницей и овощами. Получаемый урожай использует для продажи. Но часть оставляет себе. Поэтому этот бизнес дает ее семье дополнительный доход. Скоро наступает сезон посева , поэтому ей необходимо подготовить землю. Она решила получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить семена и удобрения. Кроме того необходимо купит горючее для вспашки земли. Погашать кредит она сможет в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Bahrigul

texts.ru:
Bahrigul Kalandarova lives in the city of Vahdat. She is 26 years old, not married, and has a tech school education. She works as a dressmaker in studio #3 sewing folk style dresses to order. She cannot buy a cow from this income, and therefore wants to take out a loan to buy one. She plans on selling the cow’s milk to neighbors, which will be advantageous to her and her neighbors because her milk will sell for lower prices. She will repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Dan Ostrovsky, Kiva volunteer.

Каландарова Бахригуль жительница города Вахдат .Возраст 26 лет. Незамужем . Имеет средне – специальное образование. Работает портнихой в ателье №3 . Шьет национальные платья на заказ. На зарабатываемые деньги она не может приобрести корову , поэтому хочет получить кредит и купить дойную корову. Получаемое молоко будет продавать соседям. Это будет выгодно для нее и для соседей. Так как молоко будет продавать по более низким ценам. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Buy a cow

loans.name: Idigul

texts.ru:
Idigul A. lives in the city of Vahdat. She is married and has 3 children. She has a large plot of land that she grows vegetables and wheat on. It is now time to prepare the land for the upcoming season, so in order to buy seeds, enriched fertilizer, and fuel, she wants to take out a loan. She plans on repaying the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Dan Ostrovsky, Kiva volunteer.

Асоева Идигуль проживает в городе Вахдат. Замужем и меет троих детей. Имеет большой участок земли , который засеивает овощами и пшеницей. Наступил сезон подготовки земли к новому посеву. Поэтому для покупки семян , минеральных удобрений и горючего хочет получить кредит , сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Obtain fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Zulhiya

texts.ru:
Zulhiya S. lives in the city of Vahdat. She has no educational background, but has been working in agriculture her whole life. She plants vegetables, wheat, and other grains. She is married and has 5 children. Raising such a big family isn’t that easy. Her husband doesn’t make that much money. She sells most of her crop at the market , and uses the rest for her family . Now, she plans on taking out a loan to buy enriched fertilizer and seeds. That way, she can prepare the soil for a new season. She plans on repaying the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Dan Ostrovsky, Kiva volunteer.

Саъдиева Зульхия проживает в городе Вахдат. Образования не имеет . Но всю жизнь занимается земледелием. Сажает овощи , сеет пшеницу и другие культуры. Она замужем и имеет 5 детей. Содержать такую большую семью не так уж просто. Муж зарабатывает не много. Ее деятельность помогает обеспечивать семью , так как урожай частично оставляет себе , а большую часть продает на рынке. Сейчас планирует получить кредит и закупить минеральные удобрения и семена. Таким образом она подготовит землю к новому посевному сезону. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Приобретение удобрений и семян.

loans.name: Salima

texts.ru:
Salima M. works in the trade business. She brings replacement parts in from the city of Dushanbe for automobiles and sells them in the local market. This is the only source of income for her family, which is why it is essential for her to grow the business. In order to do that, she wants to take out a loan and increase the assortment of goods she can sell. This way, she will be able to increase her profits. She will repay the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Dan Ostrovsky, Kiva volunteer.

Мирсаидова Салима занимается торговлей . Привозит из города Душанбе запчасти для легковых автомобилей и продает их на рынке района. Это единственный источник доходов его семьи, поэтому ей необходимо развивать бизнес. Для этого она хочет получить кредит и увеличить ассортимент товара. Таким образом она сможет увеличить прибыльность дела. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 6 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Oern

texts.en: Mrs. Oern U. lives in Trapaing Chambork Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is a farmer and grocer. She is a 32-year-old widow with a child who is attending school. She and her child live in poor conditions. In order to improve their standard of living, Mrs. Oern U. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding activity.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy a cow to start breeding activity.

loans.name: Alinyikira Lending Group

texts.en:
24-year-old Rose N. is the chairperson of Alinyikira Lending group in Makindye. She is married with one child and cares for two children of her late sister. For the past three years she has had a shop that operates as a retail and wholesale outlet in Makindye. Her dream is to buy a plot and build her own house. She plans to expand her shop by buying more goods including bags of beans, maize, sugar, salt, cooking oil and others. She has been successful because of her many customers.

Rose will share this loan with the members of her group.

loans.use: To buy beans, maize, sugar, salt and cooking oil.

loans.name: Shamsuddin

texts.ru:
Shamsuddin M. lives in Jaloliddini Rumy. He is married and has five children. To support his children, he works in agriculture. He grows watermelons and other melons. Now he must buy seeds and fertilizer. To do this, he plans to take out a loan for 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer.

Малаев Шамсуддин проживаетв районе Джалолиддини Руми.Женат. Имеет пятерых детей. Для того , чтобы прокормить детей занимается земледелием.Сажает арбузы и дыни. Сейчас необходимо купить семена и удобрения для обработки. Для этого планирует получить кредит сроком на 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Buying seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Chham

texts.en:
Mrs. Chham S., 40, is a rice wine maker and raises pigs to sell. She sells wine to her customers and then transports it to them. She has been in this business since 1998 and earns around $5 per day. Her husband, Mr. Champa Phay, 50, is a farmer who earns around $4 per day. They live in Korktonlaop Village, Banteay Meanchey Province.

Because of her growing business, Mrs. S. is requesting a loan of US$ 500 to add to her savings to purchase a small truck to use as transportation for her wine to customers.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL):

HKL is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To add to her savings to purchase a small truck to use to transport her wine to customers

loans.name: Narzinisso

texts.ru:
Narzinisso A. lives in Jalollidini Rumy. She is 50 years old. She is married and has four children. She works as a bookkeeper. Additionally, she works in animal husbandry. She has a business enterprise in which she raises sheep. She wants to take out a loan to buy a calf. Narzinisso is very active woman who is not cowed by the difficulties in her life. She can pay off the loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer.

Акрамова Нарзиниссо жительница района Джалоллидини Руми. Возраст 50 лет. Замужем и имеет четверых детей. Работает бухгалтером. Кроме того занимается животноводством. Имеет хозяйство где разводит овец. Хочет получить кредит и использовать его для покупки бычка. Нарзиниссо очень активная женщина и не боится никаких трудностей в жизни.Погасить кредит она сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchasing a calf

loans.name: Bwavumpologoma Lending Group

texts.en:
Esau W. is the treasurer of Bwavumpologoma Lending group in Kayunga. He is a teacher by profession teaching in Busaana Primary School, a privately owned school, where he gets a monthly pay. He is also a farmer with maize and bean plantations, as well as having a retail shop where he sells clothes of all kinds, shoes, luggage and handbags, bells and many other accessories. He is 40 years old and married with four children, the eldest being 13 years while the youngest is three. In all his businesses, he works with his wife.

Esau is our good client and he would like a loan to be able to add manpower to his plantain farm and partly to buy luggage bags for his shop. He will share this loan with the other members of his group.

loans.use: To employ more farm labor and to buy bags for a retail shop.

loans.name: Rohat

texts.ru:
Rohat R. lives in Jaloliddini Rumy. She is married and has three children. She has a higher education. She works in a dining hall. She bakes pies and sambusas (Tajik dumplings). She sells these at the market. Because the price of flour is growing, she has decided to take out a loan to buy flour. This will allow her to maintain her low prices and thus attract new clients. This way, she can earn more and further help her family. She plans to pay off the loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer.

Раупова Рохат жительница района Джалолиддини Руми. Замужем , имеет троих детей. Имеет высшее образование. Работает в столовой. Выпекает пирожки и самбусу. Реализовывает на рынке.В связи с тем , что цены на муку возраствают она решила получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить муку. Это даст возможность поддерживать цены и таким образом привлечь клиентов. Этим она сможет больше заработать и помочь семье. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchasing flour

loans.name: Muon

texts.en: Mrs. Muon M. is a farmer and basket maker in Trapaing Chambork Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is a 49-year-old widow with a child who sells bread in the local market. Even though Mrs. Muon M. and her child have three businesses, they still cannot support themselves. Therefore, Mrs. Muon M. has asked for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. Previously, Mrs. Muon M. obtained a loan from AMK to start her basket business and she has fully paid it back.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Thida

texts.en:
Mrs. Thida H. is a farmer in Damnak Smach Village in Kampong Speu Province. Aside from this business, she makes and sells desserts. She is 42 and a window with five children, two of whom are clothes sellers while the others are attending school.

She now would like to start a cow breeding business so she decided to ask for a loan to buy calves for breeding in order to improve her standard of living. So far, Mrs. Thida H. has obtained a loan from AMK to buy piglets for breeding and she has fully paid it back.

loans.use: To buy calves for breeding.

loans.name: Qurbon

texts.ru:
Qurbon J. lives in Jalollidini Rumy. She is a widow. She lives with her four children. After her husband’s death, she had to start working to provide for her children. She works in the local market. She trades in spare parts for cars. She has been doing this for eight years, but all of her profit is spent on food, and there is nothing left for business development. Since she learned that getting a loan is possible, she decided to take out a loan for 3500 somoni. This loan will help to increase sales and to increase the assortment of goods she offers. Her income will increase, and she will be able to develop her business. She plans to pay off the loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer.

Джурамуродова Курбон проживает в районе Джалоллидини Руми. Вдова. Живет одна с четырьмя детьми. После смерти мужа пришлось выйти работать для того , чтобы обеспечить детей. Работает на рынке района. Торгует запчастями для легковых автомобилей. Уже восемь лет ее бизнес существует , но вся прибыль уходит на питание и не происходит развития бизнеса. Узнав про возможность получить кредит решила получить кредит в размере 3500 сомони. Это поможет увеличить товарооборот и увеличить ассортимент товара. Доход возрастет и таким образом она сможет развивать свое дело. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Sabzhumor

texts.ru:
Sabzhumor T. has been working in sales for ten years. She has a shop in the center of town. She trades in foodstuffs and some clothes. She is married and has five children. She wants to take out a loan to bring in goods before the new season. She gets the goods in the city of Dushanbe, buying at wholesale prices. She sells the goods with a small markup. Her profit margin is not very big. Therefore, to increase her income, Sabszhumor wants to take out a loan to diversify the assortment of goods she offers. She plans to pay off the loan in 9 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer.

Тошева Сабзхумор десять лет занимается торговлей. Имеет магазин в центре своего кишлака. Торгует продуктами питания и еще некоторыми видами одежды. Замужем имеет пятерых детей. К новому сезону хочет получить кредит и привезти товар. Приобретает товар в городе Душанбе ,покупая у оптовых реализаторов. Продает товар с небольшой наценкой. Прибыль нен очень большая. Поэтому для того , чтобы увеличить доход Сабзхумор хочет получить кредит и разнообразить ассортимент товара. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 9 месяцев

loans.use: Increase the assortment of goods

loans.name: Aïssatou

texts.fr:
Aïssatou D. is married and the mother of 4 children. With this first loan, she wishes to help with the daily expenses, so as to improve the living conditions and the health status of her family. Her business consists in going to the market to buy palm oil, lemon juice, and salt, that she then resells door-to-door in several neighborhoods. She intends to repay the loan after six months, in one single installment.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer.

Aïssatou D. est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle souhaite avec ce premier prêt participer quotidiennement aux dépenses familiale afin d’améliorer les conditions de vie et de santé de sa famille. Elle va ainsi acheter au marché lde l'huile de palme, du jus de citron et du sel afin de le revendre de porte à porte dans plusieurs quartiers. Elle va rembourser au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy palm oil, lemon juice and salt for door-to-door resale

loans.name: Negmat

texts.ru:
Negmat R. lives in Shahrinav. He lives with his family. He is married and has four children. He has a secondary education. He works as a businessman. He buys rice and other kinds of grains wholesale from farmers. He then brings them to Dushanbe and, with a small markup, sells them wholesale. He has been doing this for 26 years. The business is well established. Harvest time for the new crops is coming soon, and he wants to increase his sales. The loan will help him to buy the goods for a lower price. He will repay the loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer.

Раджабов Негмат житель района Шахринау. Живет со своей семьей. Он женат и имеет четверых детей. Образование среднее. Работает бизнесменом. Покупает у дехкан рис и другие виды круп –оптом. Привозит в город Душанбе и с небольшой наценкой продает, так же оптом. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 26 лет. Бизнес налажен. Но скоро сбор нового урожая и он хочет увеличить товарооборот. Это поможет ему скупить товар по более низкой цене. Погашать кредит он будет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Zlatija

texts.en:
Zlatija is a 51-year-old woman living in the village Orahovici, near the town Gračanica. She is married with one daughter, who is 28 years old and working abroad for part of the year. Her husband earns a small monthly pension, and she helps support them through farming. Like many people in Bosnia, Zlatija farms her land, growing some vegetables & fruits to feed her family, and selling them if possible.

This is her 3rd loan with Žene za Žene, in the amount of 1000 KM. Most of her income comes from her cattle, and her last two loans have been invested in growing & sustaining this business. With this loan she plans to use funds to help renovate and expand her current barn. She does plan to buy another cow too, and may use these funds towards this if possible.

loans.use: To renovate and expand her barn

loans.name: Bashorat

texts.ru:
Bashorat A. lives in the city of Dushanbe. She is married with two children. She works from home where she makes national dresses. Bashorat would like to purchase an embroidering machine. For this purpose she would like to receive a loan that she plans to repay in the next 12 months. Bashorat’s husband works but his money is not enough. Therefore she needs to work hard to provide for her family.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva volunteer.

Абдуназарова Башорат проживает в городе Душанбе. Замужем и имеет двоих детей. Занимается пошивом национальных платьев. Шьет на дому. Хочет приобрести вышивальную машинку. Для этого планирует получить кредит сроком на 12 месяцев. Муж работает, но его заработка не хватает. Поэтому ей приходится много работать , чтобы обеспечить семью.

loans.use: to purchase an embroidering machine

loans.name: Path

texts.en:
Mrs. Path S. is a farmer in Damnak Smach Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her husband, Mr. Pheara Hon, helps his wife business when he has free time from selling pigs. Since his pig-selling business activity is going well, Mr. Pheara Hon would like to buy a new motorbike to transport his piglets to sell from door-to-door. Unfortunately, he does not have enough money to buy it so Mrs. Path S. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.

Mrs. Path S. had already obtained a loan from AMK to start her husband's business and she has fully paid it back. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike to transport his piglets to sell from door-to-door.

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
Mrs. Phat P. is a villager in Damnak Smach Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is a farmer. She is a 35-year-old widow with three children, one of whom is a pig seller while another one is attending school. The youngest one is too young to work or study.

Since her first business is going well, Mrs. Phat P. decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets to sell in the market. Previously, Mrs. Phat P. obtained a loan from AMK to start pig selling business and she has fully paid it back.

loans.use: To buy more piglets to sell in the market.

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema is married and since 2003 has made a living running a general store. Every day, she works from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90.

In the past, Neema took out two loans from BRAC Tanzania and used them to successfully expand her business. Now she is applying for a new loan to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mejra

texts.en:
Mejra is a 49-year-old woman living near the town of Doboj. She is a widow and has 4 children, all grown, ranging in age from 22 to 28. Only one son lives with her now, along with his wife and new child.

This is Mejra’s third loan with Žene za Žene. She is asking for 600 KM to buy more chickens for her poultry farm. There are two types of poultry farms: ones that breed & fatten chickens to sell for meat, and ones that breed chickens to produce eggs. Mejra buys chickens that are good egg producers, and wants to buy more of these so she can increase her egg sales for the rest of the year.

Mejra wants to make sure she earns as much money as she can, and plans to use all her free time for this business. Her sales are going well so far, she reports, but she wants to earn more. This is mostly because she wants to move back to her village, which is located near the town of Srebrenica. Mejra fled her hometown during the war and has resided in Doboj ever since. While Srebrenica was very devastated by the war and remains sparsely populated, it is still her dream to live in her hometown again. Mejra hopes to earn enough money from her business so she can pay for the move back.

loans.use: To buy chickens for egg producing & selling

loans.name: Natanamwaki

texts.en:
Natanamwaki is 48 years old, married, and has made a living selling vegetables for the last two years. Every day, she works from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m., and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

In the past, Natanamwaki took out two loans from BRAC Tanzania and used both to successfully expand her business. Now she has applied for a new loan to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Furkat

texts.ru:
Furkat K. lives in the city of Dushanbe. He is single. For the past two years he has been working as a hairdresser. Furkat is planning to get married but he does not have enough money for the wedding. Therefore he turned to us for help. He would like to get a loan of 1000 dollars that he would repay within the next year.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva volunteer.

Каримов Фуркат житель города Душанбе. Не женат. Работает парикмахером. Занимается этим видом деятельности уже два года. Планирует женится, но у него не хватает денег на проведение свадебных обрядов. Поэтому он обратился к нам за кредитом. Хочет получить 1000 долларов США, сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: for the wedding

loans.name: Usmon

texts.ru:
Usmon is married and has 3 children. He make Shish-kabob's and sells them at the road service station, he believes that there is a large demand for his product there. His family is located next to him, and his wife serves the clients, while he cooks the Shish-kabob's. He rents an area where after work he leaves his equipment there. He needs a necessary sum to buy the premise, and his friends in the business are finances in Mikroenvisti, have advised Usmon to address Kiva for a loan. He has received a loan for opening one more trading point in a road service station, near himself. In the new trading point his wife will be selling and trading Shish-kabob's as well as other foods and economic goods.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Усмон женат имеет троих детей. Он делает шашлыки и продает в автовокзале, он считает, что там хороший спрос на его продукт. Его семья находиться рядом с ним, жена обслуживает клиентов, сам Усмон готовит шашлык. Он арендует помещение, где после работы оставляет своё оборудование. Ему потребовалось необходимая сумма для выкупа помещения, его друзья по бизнесу кредитуются в Микроинвесте, они посоветовали Усмону обратиться за кредитом. Он получил кредит для открытия еще одной точки в автовокзале, недалеко от себя. В новой точке будет сидеть его жена, кроме шашлыков она будет торговать продуктами и другими хозяйственными товарами.

loans.use: For permission

loans.name: Safar

texts.ru:
Safarali M. lives in the Shahrinav region of Tajikistan. He is married with four children. In addition to his work as a taxi driver, Safarali repairs vehicles. He has fifteen years of experience in this field. He plans to obtain a loan for 12 months. He needs the loan to purchase spare parts for passenger cars. This would help him in his work.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva volunteer.

Муродов Сафарали проживает в районе Шахринау. Таксист, а так же занимается ремонтом автомобилей. Опыт работы в данной сфере 15 лет. Женат и имеет четверых детей. Планирует получить кредит сроком на 12 месяцев. Кредит ему необходим для того , чтобы закупить зап части для легковых автомашин. Это поможет ему в работе.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Mutabarhon

texts.ru:
Mutabarhon A. lives in the Jalloliddini Rumi region. She is 43 years old and is married with two children. She has been selling produce for the past ten years. In order to increase sales and attract new customers, Mutabarhon would like to obtain a credit of 1500 somoni for the period of 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva volunteer.

Абдуллаева Мутабархон жительница района Джаллолиддини Руми. Возраст 43 года . Замужем , имеет двоих детей. Занимается бизнесом. Торгует сельскохозяйственной продукцией. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 10 лет. Планирует получить кредит в размере 1500 сомони , сроком на 6 месяцев. Цель получения кредита – увеличить товарооборот. Это позволит увеличить ассортимент и привлечь новых клиентов.

loans.use: to increase sales

loans.name: Romana's Rabella Group

texts.en:
Romana is divorced and the mother of four children who range in age from 20 to 26 years old. She owns a shop and a house which she rents to other people. Ramona started her businesses in 1993. Every day, she works from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. and can earn a monthly profit of about $350.

In the past, Romana successfully repaid a loan from BRAC Tanzania that she used to expand her business. She has now applied for a new loan to buy more items to sell from her shop. She will divide this loan among the other members of her group, Winifrida, Helena and Emyrose, who run small businesses of their own, including operating a general store and raising livestock.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell from their businesses.

loans.name: Katebo Basoka Kwavula Development Group

texts.en:
Annet N., the chairperson of Katebo Basooka Kwavula Development Group located in Buwama off Masaka road, is 40 years old and married with four school-going children. She is a farmer with banana, cassava and sweet potato plantations on family land. She also keeps chickens for sale and raises goats, cattle, and pigs. Because she lives next to the landing site of Katebo, she buys smoked and dried fish from the site and sells them at markets and people's homesteads.

Annet needs a loan to be able to buy pigs and a calf. She has a dream of joining the clothing buying and selling business between Kenya and her home area, on top of her other business. In fact, it is not rare for a Ugandan to have many businesses.

The Katebo Basooka Kwavula group has been in existence for two years, and so far so good. Annet will share this loan with the other group members.

loans.use: To buy pigs and a calf.

loans.name: Amanda's Maendeleo Group

texts.en: Amanda is married and has a one-year-old child. In 2005, she went into business selling chickens, and she now works at her trade daily from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m.  She has applied for a loan to buy more chickens to raise and to sell to her customers. Amanda will divide her loan with the other three members of her group, Honorina, Meresia and Merry, all of whom run small businesses of their own.

loans.use: To buy more chickens to sell.

loans.name: Neema's Urafiki Group

texts.en:
Neema is married and has four children ages 24, 21, 19 and 8 years old. She also takes care of another child who is three years old. Neema went into business selling maize in 2004. Every day, she works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m and can earn a monthly profit of about $40.

Neema has applied for a loan to buy more rice and maize to sell. She will share this loan with the other members of her group, Nocim and Maria, who make a living selling milk and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy more food to sell from their businesses.

loans.name: Rose's Ushirikiano Group

texts.en:
Rose is 49 years old and married. For the last year, she has made a living selling milk. Every day, she works from 6 a.m. to 1 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140.

In the past, Rose took out two loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business and was diligent about paying them back. She has now applied for a new loan to buy more milk to sell to her customers. She will share this loan with Janeth, the other member of her loan group, who has a business selling clothes.

loans.use: To buy more milk and clothing to sell to their customers.

loans.name: Amrici's Mapinduzi Group

texts.en:
Amrici is married and has four children, ages 20, 18, 15 and 10. She also takes care of another child who is 10 years old. Every day, she works from 9 a.m. to 8 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70.

Amrici has applied for a loan to buy more food to sell, such as rice, maize flour, meat, vegetables and bananas. She will share this loan with Beatrice, the other member of her group, who makes a living selling clothing.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell from two businesses.

loans.name: Suubilyamukama Lending Group

texts.en:
Josephine N. is the group leader of Suubilyamukama Lending Group in Lugazi. For eight years she has been selling new clothes that include traditional bitenge, casual wear and suits mostly for ladies as well as children's wear. She is a married woman with five school-going children.

Josephine buys her clothes from Kampala, making the trip twice a week, and so far business is good. Her dream is to be able to buy a sewing machine so that she can make most of the clothes herself, as this will help her save more.

Josephine is asking for a loan to help her buy more clothes for her shop. She will share this loan with the members of her group.

loans.use: To buy new clothes for sale.

loans.name: Yuhusa's Mapinduzi Group

texts.en:
Yuhusa is 45 years old, married and has one child who is 15 years old. She also cares for another child who is four years old. In 2003, she went into business selling food. Every day, she works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. and can earn a profit of about $65 a month.

Yuhusa has applied for a loan to buy more food to sell. She will share this loan with the other members of her group, who need inventory for businesses they run that sell clothing, vegetables and charcoal.

loans.use: To buy more food to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mwanaid's Mapinduzi Group

texts.en:
Mwanaid is 35 years old, married and has three children, ages 15, 10 and 3. She went into business selling clothes in 2003. Every day, she works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Mwanaid has applied for a new loan to buy more clothing to sell. She will share this loan with the other members of her group, who want to buy inventory for businesses they run that sell milk, clothing and groceries.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for five businesses.

loans.name: Violeth's Mapinduzi Group

texts.en:
Violeth is married and has two children, ages seven and three. She also takes care of another child who is 11 years old. She owns a general store which opened in 2001. Every day, she works from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $350 from her sales.

Violeth has applied for a loan to buy more items to sell from her store. She will share this loan with the members of her group, all of whom want to buy inventory for shops they own that sell clothes or vegetables.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell from various shops.

loans.name: Bwavumpologoma Women's Group

texts.en:
Isabirye N. is the leader of Bwavumpologoma women's group in Kayunga, Busaana. Busaana is a small trading centre, but despite its small size all the surrounding villages depend on it for shopping because the distance to Kayunga is too far and costly.

Isabirye has a retail shop that sells new clothes which include traditional busuuti, trousers, shirts, shorts, casual wear, children's wear, shoes, luggage and handbags, bells and many other accessories. She has had this business for four years and has been a member of her women's group for two years now, and since that time her business has improved greatly because she has been able to add so much stock. Her husband is a teacher in the neighboring school in the village and only helps her out on weekends, so in addition to the shop she manages her farm and they have seven children ranging from 15 to one year.

Isabirye, together with her group members, needs a loan to improve her business. Isabirye plans to buy more traditional busuuti for ladies, shoes and bags once she receives the loan.

loans.use: To buy more new shoes, bags and clothes including traditional busuuti for ladies.

loans.name: Haika

texts.en:
Haika is 24 years old, married and has two young children. She went into business as a seamstress in 2004. Every day, she works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. and earns about $80 a month in profit from her sales.

In the past, Haika has successfully repaid two loans from BRAC Tanzania that she used to expand her business. Now she is applying for a new loan to buy more material which she will use to make items to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more supplies to make items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Suubiryamukama Group

texts.en:
Rukia N. is 50 years and a widow with six children, one of whom is still in senior school while the rest are adults. She is a member of the Suubilyamukama group. She has owned a restaurant for a long time, from which she serves breakfast, lunch and supper to the locals. Her meals include a variety of bananas, sweet potatoes, rice, meat, chicken, fish and greens.

Rukia will use her part of the loan to buy more chairs, plates, forks and foodstuffs to boost her business. Her previous loans have helped her with paying school fees for her children and she has been able to buy two plots of land.

Rukia will share this loan with the other members of her group.

loans.use: To buy more chairs, plates, forks and foodstuffs for a restaurant.

loans.name: Foday's Group

texts.en:
These entrepreneurs are Foday S., Patrick M. M., Musa C., Bai K., and Mohamed S.. They are working with the military in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of Le 4,100,000.00. The various members of the group will invest this loan in different types of businesses, agriculture, or invest on some developmental programme like buying a plot of land.

Foday, who is the leader of this group, is 26. He was born in Kailahun, Eastern Sierra Leone. He is married with 3 children. His wife will use the loan to invest it in her current business. She sells fish, rice, and palm-oil. She has been in this business for 5 years now. In this way, the family`s livelihood will improve as Mr Foday`s wife will now be able to earn more money to support the family.

loans.use: Buy more baskets of fish.

loans.name: Rayo De Luz Group

texts.en:
Claribel M. is a 30-year-old woman who lives with her husband and three children (ages 13, 7, and 6) in a small community called Las Palmillas in the eastern province of Hato Mayor in the Dominican Republic. She began a small business selling clothing earlier this year and wants to use the loan to increase her inventory.

Claribel travels by bus from town to town selling her products to the small communities in the countrysiD., as many of these rural people do not have the means to travel to town to do their shopping. Claribel also has a small hair salon in her house where she serves friends and neighbors when she is not out selling the clothing. She has started this clothing business to earn additional income so that she can proviD. her children with a good education and comfortable home. It is her hope that they become professionals one day. In Claribel’s free time, she enjoys reading and spending time with her family.

Claribel is the leader of the 10-person micro-bank group, Rayo D. Luz. In English, this means `ray of light´. Each of these unique Dominican entrepreneurs unite in solidarity, allowing them to access funding that they would otherwise never be able to receive on their own. On behalf of Claribel, the Rayo D. Luz group, and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, and undergarments

loans.name: Su

texts.vi:
Mr. Su’s family has 4 persons and doesn’t have enough space for agricultural activities. His wife has cancer, which makes her unable to work but they don’t have financial resources to send her to hospital. Mr. Su earns a living by making ice-cream and selling it in the streets, which generates a very limited income of about only 175000 VND per person. Mr. Su has two children; the oldest one is in grade 12 and very diligent. Thus, he is in an extreme need of money to send his wife to the hospital and raise his two children, especially when his daughter is going to college in a year. Mr. Su would like to borrow a loan of $75 to purchase more ingredients to make ice-cream and breed chickens.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa N., Kiva Volunteer.

Gia đình gồm có 4 người và không có đất sản xuất, chỉ ở trên nền đất nhỏ họ hàng cho. Vợ đau yếu thường xuyên không hể lao động nặng được. Hiện tại vợ bị bệnh u bướu sau lưng, nổi u nhiều gây đau nhức, không có tiền đi mổ. Chồng tự làm kem rồi đi bán suốt ngày ngòai đường nhưng thu nhập thấp ( Thu nhập bình quân 175.000 đ/ người ) do không có người ăn, vợ khi nào không đau thì phụ với chồng kiếm tiền nuôi 2 con ăn học. Cháu gái lớn học lớp 12, tuy gia cảnh khó khăn nhưng siêng học và học khá. Gia đình rất cần sự quan tâm giúp đỡ về mặt tiền bạc để chạy chữa bệnh sau lưng cho vợ và mua nguyên liệu làm kem và chăn nuôi gà kiếm chút đồng lời cho 2 cháu ăn học và đặc biệt là cháu lớn sắp vào đại học.

loans.use: Raise chicken

loans.name: Son

texts.vi:
As Mr. Son’s family doesn’t have enough space for agricultural activities, they make a living by working for people in the area. However, his oldest son is incapable of working due to his mental illness; his wife feels so despaired that she often leaves home. Mr. Son’s mother thus has to take the responsibility to raise his young daughter (her name is Xuan Mai). The family doesn’t have financial resources to send the oldest son to hospital. Since their income is only about 13.000.000 VND (around $800) per year even though all three people are working hard, they don’t have sufficient capital to invest in breeding poultries. Therefore, Mr. Son wishes for a loan of $75 so that they can buy chickens and breed them.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Gia đình không có đất canh tác ( Chỉ có 700 m2 ) chủ yếu sống vào nghề làm thuê quanh năm. Đứa con trai lớn không thể làm gì vì bị bệnh thần kinh, do con trai bị bệnh nên vợ chán nản thường bỏ nhà đi, nên bà nội phải nuôi thêm đứa cháu ( Xuân Mai ) từ lúc mới sinh đến nay. Hiện tại gia đình cũng không có tiền để lo thuốc thang cho đứa con trai bị thần kinh đi trị bệnh. Nhà có 3 người đi làm thuê nhưng thu nhập cả năm cũng chỉ được gần 13 triệu. Hiện nay gia đình chúng tôi muốn phát triển chăn nuôi nhưng thiếu vốn. Rất mong sự quan tâm của dự án về tài chính để chúng tôi nuôi gà. Gia đình có 4 người con thì 1 cháu lớn bị bệnh thần kinh.

loans.use: Raise chicken

loans.name: Unidos Por El Progreso Group

texts.en:
Pilar is a 48-year old woman who lives with her husband and son (age 6) in a small town called Sabana in the eastern province of Hato Mayor in the Dominican Republic. Pilar operates her own `fritura´, a small business that makes homemade snacks such as empanadas. She makes the food in her home and then sells it in the street. In the Dominican Republic, it is very common for people to buy a snack on the street corners as they walk to work, their homes, or simply when they are out and about.

The money from this loan will help her to buy enough ingredients such as flour, oil, corn, sugar, and chicken to make the food necessary to meet the demand she faces. She hopes that her business will continue to grow and become more stable with the help of this loan. Eventually Pilar hopes to save enough money to buy a refrigerator so that she can store meat for longer periods of time. In the meantime, she continues to work hard to provide for her family and better their living conditions.

Pilar is the leader of the 5-person micro-bank group, Unidos por el Progreso. In English, this means `united to progress´. Each of these unique Dominican entrepreneurs unite in solidarity, allowing them to access funding that they would otherwise never be able to receive on their own.

On behalf of Pilar, the Rayo de Luz group, and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

loans.use: To buy corn, flour, sugar, chicken, and oil for her fritura

loans.name: Dung

texts.vi:
Her husband abandoned her and her 4 children. She alone has to work hard to tend to their lives so it is unendurable. Her children one by one had to quit school to go to work for others. She currently only has the ability to educate one child. Her oldest son had an accident so his communication skill and health are not good, and thus he is unable to work. In addtiion, she has to spend money to buy him medication. They have little land to cultivate. They only have 1 small lot that they planted 100 green dragon plants, and therefore, she and her children have to work to make extra money to live, and buy medicine for her son who had the accident. Her family wishes to have some capital to expand their chicken farm.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer.

Chồng bỏ nhà đi đâu không rõ, để lại 4 đứa con. Một mình mẹ phải vất vả lo toan cuộc sống nên không thể kham nổi. Các cháu lần lượt bỏ học đi làm thuê. Hiện tại chỉ còn khả năng nuôi một cháu đến trường. Con trai lớn bị tai nạn giao thông sức khỏe yếu không đi làm được nhưng lại phải tiêu tiền thuốc men. Đất canh canh tác không có nhiều, nhà có 1 sào đất trồng 100 trụ thanh long vì vậy mấy mẹ con phải đi làm thuê kiếm sống và lo thuốc thang cho cháu bị tai nạn. Gia đình mong có nguồn vốn phát triển chăn nuôi gà.

loans.use: Raise Chicken

loans.name: Ba

texts.vi:
Mrs Ba is poor and the government helped build her a home. She herself is old and unable to do labor work, so she stays home and take care of her grandchildren, Her family does not have any land to farm, so their livelihood depends on her children working for others. However, it does not mean every child has stable employment. Her grandchild was born without a father, so the grandmother and his aunts and uncles help take care of the child. Even though they have a hard life, she was determined to educate her youngest son, and he is working hard to win a scholarship from the VN Plus program. Her family needs the loan to expand their business of raising chickens. Average income 10 USD per person.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer.

thuộc diện hộ nghèo được nhà nước xây nhà tình thương. Bản thân chủ hộ tuổi già sức yếu không lao động được, ở nhà nội trợ và chăm sóc cháu ngọai. Gia đình không có đất canh tác, cuộc sống chủ yếu là làm thuê của mấy đứa con. Tuy nhiên công việc không phải đứa nào cũng có thường xuyên. Cháu ngọai sinh ra không có cha nên chịu sự đùm bọc của bà ngọai và cậu, dì. Tuy cuộc sống còn nhiều khó khăn nhưng người mẹ vẫn nhất quyết cho đứa con trai út đi học và cháu đã cố gắng nhiều để được nhận học bổng của dự án VN Plus. Gia đình cần sự giúp vốn để phát triển chăn nuôi gà. Thu nhập bình quân 159.000 đ/người

loans.use: Raise chicken

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martin started this business in order to have an income to allow him to support his wife and not have to do without necessities nor have economic difficulties. He was faced with the need of a way to generate income, because before he was working in the Armed Forces of Mexico (Navy,) and when he left he did not have work. So, together with his wife he started selling jewelry and it went very well for them, and because of this he now has another income through a Taxi. He started in December of 2001 selling jewelry with his wife, and thanks to this going so well they were able to acquire the Taxi 3 years ago. But now he is no longer buying and selling jewelry because his wife has started to work with a company full time and has no time for the jewelry. So therefore the only business that he’s working at now is the Taxi.

He needs a loan of US$500 that he will pay in 4 months to buy tires and shock absorbers as well as a tune-up for the engine, which will allow him to provide a better service for his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

Martin inició el negocio para tener un ingreso que le permitiera sostener a su esposa y no tener que pasar necesidades ni apuros económicos, ante la necesidad de tener una actividad en la que percibiera un ingreso, ya que anteriormente había trabajado en la Armada de México (Marina) y cuando se retiro no tenía trabajo, fue por eso que junto con su esposa comenzó vendiendo joyería y les fue muy bien, es por eso que ahora cuento con otro ingreso extra a través del Taxi. Comenzó en Diciembre de 2001, vendiendo joyería con su esposa, y gracias a que les fue bien pudieron adquirir el Taxi hace 3 años, pero en la actualidad ha dejado la actividad de la compra-venta de joyería ya que su esposa entró a trabajar a una empresa de tiempo completo y ya no le queda tiempo para la joyería por lo que el único negocio al que se dedica es al Taxi

El necesita un prestamo por US $500 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar llantas y amortiguadores así como para la afinación del motor, lo cual le permitirá dar un mejor servicio a los usuarios del transporte.

loans.use: Taxi Maintenance

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria started her business because the father of her children abandoned them and she had to be responsible for her children, who at the time were very young. She was faced with the lack of money, that is to say, of some extra income that will allow them to cover their necessities, since the salary that she receives as the person in charge of cleaning in a construction company was not sufficient. So she started her business in October of 2006. One time when she dropped her children off at school, she realized that the vendors that were at the school entrance were selling a lot, and it occurred to her to do this outside of her house, and so one day she took out a small table with some candies and fried snacks, and the people passing by began to buy. She liked it, and little by little she was investing in more products and later put in a shelf with fried snacks of a well-known brand name and now has a good selection. Her project is to expand her business again by putting in an actual store that is bigger, converting a patio space at her house.

She needs a loan of US$1,000 that she will pay in 6 months in order to buy more candies, fried snacks and general groceries so that she will have a great selection and be able to sell more. With your help Maria will be able to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria inició el negocio porqué el papa de sus hijos los abandonó y ella tuvo que hacerse cargo de sus hijos que estaban muy pequeños. Ante la falta de dinero, es decir, de un ingreso extra que le permitiera completar para cubrir sus necesidades, ya que el sueldo que percibe como encargada de limpieza en una compañía constructora no le alcanzaba fue que comenzó su negocio en octubre del 2006, una vez que fue a dejar a sus hijos a la escuela se dio cuenta que los vendedores que estaban a la entrada de la escuela vendían mucho, y se le ocurrió hacerlo afuera de su casa, así que un día sacó una mesita con algunos dulces y frituras y la gente que pasaba le empezó a comprar, le gustó y poco a poco fue invirtiendo en mas mercancía, después pusó un anaquel con frituras de reconocida marca y ahora tiene mas surtido. Su proyecto es expandir más su negocio para poner una tiendita en forma y más grande, acondicionando un espacio del patio de su casa.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $1,000 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar más dulces, frituras y abarrotes en general para tener un mejor surtido y poder vender mas. Con tu ayuda Maria hara crecer su negocio.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Dalia

texts.es:
Dalia started her business out of necessity; because for her husband, the fishing at times goes well but at other times it does not, particularly when the fishery season is closed. Because of this she wanted to help him with the household expenses that are ever-increasing as their children grow up. She needed to have an additional income that would permit them to cover their necessities when her husband’s work was scarce, since all of their children are studying and at times their situation is very difficult. Although she works in the cleaning department of a construction company, the salary is not very high. She started her business when a friend at work encouraged her to sell household goods and cosmetics in her free time, which she thought was a good idea. In 2004 she started to sell them and in 2006 incorporated cosmetic sales. Both products she started selling to her co-workers, neighbors and friends, and today she has a good client base, and moreover is expanding her business and is now starting to sell fish and shellfish.

She needs a loan for US$1000 which she will pay in 6 months in order to buy cosmetics and products that will allow her to have a better selection of goods to offer her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

Dalia inició el negocio por necesidad, ya que a su esposo a veces le va bien en la pesca pero otras veces no, sobre todo cuando es temporada de veda, por eso quizo ayudarlo para apoyarlo con los gastos del hogar que cada día aumentan con el crecimiento de sus hijos. Ella necesitaba tener un ingreso adicional que les permitiera cubrir nuestras necesidades cuando el trabajo de su esposo fuera escaso, ya que todos sus hijos están estudiando y a veces su situación es muy difícil, y aunque ella trabajo en el área de limpieza de una constructora, sueldo no es muy alto. Comenzó? con su negocio cuando una amiga del trabajo la alentó a que vendiera productos para el hogar y cosméticos en sus ratos libres, lo cual le pareció una buena idea, y desde el año 2004 comenzó a venderlos y en el 2006 incorporo la venta de cosméticos. Ambos productos los comenzó vendiendo entre sus compañeros de trabajo, vecinas y amigas, y hoy tiene ya una buena clientela, además ha ampliado su actividad y ahora empieza a vender pescados y mariscos.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $1,000 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar cosméticos y productos que le permitan tener una mejor variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Caya

texts.es:
Caya started the business because she realized that in the block where she lives there was not a single small store, and that they are very necessary in order to obtain basic staple items. For this reason she decided to put in a store and it went well; little by little it has been growing and providing more for her. She needed to make extra money in order to help her husband with household expenses and for their children, since her husband’s salary at times was not sufficient. She started her business in December of 2000, converting the front part of their house and started selling a little merchandise at first. Little by little the business was growing and she was buying shelves to better accommodate her products and have a better selection. Apart from that, she was able to paint the store and circulate the name to improve the image of the store and in this way also sell more products.

She needs a loan for US$500 that she will pay in 4 months in order to by more merchandise that will permit her to have a greater selection and offer a better service to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

Caya inició el negocio porqué se dio cuenta que en la cuadra donde vive no existía ninguna tiendita y son muy necesarias para poder adquirir artículos de primera necesidad, razón por la cual se decidío a poner una y le fue bien, poco a poco ha ido creciendo y surtiéndola mas. Ella necesitaba ganar un dinero extra para poder apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y de sus hijos, ya que el salario de su esposo a veces no era suficiente. Comenzó su negocio en Diciembre de 2000, acondicionó la parte de enfrente de su casa y comenzó vendiendo poca mercancía en un principio y poco a poco fue creciendo y comprando estantes para acomodar mejor su mercancía y tener un mayor surtido, además de que también pude pintarla y roturarle el nombre, lo cual le da una mejor imagen y así también puede vender mas.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $500 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar más mercancía que le permita tener un mejor surtido para darles un mejor servicio a mis clientes.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa hand weaves sweaters, vests, and jackets. Her work is made with thick wool like macramé. She is married to a bricklayer. The couple lives in the area Irpavi II of La Paz, but they have no home. Thus, Rosa is responsible for serving as caretaker in exchange for not paying rent.

This is her third loan with Impro with Kiva. Her record is very impressive; she always makes payments on time. The amount will be used to buy wool and yarn to strengthen her business. Rosa has been an Impro client since 2007.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa es tejedora de chompas, chalecos, chalinas y sacones, la ropa es tejida a mano, sus trabajos son realizados tanto en lana gruesa como en macramé. La clienta esta casada con un albañil, la pareja vive en la zona de Irpavi II de la ciudad de La Paz pero no cuenta con domicilio propio, es así que Rosa se encarga de cuidar la propiedad y/o el terreno a cambio de no pagar alquileres (no recibe ningún tipo de pago).

Este es su tercer crédito, tanto en Impro como en Kiva, su historial es bastante impresionante (siempre hace los pagos a tiempo). El monto será destinado para comprar lana e hilo, de esa manera fortalecerá su negocio. Rosa es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2007.

loans.use: To purchase wool and yarn for a weaving business

loans.name: Thuan

texts.vi:
Her family has many children but littL. land to cultivate. Currently she has 3 acres of land but was only abL. to plant 200 roots of the green dragon plants due to lack of money. Income from growing the green dragon plants is not much. Last year she made 90 USD because of limited technology, and because the business is new so production is low. Her family needs the guidance and technology of the experts in the agriculture field. Presently, she and her husband want to raise cows not only to save up for their children, but also to use the manure to fertilize the green dragon plants. Average income 12 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer.

Gia đình thuộc diện đông con nhưng đất đai canh tác thì ít, hiện tại có 3 sào đất nhưng mới trồng được 200 trụ thanh long vì không có vốn. Thu nhập từ thanh long chưa cao, năm rồi thu được 14,5 triệu vì kỹ thuật trồng còn hạn chế, mặt khác do mới trồng nên năng suất thấp. Gia đình rất cần sự hướng dẫn kỹ thuật của các chuyên gia trồng trọt. Hiện tại vào lúc này vợ chồng muốn nuôi bò vừa tích lũy cho các con vừa lấy phân để bón cho thanh long. Thu nhập bình quân 200.000 đ.

loans.use: Grow Green Dragon

loans.name: Gladys Reyna

texts.en:
Gladys, a member of the Las Hormigas Village Bank, is a 38-year-old mother of four children. She hopes to get married to her partner as soon as possible. Gladys sells various sorts of wool in the city of Ayacucho from Wednesday to Saturday. She sells the wool for others to make blankets, sweaters, etc., and purchases the raw materials from the city of Lima. Furthermore, Gladys has a small store in her house where she sells vegetables, meat, and fruit with the help of her children.

Gladys needs a loan of 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (US$ 375) to invest in different colored wool.

Glady’s dream is to buy a car, to construct nice floors for her house, and to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to invest in different colored wool

loans.name: Fuente De Bendición Group

texts.en:
Reina Maria D. L. is a 21-year-old woman who lives with her husband and two children (ages 4 and 2) in a small community in the eastern province of Hato Mayor in the Dominican Republic. She opened a small stand selling seafood products and snacks one year ago. She recently came to Esperanza because she lacked adequate capital to buy enough products for her stand. The money from this loan will go towards purchasing fish, crab, shrimp, and oil to expand her inventory further. It is Reina´s hope to continue to growing her business so that she will be able to help support her young children and proviD. them with good health care and education.

Reina is the leader of the 5-person micro-bank group, Fuente D. Bendición. In English, this means `source of blessing´. Each of these unique Dominican entrepreneurs unite in solidarity, allowing them to access funding that they would otherwise never be able to receive on their own.
