On behalf of Reina, the Fuente D. Bendición group, and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

loans.use: To buy fish, crab meat, shrimp and oil

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria and her husband have a small business making rakes for tractors and with this income they support their children. They started the business when they purchased second-hand cars to take apart, providing the framework to start building rakes adaptable to tractors, and selling car parts to other workshops.

Gregoria needs a loan for 3000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (US$ 1075) to invest in a second car. Gregoira is a member of Las Hormigas Village Bank.

Greogia’s dream is to construct a home, to have a small store, and that her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to invest in a second car

loans.name: Trung

texts.vi:
Mr. Trung and his wife have 1.5 acres of land to grow rice and there are 5 people in the household. However, the land is not very fertile and quite dry, and due to lack of water they could only grow a small amount every year. Last year the rice was diseased and, therefore, their income was minimal. Due to their small lot of land, Mr and Mrs Trung also work as laborers for people in the area, earning about 62 USD per year to raise and educate their children. One child has a scholarship from the project VN Pus; however, that child has joint inflammation so the family has to buy medication regularly for the child. The family wants to raise chickens, making use of the little rice they produce. Average income is 12 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer.

Gia đình anh chị Trung có 1,5 sào đất trồng lúa và có 5 người trong nhà, nhưng vùng đất xấu và khô căn, thiếu nước nên mỗi năm chỉ trồng được một vụ. Năm vừa rồi lúa bị bệnh nên thu nhập không có bao nhiêu. Vì ruộng đất ít nên 2 vợ chồng đi làm thuê cho người dân trong vùng mỗi năm được khỏang 10 triệu lo cho các con ăn học. Nhà có một cháu được nhận học bổng của dự án VN Plus, tuy nhiên cháu hay bị đau nhức các khớp nên gia đình phải thường xuyên lo thuốc thang cho cháu. Nay gia đình muốn CN gà, tận dụng ít lúa sản xuất được. Thu nhập bình quân 200.000 đ

loans.use: Raise chicken

loans.name: Aida Aurora

texts.en:
Aida is a widowed, 67-year-old mother of ten children, two of whom currently live with her. She has had a garment workshop for many years, income that helped support her children to become professionals. Aida is a member of Las Hormigas Village Bank.

Aida uses a machine to make traditional clothing such as jumpers, blouses, underskirts, slip dresses, etc. In one day she is able to make up to three underskirts, which she sells at fairs in the rural area and the city of Ayacucho. Furthermore she purchases cheeses at the fairs and resells them in Ayacucho.

Aida needs a loan of 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (US$ 375) to invest in fabrics and thread.

Aida’s dream is to have a garment workshop where she can make more clothing and count on her workers.

loans.use: to invest in fabrics and thread

loans.name: Maria Jesús

texts.en:
Maria is a professional teacher in a relatively remote area, though it is not very good pay. In order to deal with her household expenses, Maria also makes animal gelatins that have curative properties. She sells her gelatin in pails, walking around different markets, institutions, and parks. Furthermore, Maria sells ready-made cereals, duck, and potbelly to order to various families.

Maria hopes for a loan of 1,600 Peruvian Nuevo Soles to invest in sugar, disposable cups, firewood, and cereals.

Maria’s dream is to have a larger gelatin business and to distribute her products around most of the city.

loans.use: to invest in sugar, disposable cups, firewood, and cereals

loans.name: Rober

texts.es:
Rober es un joven emprendedor, sus ganas de creer y progresar lo llevaron a iniciar su labor cultivando café, esto lo motivó a estudiar la carrera de agropecuaria, estudios que aún no puede concluir por motivos económicos, requiere mejorar su producción para costear los gastos de sus estudios.Esta incapacidad económica que está pasando lo limita a ampliar sus terrenos, por ello que tiene la esperanza de poder contar con usted.Solicita un préstamo de 600 soles que será debidamente invertido en la compra de plantaciones de café, que cuidará en su huerto para luego sembrarlos en sus terrenos, él espera que usted pueda atender su solicitud para así también continuar con sus estudios.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Rober is a young entrepreneur with the desire to get ahead in life; this led him to start cultivating coffee. In turn this also motivated him to study agriculture, which he will be unable to finish due to economic difficulties. He plans to improve his coffee production to cover the additional expenses of his studies. This economic limitation means that he is restricted to increasing the production of his land, which is why he hopes to count on you. He is asking for a loan of 600 soles which will be invested in the purchase of coffee plantations; he will tend to the plants in his garden and then plant them on his agricultural land. He hopes that you can help with his request so that he may continue with his studies.

loans.use: Purchase of coffee plantations to expand his agricultural land.

loans.name: Elvis

texts.es:
In order to bring more income to his family Elvis began to cultivate coffee; in the jungle area where he lives it is very profitable and there are great alternatives for growth. Now, Elvis hopes that his coffee is ready to be sold in the city, so that with his profit he can begin preparing for the next planting. His desire is to expand his crops and thus he is applying for a loan that will be invested in the purchase of plants and materials for his next round of coffee production.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Elvis, con el fin de traer un ingreso económico más a su familia, empezó a cultivar café, ya que en la zona de selva donde vive, es muy rentable y tiene grandes alternativas de crecimiento.Ahora, Elvis espera que su café esté listo para ser vendido en la ciudad, para que con las ganancias pueda prepararse para la próxima producción. El deseo de este joven, es de ampliar sus cultivos.Para ello, solicita un préstamo que será invertido en la compra de las plantas e insumos necesarios para su próxima producción de café.

loans.use: Investment capital for his next round of coffee production

loans.name: Marlene Esperanza

texts.es:
Señora Marlene is married and is 47 years old. She studied to be a secretary and she has 2 children who still depend on her. She lives in the neighborhood of Víctor Larco Provincia de Trujillo, La Libertad. Currently, she works making chocolate candies and at the same time making costume jewelry. She sells her chocolates in the shops closest to her house which have very good acceptance in the winter. In the summer she spends more time making and selling costume jewelry. The first loan that she recieved was for S/.300.00, that she invested in the purchase of materials for the costume jewelry. She belongs to the Community Bank "Las Palmeras" which she joined by invitation from a friend. With thel oan of S/.800.00, that she will repay in 6 months, she thinks she will begin buying and selling shoes and by this method grow her business. She dreams of being a large microenterprise and to run a nice market.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Marlene está casada, tiene 47 años, estudió secretariado y tiene 02 hijos que aún dependen de ella; vive en el distrito de Víctor Larco Provincia de Trujillo, La Libertad. Actualmente, se dedica a la preparación de chocotejas y al mismo tiempo confecciona joyas de fantasía; Realiza la venta de chocotejas a las bodegas más cercanas de su casa las cuales tienen muy buena aceptación en la temporada de invierno, en la temporada de verano brinda mayor dedicación a la confección y venta de joyas de fantasía. El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00, los que invirtió en la compra de materiales para la confección de bisutería. Pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS PALMERAS” al cual ingresó por invitación de una amiga. Con el préstamo de S/.800.00, que cancelará en un plazo de 06 meses; tiene pensado dedicarse a la compra y venta de zapatos y de esa forma ampliar su negocio. Sueña con ser una gran microempresaria y contar con un bazar muy surtido.

loans.use: To buy better materials for chocolates and jewelry

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr:
Marie S. is a 52-year-old woman who is married with six dependent children. She is requesting this loan to help with her household expenses. Thus, she plans to sell palm oil, honey and lemon juice.

She plans to repay the loan in a single payment in six months.

Translated from French by Pamela Poole, Kiva volunteer.

Marie S. est une femme de 52 ans, mariée et avec 06 enfants en charge. Elle souhaite ce prêt pour assurer ses charges familiales. Elle projette donc de vendre de l’huile de palme, du miel et du jus de citron.

Elle compte faire le remboursement au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Purchase and reselling of palm oil, honey, and lemon juice

loans.name: Liliana Pamela

texts.es:
Liliana is single. She is 27 years old and has studied through high school. She has two young children who depend on her. She lives in the neighborhood of Víctor Larco Provincia de Trujillo, La Libertad. Currenty she is the director of a line of beauty products and she has 54 consultants working for her who she constantly audits to achieve better sales as the group continues to add more consultants. Separate from selling beauty products, she is dedicated to the sale of milk in her neighborhood and other nearby neighborhoods also. This is a business that she inherited from her mother. She doesn't want to give it up since she currently has several cows with very good production and doesn't want to sell to big businesses wholesale because they pay very little. The first loan she received was S/.300.00 with which she started the business selling beauty products independently, since she helped another person sell when she was very young. She belongs to the Community Bank "Las Palmeras." With this loan of S/.500.00 that she will repay in 4 months, she is thinking of buying beauty products to have better stock. Liliana works with great persistence and dedication because she has a goal of buying a house.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Liliana es soltera, tiene 27 años, estudió secundaria completa, tiene 02 hijos menores de edad los cuales dependen de ella. Vive en el distrito de Víctor Larco Provincia de Trujillo, La Libertad. Actualmente, es directora en una línea de productos de belleza y tiene 54 consultoras a su cargo a las cuales capacita constantemente para la mejor realización de las ventas a pesar del grupo que tiene continúa captando más consultoras. A parte de dedicarse a la venta de productos de belleza se dedica también a la venta de leche en su distrito y otros distritos aledaños, este es un negocio que lo heredó de su madre y no quiere dejarlo ya que tiene algunas vacas con muy buena producción y venderlo al por mayor a empresas grandes no le conviene porque pagan muy poco. El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 con los cuales se inició en la venta de productos de belleza de manera independiente ya que desde muy joven había vendido ayudando a otra persona. Pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS PALMERAS”. Con el préstamo de S/.500.00 que cancelará en 4 meses tiene pensado comprar productos de belleza para tener mayor stock. Liliana trabaja con mucho empeño y dedicación porque tiene como meta comprar su casa.

loans.use: To buy beauty products

loans.name: Fatou Bintou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Fatou Bintou M. is married and has four dependent children. She is requesting this loan to purchase the raw materials necessary to dye her stock of white cloth in order to make the cloth into batik-dyed bedsheets, which she plans to sell.

This loan will be repaid in a single payment in six months.

Translated from French by Pamela Poole, Kiva volunteer.

Mme Fatou Bintou M. est mariée et a 04 enfants à charge. Elle souhaite ce prêt pour acheter de la matière première pour la teinture de son stock de tissu blanc, afin d’en confectionner des draps de lits en batik qu’elle va vendre

Ce prêt sera remboursé en une seule échéance au bout de six mois .

loans.use: Batik dying of white cloth, making bedsheets of the cloth, and traveling to Dakar, the capital, to sell them there.

loans.name: Miriam Janet

texts.es:
Miriam Janet is 36 years old and is married. She studied up through 3 years of high school. She has one daughter still dependent on her and lives in the district of Victor Larco Province of Trujillo, La Libertad.

In order to earn a living, she sells beauty products, and is a childcare provider (runs a daycare) for a group of children under 5 years of age, for parents who work outside their home. She runs the daycare during the day, and in the evening, she travels throughout her district to visit her clients wishing to purchase beauty products. She is interested in obtaining the awards for sales and customer retention.

The first loan she received was S/.300.00, which she invested in the purchase of cosmetic products that were on sale, and was then able to sell them at a higher price and increase her profits. Miriam Janet belongs to the Communal Bank "Las Palmeras". With this new loan of S/.800.00, which she plans on repaying within 6 months, she plans on buying additional products to increase her inventory and make more money. Miriam also dreams of building her house someday.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Miriam Janet está casada, tiene 36 años, estudió hasta 3er año de secundaria, tiene 01 hija la que todavía depende de ella. Vive en el distrito de Víctor Larco Provincia de Trujillo, La Libertad . Actualmente se dedica a vender productos de belleza de diferentes líneas y a la vez es madre cuidadora en un wawawasi (cuidado de niños); tiene a su cargo un grupo de niños menores de 5 años a los cuales cuida, estimula y atiene mientras sus padres salen a trabajar. Durante las tardes sale por todo su distrito a visitar a sus clientas para vender sus productos de belleza ya que le interesa obtener los premios por ventas y captación de clientas. El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00, los cuales invirtió en la compra de productos cosméticos que estaban en promoción para luego venderlos a mayor precio e incrementar su ganancia. Pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS PALMERAS”, con el préstamo de S/.800.00, que cancelará en un plazo de 06 meses comprará productos para incrementar su stock y pueda realizar ventas al crédito. La Señora Miriam sueña con construir su casa.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products (Compra de productos de belleza.)

loans.name: Lamp Fall Couture Group

texts.fr:
Lamp Fall couture specializes in men’s, women’s, and children’s clothing.  It makes ready-to-wear clothing and also custom-made clothing.  The fight against under-employment creates other difficulties, such as illegal immigration and juvenile delinquency.  It is to avoid these problems that the group invested itself in this business.  We are asking for a loan from Kiva that will allow us to purchase a variety of fabrics (bazin, batik, linen, Givenchy), which we will tailor and sell in fairs or according to orders.  

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva volunteer. 

Lamp Fall couture est spécialisé dans la couture hommes, dames et enfants. Il fait du prêt à porter et de la couture sur mesure. C’est pour lutter contre le sous-emploi qui crée d’autres difficultés comme l’immigration clandestine, la délinquance juvénile que le groupement s'est investi dans cette activité. Nous sollicitons un prêt de kiva qui nous permettra d'acheter beaucoup de variétés de tissus (bazin, batik, lin, Givenchy) que nous allons coudre et vendre par exposition ou selon les commandes qui ne seront faites

loans.use: Purchase materials (fabrics) to tailor and sell

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Señora María Elena is single and is 54 years old. She studied through the third cycle of social work. She lives in the neighborhood of Víctor Larco de la Provincia de Trujillo, La Libertad. Currently she provides typing services from her house. She already owns a computer that she got at a good price through a police auction. The first loan that she got was for S/.300.00, with which she bought paper and ink. A little while after she got her loan she had difficulties with her computer, which hindered kept her from completing her work. She had to find money in order to get her equipment working and to continue working. She belongs to the Community Bank "Las Palmeras." With this loan of S/.1200.00, that she will repay in 6 months, she is thinking of investing in paper, 2 ink catridges, and to do maintinence on her machine. Señora María Elena says that she wanted to finish her studies but she gave them up due to lack of help. But now she is working with lots of persistence and enthusiasm in her current work. She dreams of buying another computer and also a photocopy machine in order to give better service to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora María Elena es soltera, tiene 54 años, estudió hasta III ciclo de asistencia social; vive en el distrito de Víctor Larco de la Provincia de Trujillo, La Libertad. Actualmente se dedica a dar servicios de tipeos en su propia casa ya que cuenta con una computadora que adquirió a buen precio y con facilidades en el bazar de la policía. El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00, con los cuales compró papel y tinta. Al poco tiempo de recibir su crédito tuvo dificultades con su computador, el cual se malogró y le impidió realizar su trabajo, tuvo que conseguir un dinero para repotenciar el equipo y continuar trabajando Pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS PALMERAS”, con el préstamo de S/.1200.00, que cancelará en 06 meses; tiene pensado invertir en la compra de papel, 02 tintas y darle mantenimiento a la máquina. La señora María Elena dice que le hubiera gustado terminar sus estudios pero los abandonó por falta de apoyo pero aún así trabaja con mucho empeño y entusiasmo en su actual negocio. Sueña con comprar otro computador y también una maquina fotocopiadora para brindar mejor servicio a sus clientes.

loans.use: To buy materials (paper and ink).  PC maintinence .

loans.name: Lucero De La Mañana Group

texts.en:
Yocelyne J. is an ambitious young woman from Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic. She is 25 years old and lives with her husband and their three children. She will use this loan money to purchase new pants, blouses, shoes, and cosmetics from the nearby city of Santiago. Then, she will go on to sell the purchased goods in a local flea market. She hopes that her business will continue to thrive and aspires to own her personal business in the future.

Yocelyne J. is part of a 10-person micro-bank, Lucero de la Mañana, which means "Morning Star". Each woman has her own personal business but all of them unite to pay their loan as a group. The purpose of the group loan is to assist each other in case someone defaults. The Kiva loans will be divided among the group to pay back.

We thank you for your support on behalf of Yocelyne, the Paz and Amor group, and the entire team at Esperanza International.

loans.use: Purchase new pants, blouses, shoes, and cosmetics to be sold in the local flea market.

loans.name: Heriberto

texts.es:
Mr. Heriberto O. has spent several years in the business of agriculture where he grows basic grains and coffee and stands out as a small producer in the town of Condega where he resides.

It is important to stress that he is a man whose responsibility is to provide for his family by giving them all that is necessary for their development. Despite the many difficulties he has faced, he has managed to succeed thanks to the support provided by Ceprodel which has provided him with loans that he's been able to use in order to improve his farm's crops. Once again he has gone to Ceprodel and applied for a loan with which to improve his business through the purchase of a solar panel/module, which in turn will assist him with the growing of basic grains.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Heriberto C. O. se dedica desde hace varios años al negocio de agricultura cultivando granos básicos y café destacándose como pequeño productor en el municipio de Condega donde reside.

Es de importancia destacar que es un caballero con la responsabilidad de mantener su familia brindándole las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo. A pesar de las múltiples dificultades que ha atravesado, ha logrado salir adelante gracias al apoyo brindado por Ceprodel el cual le ha otorgado créditos que los ha utilizado para mejorar su actividad de agricultura. Una vez más acude a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito con el cual mejorar su actividad por medio de la compra de un modulo solar e inversión en la siembra de los granos básicos.

loans.use: Purchase of a solar panel / module to aid in the cultivation of grain. (Compra de un modulo solar para los cultivos)

loans.name: Cecilia Armida

texts.es:
Señorita Cecilia is 57 years old. She finished college, and lives in the neighborhood of Víctor Larco Provincia de Trujillo, La Libertad. At the end of her studies, she took up teaching but had to have an operation for a tumor in her throat, and had to leave her job. Because of this she began selling food, an activity that helped her cover her expenses. She currently works preparing food and selling breakfast in the morning and food at night. In the middle of the day, she makes refreshments for children in the twelve pre-schools that operate in the neighborhood of Victor Larco. On the weekends she caters food for parties as ordered by her clients. She is the secretary of the Community Bank "Las Palmeras." In this bank she recieved her first loan of S/.300.00 with which she bought rice, oil, and vermicelli noodles. With this loan of S/.1,300.00 that she will repay over a period of 6 months she will buy tables, chairs, and non-perishable snacks. In the near future, she wants to improve her house and improve the ambiance of the location where she sells her food.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

La señorita Cecilia tiene 57 años de edad, estudió educación superior completa; vive en el distrito de Víctor Larco Provincia de Trujillo, La Libertad. Al terminar sus estudios se dedicó a la docencia pero al ser operada de un tumor en la garganta tuvo que dejar el trabajo por eso es que se dedicó a la venta de comida, actividad que le ayudó a cubrir sus gastos. Actualmente se dedica a preparar comida y vender desayuno por las mañanas y comida por las noches ya que al medio día colabora con la preparación de los refrigerios para los niños de los doce wawa huasis que funcionan en el Distrito de Victor Larco; los fines de semana prepara comida para atender agasajos según pedido de sus clientes Es secretaria del Banco Comunal “LAS PALMERAS” en este banco recibió su primer préstamo de S/.300.00 con los cuales compró arroz, aceite y fideos. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,300.00 que cancelará en un plazo de 06 meses comprará mesas, sillas y alimentos no perecibles. En un plazo no muy largo quiere mejorar su casa y el ambiente donde vende la comida para mejorar la apariencia.

loans.use: To buy chairs, tables, and ingredients

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
Señora Rosa María is married and 51 years old. She studied until the third year of high school. She has 7 children, 5 living in Lima and 2 who are students. She lives in the neighborhood of Víctor Larco Provincia de Trujillo, La Libertad. She is a businesswoman that works in the preparation of fast food for university students. She has also started to work raising animals. Her friend motivated her to join Manuela Ramos. The first loan she recieved was for S/.300.00, which she invested to buy a blender and also to travel to Lima because her son passed away. She belongs to the Community Bank of "Las Palmeras." With this loan of S/.800.00 that she will repay over 6 months she will buy food for her animals and also rice, oil, and beans. Her other dream is to have a restaurant in an appropriate location, to buy a television, and to build her savings.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosa María está casada, tiene 51 años, estudió hasta 3er año de secundaria y tiene 07 hijos, 05 trabajan en Lima y 02 son estudiantes; vive en el distrito de Víctor Larco Provincia de Trujillo, La Libertad. La empresaria, se dedica a la preparación de comida rápida, para los estudiantes de la universidad y también empezó a dedicarse a la crianza de animales. Su amiga la animó a participar en Manuela Ramos, el primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00, invertido en la compra de una licuadora, y tuvo que viajar a Lima porque su hijo había fallecido. Pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS PALMERAS”. Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00 que cancelará en un plazo de 06 meses, comprará alimento para los animales y también arroz, aceite, menestras. La socia sueña con tener un restaurant en un sitio apropiado, comprar un televisor y seguir ahorrando.

loans.use: To buy better ingredients and to by food for animals.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Silvia Argentina

texts.es:
Ms. Silvia Argentina L. Zavalai is 56 years of age, unmarried, and has no younger children. All her children are married, but she provides them support with what she can. Ms. Silvia has owned a general store for more than 15 years, with which she has sustained household expenses and helped her children.

Silvia is requesting funding to invest more in her small general store to offer a variety of products and retain customers. Her business is located at her home, and it began as an alternative mode of employment and way of life. She had no other income than her husband, and upon their separation, she had to move forward to support her children. Her business offers a variety of household products, such as rice, sugar, oil, gas, jewelry, chicken, and other products.

Her desire is to gradually improve her residence and the conditions of her business, as they do not currently have enough space for their general market.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Silvia Argentina L. Z., tiene 56 años de edad, es soltera, no tiene hijos menores de edad, todos sus hijos ya estan casados, pero le apoyan en lo que puede. Doña silvia tiene mas de 15 años de tener una pequeña pulpería con la cual ha sustentado los gastos del hogar y ayudar a sus hijos.

Doña Silvia, Solicita financiamiento para poder invertirle mas a su pequeña pulpería de esta manera ofertar una diversidad de productos y mantener la clientela, dicho negocio lo tiene ubicado en su domicilio, su negocio da inicio como una alternativa de empleo y modo de subsistencia ya que no tenia otros ingresos que los de su esposo, pero al separarse tuvo que buscar como salir adelante y apoyar a sus hijos, en su negocio ofrece una variedad de productos del hogar como arroz, azucar , aceite , gaseos, bisuteria en general, pollo entre otros productos.

Su deseo es poder mejorar su casa de habitación poco a poco y tener un poco mas de condicones en su negocio ya que no tiene suficiente espacio para tener su pulperia.

loans.use: For investment in a general market

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.en:
Maria has raised pigs at her house for four years. She buys them when they are small, takes care of them and feeds them. She later sells them in the local market or sometimes people come to her house seeking her pigs. In her free time, she weaves traditional cloth by hand, which she also sells in the market and are sought after for their quality. Maria has two small children. Her husband actually doesn't live in Guatemala right now, as he is working in the United States, which helps out economically. Maria is requesting this loan to invest further in her business of raising pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Montgomery, Kiva Fellow.

La señora Maria del Rosario T. tiene un negocio de crianza de cerdos desde hace 4 años en casa, ella compra los cerdos pequeños, los cuida y alimenta y luego los vende en el mercado de la localidad o algunas personas la buscan en su casa. En sus tiempos libres ella se dedica a hacer tejidos típicos a mano los cuales vende en el mercado y son muy solicitados por su calidad. Ella tiene 2 hijos pequeños, su esposo actualmente no vive en Guatemala, trabaja en los Estados Unidos de Norteamérica, y le ayuda un poco económicamente. Este préstamo ella lo necesita para invertir más en la crianza de los cerdos.

loans.use: To buy more pigs and food (para comprar mas cerdos y comida para ellos)

loans.name: Griselda Del Carmen

texts.en:
Griselda operates a business selling used American clothing and is requesting this loan to buy more clothes to sell. She started a business selling gold six years ago. Over time, the business grew and has generated good income, so she wanted more capital to continue negotiating and investing more because she used the income that this generated for basic items for her family.

A friend told her that FAPE helps women micro-entrepreneurs to advance in their businesses and she joined one of FAPE's trust banks, called Alpha and Omega, through which she received a loan that she says helped her a lot. A year ago she opened her American clothing store, which has helped her a lot and sales are good. Right now she has the opportunity to buy very high quality American clothing in bulk, but doesn't currently have the money for it so that is why she is requesting this loan. Griselda is 31 years old and was born in Jocotan Chiquimula, but actually lives in Villa Nueva, near the capital city of Guatemala. Translated from Spanish by Megan Montgomery, Kiva Fellow. Griselda tiene una venta de ropa americana usada y está pidiendo este préstamo para comprar más ropa para vender. Ella inició un negocio vendiendo oro hace 6 años. Con el paso del tiempo, el negocio fue creciendo y ha generado buenas ganancias por lo cual necesitaba capital para seguir negociando e invertir más porque las ganancias que ya generaba las estaban utilizando para cosas de consumo familiar. Una amiga le contó que FAPE ayudaba a las mujeres microempresarias a salir adelante con sus negocios y le integró en un banco de confianza denominado alfa y omega, con el cual adquirió un crédito que dice que le ayudó mucho. Hace un año abrió su venta de ropa americana en la cual le ayudó bastante y vende muy bien. Ahorita ella tiene la oportunidad de comprar una paca (ropa americana a granel) de muy buena calidad, pero no cuenta con el capital para comprarlo y por eso está pidiendo este préstamo individual. Griselda tiene 31 años y nació en Jocotan Chiquimula, pero actualmente vive en Villa Nueva, cerca de la ciudad capital de Guatemala.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing to sell in her business (comprar ropa usada para vender en su negocio)

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa has been making tamales every weekend for 20 years. She learned how to make them from her mother, who also prepared tamales. In the evenings, she sells Creole food outside her home. Besides selling tamales, she's been selling clothes for 5 years. The loan she is requesting is purchase clothes for the orders she's received.

Louisa would like to own her own market stall where she can sell clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Luisa hace tamales todos los fines de semana desde hace 20 años. Ella aprendió esta labor de su madre, quien también preparaba tamales. Asimismo, todas las noches sale a vender comida criolla afuera de su casa. Asimismo, Luisa vende ropa por pedidos desde hace 5 años. Los préstamos que ha recibido le han servido para comprar la ropa que le piden. A ella le gustaría tener un local propio o un puesto en el mercado donde vender ropa.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to meet the demands of her clients. (Para comprar la ropa que le piden.)

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe has had a store in her house for 6 years. She decided to start this business because she had small children, and she needed to stay at home to care for them. She previously helped her husband with his metalworking business.

Guadalupe also sells sweaters and clothing that her mother weaves to her acquaintances. The loans that she has requested have helped her purchase the products that she sells in her store wholesale. They have also helped her mother buy the materials that she needs to weave. She would like to expand her store by buying a copy machine and a freezer.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Guadalupe tiene una bodega en su casa desde hace 6 años. Ella se animó a crear este negocio debido a que tenía hijos pequeños y necesitaba quedarse en casa para cuidarlos. Antes ayudaba a su esposo en el negocio de la metalurgia.

Guadalupe también se dedica a vender a sus conocidos las chompas y ropa tejidas que hace su mamá. Los préstamos que ha pedido le han servido para comprar por mayor los productos que ofrece en la bodega. También le ha servido para que su mamá compre los materiales que necesita en la elaboración de los tejidos. A ella le gustaría poder ampliar su bodega comprándose una fotocopiadora y una congeladora.

loans.use: To purchase the products that she sells in her store wholesale.

loans.name: Noemí

texts.es:
Noemí has sold cosmetics through catalog for 5 years. Her customers are her neighbors and friends. Noemí also offers hair cutting in a small, furnished beauty salon in her home. Her neighbors know and seek her there.

The loans will go towards paying in advance for the cosmetics and a stock of products at home. The loans will also go towards materials in her small beauty salon. Noemí would like to have a bazaar where she can offer her cosmetics or a market stall.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

Noemí se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catálogo desde hace 5 años. Sus clientes son sus vecinos y amistades. Noemí también ofrece el servicio de corte de cabello en su casa. Tiene amoblado un pequeño salón de belleza dentro de su casa. Sus vecinos ya la conocen y la buscan allí.

Los préstamos le han servido para pagar los cosméticos por adelantado y tener un stock de productos en su casa. También le ha servido para los materiales de su pequeño salón de belleza. A Noemí le gustaría tener un bazar donde ofrecer sus cosméticos o un puesto en el mercado.

loans.use: For the advance purchase of cosmetics

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa sells cosmetics per catalogue since three years. She worked selling food but she stopped because she was not earning enough. Rosa also sells clothes upon request; her clients are her neighbors and family.

She has used the loans she has received to buy cosmetics. One day she would also like to have a restaurant in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa vende cosméticos por catálogo desde hace 3 años. Ella trabajaba vendiendo comida, pero dejó el negocio debido a que no le resultó rentable. Rosa también vende ropa por pedidos. Sus clientes son sus vecinos y familiares. Los préstamos que ha solicitado le han servido para tener un stock de cosméticos en su casa. A ella le gustaría tener un restaurante en su casa.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics

loans.name: Jesús María

texts.es:
Señora Jesús María is married and 55 years old. She has completed high school and has 4 children who work in the city of Trujillo. She lives in the neighborhood of Víctor Larco Provincia D. Trujillo, La Libertad. She is a business woman dedicated to making jewelry, crafts from corrospun, and costume jewelry. Her daughters help her sell the goods and to fulfill orders from Spain. She decided to work with Manuela Ramos because they would give her working capital. The first loan that she recieved was for S/.300.00, which she invested in the purchase of materials, paint, etc. She belongs to the Community Bank "Las Palmeras." With this loan of S/.900.00, that she will repay in a period of 6 months, she will buy materials in order to make jewelry. Her goals are to buy a display cabinet to display her goods, to improve the business, and to fix her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Jesús María, está casada, tiene 55 años, estudió secundaria completa y tiene 04 hijos, los cuales trabajan en la ciudad D. Trujillo; vive en el distrito D. Víctor Larco Provincia D. Trujillo, La Libertad. La empresaria se dedica a hacer manualidades en corrospun, joyas, bisutería, sus hijas la ayudan a vender y D. igual manera atienD. pedidos D. España. Decidió trabajar en Manuela Ramos porque dan facilidades para trabajar el dinero, el primer préstamo que recibió fue D. S/.300.00, invertido en la compra D. material, pintura, etc. Pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS PALMERAS”. Con el préstamo D. S/. 900.00, que cancelará en un plazo D. 06 meses, comprará material para hacer alhajas. Tiene como meta, comprar una vitrina para exponer sus manualidades, implementar mejor el negocio y arreglar su casa.

loans.use: To buy materials to improve her jewelry and crafts store

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
He was encouraged to enter the business of renting because his house was too big for him alone. José has also been involved in construction for 15 years.

He is asking for a loan to finish building the apartment that he rents and put in a door. He would like to build another apartment on the third floor of his house and rent it out as well.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

José alquila un departamento que construyó en el segundo piso de su casa desde hace 5 años. Él se animó a incursionar en el negocio del alquilar debido a que su casa era muy grande para él solo. José también se dedica a la construcción obrera desde hace 15 años.

Los préstamos que ha pedido le han servido para acabar de construir el departamento que alquila y colocarle una puerta. A él le gustaría construir otro departamento en el tercer piso de su casa y darlo en alquiler.

loans.use: To complete construction of an apartment

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes has been selling wooden furniture out of her home for the past year. She encouraged herself to take on this business because a relative makes the furniture, like wardrobes, beds, dressers, etc. She also has made a living the past four years selling shoes and sheets via order. Her clients are friends and neighbors. The loans she has received have helped her pay for the furniture she offers and purchase the merchandise that she sells via orders. Mercedes would like to have a large store where she could sell her furniture.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

Mercedes vende muebles de madera en su casa desde hace 1 año. Ella se animó a incursionar en este negocio debido a que un familiar fabrica esto muebles, como roperos, camas, cómodas, etc. Ella también se dedica a la venta de zapatos y sábanas por pedidos desde hace 4 años. Sus clientes son sus conocidos y vecinos. Los préstamos que ha recibido le han servido para pagar los muebles que ofrece y para comprar la mercadería que vende por pedidos. A Mercedes le gustaría tener un local grande donde vender los muebles que ofrece.

loans.use: Pay for the furniture she offers and purchase the merchandise that she sells via orders / Para pagar los muebles que ofrece en su casa y para comprar la mercadería que vende por pedidos.

loans.name: Rosa Milagritos

texts.es:
Ms. Rosa Milagritos is unmarried, 42 years of age, studying education and intends to complete her degree. She lives with her parents in the district of Victor Larco Province de Trujillo, La Libertad.

The entrepreneur has a telephone booth at home and is working on a Wawasi (child care). She has the function of being a mother caregiver. She decided to contact Manuela Ramos for the benefits, received a loan which she invested in painting and fixing the telephone booth.

She belongs to the Communal Bank “Las Palmeras”. With this loan of $375 which she will repay within 6 months, she intends to purchase another phone line to improve the service offered to her customers. Thanks to her efforts, she succeeded in becoming independent, and she now shares the profit with her parents.

Her goal is to have a kindergarten, to settle in, and to continue to invest in her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

La señorita Rosa Milagritos es soltera, tiene 42 años, estudia educación inicial y piensa terminar la carrera. Vive con sus padres en el distrito de Víctor Larco Provincia de Trujillo, La Libertad.

La empresaria tiene un locutorio en su casa y trabaja en un Wawasi (cuidado de niños), tiene la función de ser madre cuidadora. Decidió ingresar a Manuela Ramos por los beneficios, recibió un préstamo de S/. 300.00, invertido en el locutorio, pintar el local y arreglarlo.

Pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS PALMERAS”. Con el préstamos de S/. 1,000.00, que cancelará en un plazo de 06 meses; tiene pensado adquirir otra línea telefónica para mejorar el servicio que brinda a sus clientes. Gracias a su esfuerzo logró independizarse, superarse y el beneficio ahora lo comparte con sus padres.

Tiene como meta, tener un jardín de niños, ambientarlo y seguir invirtiendo en sus estudios.

loans.use: To purchase a telephone line

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana sells cosmetics per catalogue since four years. Rosa also sells clothes upon request; her clients are mostly her neighbors.

She has used the loans she has received to buy cosmetics and clothes. One day she would also like to have a store and sell clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Liliana vende cosméticos por catálogo desde hace 4 años. Ella también se dedica a la venta de ropa por pedidos que sus vecinos le hacen. Los préstamos que ha recibido le han servido para pagar los cosméticos y la ropa que ofrece. A ella le gustaría tener una tienda y vender ropa.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and clothes

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria Elena Z. N. is a 29 year old single mother. She completed her studies through high school. She has one young daughter who is studying in primary school. She lives in the district of Victor Larco in Trujilo, La Libertad. She and her former husband had started a business printing t-shirts. A friend invited her to join the Communal Bank LAS PALMERAS from which she received her first loan for 300 Soles. She invested this money to purchase paints. Later she had problems with her husband and when they separated she decided to go into another business. Now she sells household goods from a small store run out of her home. She also participates in the local milk consortium in her neighborhood. With a loan for 800 Soles, to be repaid within 6 months, she plans to add stock to her store and to pay her daughters tuition. Her goal is to open a minimart to earn enough to support her daughter since she doesn’t have any support from her ex-husband. In spite of her problems she is happy because she is managing to improve her life.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

La señora María Elena Z. N., es madre soltera, tiene 29 años, estudió secundaria completa, tiene 01 hija menor de edad que está estudiando el nivel primario; vive en el distrito de Víctor Larco Provincia de Trujillo, La Libertad. Al comienzo la socia y su esposo se dedicaban a los estampados de polos. Por la invitación de una amiga ingresa al Banco Comunal “LAS PALMERAS” en este banco comunal recibió su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 este dinero fue invertido en la compra de pinturas, luego tuvo problemas con su esposo y al separarse decidió cambiar de negocio; ahora se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en una pequeña tienda ubicada en su casa. También participa en el vaso de leche de su barrio. Con el préstamo de S/. 800.00 que cancelará en un plazo de 06 meses, tiene pensado surtir la bodega y pagar la movilidad de su hija. Tiene como meta, tener un minimarket para poder ayudar a su hija, ya que no tiene el apoyo de su esposo, pero a pesar de los problemas ella se siente contenta porque está logrando salir adelante.

loans.use: To purchase supply of household goods for resale.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Racquel has run a restaurant out of her home for the past two years. She had a bar for more than 30 years, however due to an armed assault she had to give up the business since her physical integrity was in danger. Now she sells meals, juices and desserts every day at her restaurant, open from 11:30 a.m. to 6 p.m. She also rents the second the floor of her home. The loans that she has received have helped her purchase at wholesale the ingredients she needs to make her meals. Raquel would like to expand her business and offer chicken soup in the evenings.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

Raquel tiene un restaurante en su casa desde hace 2 años. Ella ha tenido un bar por más de 30 años, sin embargo, debido a un asalto a mano armada tuvo que dejar este negocio, ya que su integridad física estuvo en peligro. Ahora ella vende menues, jugos y postres en su restaurante todos los días. Abre a las 11.30 del día y cierra a las 6 de la tarde. Ella también alquila el segundo piso de su casa. Los préstamos que ha recibido le han servido para comprar por mayor los ingredientes que necesita para elaborar sus menues. A Raquel le gustaría ampliar su negocio y ofrecer caldo de gallina por las noches.

loans.use: Purchase at wholesale the ingredients she needs to make her meals / Para comprar por mayor los ingredientes que necesita para elaborar sus menues.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes has made a living by delivering lunches the past four years. It was her brother who encouraged her to prepare meals and deliver them. He helps her load the food containers. Mercedes had previously worked for a company. The loans she has received have helped her purchase the utensils necessary to deliver her meals. Mercedes would like to rent a place and set up a bookstore with her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

Mercedes se dedica al reparto de almuerzos desde hace 4 años. Fue su hermano quien le animó a preparar comida y repartirla. Él la ayuda a cargar los envases de comida. Mercedes antes trabajaba en una empresa. Los préstamos que he recibido le han servido para comprar los utensilios que necesita para repartir los almuerzos. A ella le gustaría alquilar un local con su hija y poner una librería.

loans.use: Purchase the utensils needed to deliver the lunches she offers / Para comprar los utensilios que necesita para repartir los almuerzos que ofrece.

loans.name: Nely

texts.es:
Nelly has been dedicated to selling clothes via order for the past five years. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. Previously she had a stock of products in her home, but due to economic problems she now only takes part in the purchase and immediate delivery of the items. For the past six years she has also participated in neighborhood committees. The loans she has requested have helped her with the purchase of the clothing she offers. Nelly would like to have a post in the market where she could sell clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

Nelly se dedica a la venta de ropa por pedidos desde hace 5 años. Sus clientes son sus conocidos y vecinos. Antes ella tenía stock de productos en su casa, pero por problemas económicos, solo se dedica a la compra y reparto inmediato. Desde hace 6 años, ella también participa en la directiva del comité del vaso de leche de su barrio Los préstamos que ha solicitado le han servido para comprar la ropa que ofrece. A Nelly le gustaría tener un puesto en el mercado donde vender ropa.

loans.use: Purchase the clothing she offers via orders / Para comprar la ropa que ofrece por pedidos.

loans.name: Angela Presciliana

texts.es:
Angela Presciliana is married, 48 years old and studied through the 2nd year of high school. She has 4 children. Two are independent, working in Lima. The other two are students, one in primary school, the other in secondary. She lives in the disctrict of Moche in Trujillo, La Libertad. She runs a small restaurant out of her home where she sells smoked fish and roasted goat. Her cousin invited her to join the Grupo Mientras Tanto LUIS ALBERTO SANCHEZ. With her first loan for 300 Sols she purchased kitchen equipment, ladles and sauce pans used to prepare her various dishes. Her business employs a few workers from Moche who run the kitchens. She also fills special orders for parties. With a loan for 500 Soles she plans to purchase rice, sauces and cooking oil to support her business. Her goals are to improve her home, educate her children and to someday open another restaurant in Moche.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

La señora Ángela Presciliana etá casada, tiene 48 años y estudió hasta 2do año de secundaria, tiene 04 hijos, 02 son independientes, trabajan en Lima y 02 son estudiantes del nivel primario y secundario respectivamente. En su casa, en el distrito de Moche en la provincia de Trujillo del Departamento de La Libertad, tiene un pequeño restaurant, en el cual empezó a vender sudado de pescado y cabrito. Su sobrina la invitó a participar en el Grupo Mientras Tando “LUIS ALBERTO SANCHEZ”, y con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 que recibió, compró cucharones, un par de ollas, etc. lo cual usa para preparar comidas variadas. A su negocio acuden algunos trabajadores del Municipio de Moche y los que laboran en la chacra. También atiende pedidos para celebraciones. Con el préstamo de S/. 500.00, tiene pensado comprar arroz, menestras, aceite para el negocio. Tiene como meta, mejorar su casa, educar a sus hijos y llegar a tener otro restaurant en Moche.

loans.use: To purchase wholesale supplies

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda was working in her mother's restaurant for three years, but during the business' slow season she decided to look for a side job. Now she serves as an in-home babysitter. She works from 7 in the morning until 7 at night. The loans she has received have let her help her mother with the restaurant, and she would do the same with the current one she is requesting. Nilda would like for the restaurant to have a soda fountain.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

Nilda trabajaba en el restaurante de su mamá por 3 años, pero debido a la temporada baja del negocio, ella decidió buscar un trabajo aparte y ahora se desempeña cuidando niños en una casa. Trabaja desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche. Los préstamos que ha recibido le han servido para ayudar a su mamá en el negocio que ella tiene. A Nilda le gustaría tener una fuente de soda.

loans.use: Help with her mother's restaurant / Para ayudar a su mamá en el restaurante que ella tiene.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Efraín studied cutting and sewing and from this decided to set up a tailor shop in his home two years ago. He makes jackets, sweaters and polo shirts and sells them at the local markets and to friends, who also give him special orders. His sisters help him sell his products on the weekends. Efraín is also a master construction worker and dedicates himself to this trade along with his tailoring. The loans he has received have helped him purchase the supplies needed to make his products, and the one he is currently requesting will be used for the same purpose. He would like to be done with his construction work and enlarge his shop so he can focus his efforts on solely tailoring.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

Efraín estudió corte y confección, por ese motivo, hace 2 años decidió poner un taller de confecciones en su casa. Él hace casacas, buzos y polos que reparte la ropa en mercados y a amistades que le encargan pedidos específicos. Sus hermanas le ayudan a vender los fines de semana. Efraín también es maestro constructor, por lo que también se dedica a esta actividad en paralelo. Los préstamos que ha recibido le han servido para comprar la materia prima que necesita para sus confecciones. Él quisiera dejar la construcción y ampliar su taller de confecciones para dedicarse íntegro a eso.

loans.use: Purchase supplies needed to make articles of clothing / Para comprar la materia prima que necesita para sus confecciones.

loans.name: Martha Elizabeth

texts.es:
Martha Elizabeth H. L. is a 39 year old single mother. She completed her studies through high school. She has 2 children, one in primary school, the other in high school. They live in the District of Moche in Trujillo, La Libertad. Since her husband abandoned her she has had to support herself financially. She decided to participate in the Grupo Mientras Tanto SANTA LUCIA. She received her first loan for 300 Soles which she invested in the purchase of a sewing machine and began her small business doing alternations and making costumes. With a loan for 500 Soles, to be repaid within 4 payments, she plans to purchase fabric to increase her production of costumes. Thanks to her perseverance and effort she has a large number of customers. She dreams of remodeling her house to have a sewing room and space to sell school uniforms, dresses, etc, and to study fashion design.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

La señora Martha Elizabeth H. L., es madre soltera, tiene 39 años, estudió secundaria completa, tiene 02 hijos, son estudiantes del nivel primario y secundario respectivamente, vive en el Distrito de Moche en la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad. Debido al abandono del esposo, tuvo que ayudarse económicamente. Decidió participar en el Grupo Mientras Tanto “SANTA LUCIA”, recibió un préstamo de S/. 300.00, invertido en la compra de una máquina para coser y empezó en el mundo del negocio, arreglando pantalones y elaborando disfraces. Con el préstamo de S/. 500.00, que será cancelado en 4 cuotas, tiene pensado comprar tela para incrementar la cantidad de disfraces. Gracias a su perseverancia y esfuerzo tiene una gran afluencia de clientes. La socia sueña con remodelar su casa, tener un taller de costura para vender uniformes de colegios, buzos, al por mayor y estudiar alta costura.

loans.use: Compra de tela al por mayor.

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es:
Fanny used to bake and sell her desserts 2 years ago. She even sold desserts in schools. She used to have a distribution menu, but due to economic reasons she had to quit.

This loan will be used to purchase wholesale ingredients needed to make her desserts for sale again. Fanny would also like to rent a room and put in a fountain soda business.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Fanny se dedica a la venta de postres y dulces por reparto desde hace 2 años. Antes preparaba y repartía menú, pero por problemas económicos tuvo que dejarlo. También ha vendido golosinas en colegios. Los préstamos le han servido para comprar por mayor los ingredientes que necesita en la preparación de sus postres. Fanny quisiera alquilar un local y poner una fuente de soda.

loans.use: Loan will be used to purchase ingredients needed for her desserts. (Para comprar por mayor los ingredientes que necesita en la preparación de sus postres.)

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
Maria Esperanza is 46 years old and married. She studied through high school and supports 5 children, 2 of which are working while the other 3 are still students. She lives in the district of Salaverry in the Province of Trujillo, La Libertad. When she was studying high school she learned how to make purses. When she finished her studies she dedicated herself to this small business which she started thanks to a small amount of money she had saved. Later her friends encouraged her to participate in the Communal Bank “LAS EMPRENDEDORAS”. With her first loan of 200 S. she purchased buckles, closures and other supplies to invest in her business. With a new loan for 1,700 S., to be repaid within 6 months, she will purchase decorative ribbons to make shirts and other hand sewn products for some children’s playcenters. She currently acts as Secretary of her Communal Bank and she is very happy to work with the other members. One of her goals is for her younger children to become professionals since her older children never had the opportunity to complete their studies.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

La señora María Esther tiene 46 años, está casada, estudió la carrera D. Contabilidad, no la ejerce porque tenía que cuidar a sus hijos pequeños, tiene 03 hijos y son estudiantes. Vive en el Distrito D. Moche en la Provincia D. Trujillo en el Departamento D. La Libertad. Para ayudarse económicamente empezó a vender productos cosméticos D. AVON, EBEL. Luego se animó a vender cerveza al por menor y también participa en ferias vendiendo bordados, tejidos. Una amiG. la invitó a participar en el Banco Comunal “VIRGEN D. FATIMA”, y decidió pertenecer a Manuela Ramos porque tenía la oportunidad D. salir adelante. Con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00, compró productos cosméticos para tener un stock disponible y poder colocar los productos al crédito. Con el préstamo D. S/. 1200.00 que cancelará en un plazo D. 06 meses comprará cerveza para incrementar la ganancia. La socia colabora con el ingreso familiar, piensa en remodelar el baño D. su casa y también aprender a elaborar pan y ha administrar una panadería porque sueña con tener una.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products for resale

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Since 6 years, Carmen sells tennis shoes in a shopping mall. Her nephew got her into the business because he already had two selling spots at the mall; now Carmen sells in one of them.

She works from 8am until 10pm. She has used the loans she received to buy more merchandise. Now, she would like to have her own selling spot at the mall.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 6 años, Carmen trabaja vendiendo zapatillas en un centro comercial. Su sobrino la animó a participar de este negocio, debido a que él tiene dos puestos de ventas. Ella vende en una de esos puestos. Trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. Los préstamos le han servido para invertir en la compra de las zapatillas. A ella le gustaría tener su propio puesto de venta de zapatillas.

loans.use: To buy more tennis shoes

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia has cleaned and painted leather jackets for 6 years. She learned to do this by working in a sewing shop and then in a shop for painting jackets. Presently, she has become independent and has started her own shop in her house. Antonia has the jackets sent to the shop where she learned, and from there they send her the jackets so she can paint them.

The loans that she has requested have helped her expand the small shop she has in her house. She would like to grow her business and to learn new techniques in working with leather.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Antonia limpia y pinta casacas de cuero desde hace 6 años. Ella empezó trabajando en un taller de costura y luego en un taller de pintado de casacas, fue así que aprendió esta labor. Actualmente, ella se ha independizado y ha creado su propio taller en su casa. A Antonia le recepcionan las casacas en el taller donde aprendió, y desde allí le mandan las casacas para que ella los pinte. Los préstamos que ha solicitado le han servido para ampliar el pequeño taller que tiene en su casa. A ella le gustaría incrementar su negocio y aprender nuevas técnicas sobre el trabajo en cueros.

loans.use: To expand the small shop that she has in her house.

loans.name: Zulma Diana

texts.es:
Zulma Diana V. D. Zavaleta is married, 30 years of age. She completed secondary school but did not continue her studies after she married. She has 2 young children, both of school age. She used to sell food in the market, but after a short while they left. She was left with nothing and wanted desperately to restart her business. This is why she accepted her friend's invitation to join the Banco Comunal “LAS EMPRENDEDORAS“, and with the first loan of S/. 300.00, she started her business selling groceries from home, in the Salaverry district in Trujillo, in the La Libertad department. With this money she bought vegetables, chicken, potatoes, peppers, etc. With the loan of S/. 1,000.00, which she will pay back in 6 installments, she wants to invest in buying rice, sugar, oil and condiments. This member wants to continue working in order to educate her children and have a stocked grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

La señora Zulma Diana V. D. Zavaleta, está casada, tiene 30 años, estudió secundaria completa, no continuó estudiando porque se casó, tiene 02 hijos pequeños estudiantes del nivel primaria. Anteriormente vendía comida en el mercado como ambulante, pero al poco tiempo la desalojaron del lugar, se quedó sin nada y quería retomar su negocio por eso es que aceptó la invitación D. una amiga para participar en el Banco Comunal “LAS EMPRENDEDORAS“, y con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 que recibió inició su negocio D. venta D. abarrotes en su casa ubicada en el Distrito D. Salaverry en la Provincia D. Trujillo en el Departamento D. La Libertad. Con este dinero compró verdura, pollo, papa, ají, etc. Con el préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, piensa invertir en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, aceite, condimentos. La socia piensa seguir trabajando para educar a sus hijos y sueña con tener una bodega surtida.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys has been selling bottles of wine for the past six months. She brings them from the province every month. Additionally she has also been selling cheese for the past six months, after a friend encouraged her to try it out.

The loans she has received have helped her build her house and as capital for her business. She would like to eventually have a liquor store at her house.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer

Gladys vende botellas de vino desde hace 6 años. Ella misma se encarga de traerlos desde provincia todos los meses. Asimismo, ella también vende quesos por pedidos desde hace 6 meses. Una amiga le animó a incursionar en este negocio. Los préstamos que ha recibido le han servido para construir su casa y como capital para su negocio. A Gladys le gustaría tener una licorería en su casa.

loans.use: To invest in her business and build her house.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda has sold food in the market for 2 years. A friend used to sell food but she had to retire from the business and she passed her stand along to Hilda. She's also sold clothing. However, she has now left the business because of the birth of her child.

The loans that she's received have been used to fund the food business. Hilda would like to go back to selling clothes but she needs capital to do so.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Hilda vende comida en el mercado desde hace 2 años. Una amiga vendía comida, pero ella tuvo que retirarse D. negocio, por lo que le dejó a Hilda el puesto de comida. También ha vendido ropa por pedidos. Sin embargo, Hilda por ahora ha dejado el negocio, debido a que ha dado a luz a su hijo.

Los préstamos que ha recibido le han servido como capital para el negocio de la venta de comida. A ella le gustaría volver a vender ropa por pedidos, pero necesita el capital necesario.

loans.use: Invest in food business.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria's husband has a business where he offers data entry services, copies and copies of CDs and DVDs. She helps her husband by making the copies of the Cds and DVDs. She used to have an internet café three years ago. Unfortunately she was the victim of a theft and her business failed. Additionally, she helps her daughter in law sell cosmetics via catalog.

The loans have helped her purchase a printer for her business. She would actually like to set up a printing workshop since there is no competition in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer

El esposo de María tiene una computadora donde ofrece servicios de tipeo, impresiones y copiado de CDs y DVDs. Ella le apoya a su esposo en el copiado de los CDs y DVDs. Hace tres años, ella tenía unas cabinas de Internet en un local propio, sin embargo, fue víctima de un robo, por lo que el negocio fracasó. Igualmente, ella le ayuda a su nuera en la venta de cosméticos por catálogo. Los préstamos le han servido para comprar una impresora para su negocio. A María le gustaría poner una imprenta en su local, ya que no hay competencia por la zona.

loans.use: To purchase a printer for her business.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
Jose has been a carpenter for 20 years. He has worked for other carpenters in their shops, but he decided 5 years ago to strike out on his own by opening his own shop. He makes all kinds of furniture. His wife helps him with the carpentry. He also operates a car-parking business at his house.

The loans that he's received have been used for working capital. Jose wants to continue working a couple of years, improve his house so that he can rent it out and go live abroad.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

José se dedica a la carpintería desde hace 20 años. Ha trabajado en talleres de otras personas, sin embargo, hace 5 años decidió independizarse por lo que abrió su propio taller en su casa. Él elabora toda clase de muebles. Su esposa lo ayuda en las labores de carpintería. Igualmente, también da servicio de cochera en su casa.

Los préstamos que ha recibido le han servido como capital de trabajo. José quiere seguir trabajando un par de años, mejorar su casa para poder alquilarla e irse a vivir al extranjero.

loans.use: Buy materials for carpentry business.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es:
Esmeralda has been selling beer out of her house for the past two years. She also attended cooking school and had been preparing desserts for past three years. However, she had to put this activity on hold because she works everyday as a chef in a restaurant.

The loans have helped expand her beer business. She purchased a freezer and was able to finish paying it off.

Esmeralda would like to have a glass display case with desserts outside of her house. She would have her sister tend it while she works.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer

Esmeralda vende cerveza en su casa desde hace 2 años. Asimismo, ella estudió gastronomía, por lo que se dedica a preparar postres desde hace 3 años. Sin embargo, ha dejado por el momento esta actividad, debido a que trabaja todos los días en un restaurante como chef. Los préstamos le han servido para incrementar su negocio de venta de cerveza. Asimismo ella se compró una congeladora, por lo que le ha servido para terminar de pagarla. A Esmeralda le gustaría tener una vitrina con postres afuera de su casa y dejarle a su hermana el negocio, mientras ella trabaja.

loans.use: To expand her beer business.

loans.name: Teresa Jesús

texts.es:
Teresa Jesús P. D. C. is divorced, 53 years of age, she studied nutrition and works in Salaverry as head of social programmes. She has 4 children, two who work and 2 who are still studying. She lives in Salaverry, in Trujillo, La Libertad. Apart from working in the area, she also sells cosmetic products. It was her niece who encouraged her with the business, which is going well. She sells products to work colleagues and also relatives. Teresa is a dynamic lady, and despite her busy life, she is involved in the Mothers Club “SANTA ROSA D. LIMA”. Her friend encouraged her to join the Banco Comunal “LAS EMPRENDEDORAS”, and she has been working with Manuela Ramos for three years. With her first loan of S/. 300.00, she bought catalogue offers in order to offer her customers greater variety and make the most of the rewards. With this loan of S/. 800.00, which she will pay back in 6 months, she intends to open a new business selling threads, buttons, fasteners, and silk lace as there is a need for this sort of business in her area. Her aim is to become a great business woman, and her wish is to have a car of her own to get about.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

La señora Teresa Jesús P. D. C., es divorciada, tiene 53 años, estudió nutrición, trabaja en la Municipalidad D. Salaverry tiene el cargo D. jefa D. programas sociales, tiene 04 hijos, 02 trabajan y 02 son estudiantes, vive en el distrito D. Salaverry en la Provincia D. Trujillo en el Departamento D. La Libertad. Aparte D. trabajar en el municipio se dedica también a la venta D. productos cosméticos, fue una sobrina quien la animó a incursionar en este negocio y le va bien, venD. sus productos a compañeras y compañeros D. trabajo y también a sus familiares. La señora Teresa es muy dinámica pese a sus múltiples actividades integra el Club D. Madres “SANTA ROSA D. LIMA” su compañera la animó a participar en el Banco Comunal “LAS EMPRENDEDORAS”, tiene tres años trabajando con Manuela Ramos y con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00, compró las ofertas del catálogo para tener variedad D. productos y aprovechar los premios. Con el préstamo D. S/. 800.00 que cancelará en un plazo D. 06 meses, tiene pensado abrir un nuevo negocio D. venta D. hilos, botones, cierres, blondas ya que un negocio así hace falta en su localidad. Tiene como meta ser una gran empresaria, su anhelo es tener un carro para movilizarse.

loans.use: To purchase threads, buttons, fasteners etc

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Margarita Gaudiosa

texts.es:
Margarita, 65, is divorced. She studied obstetrics but didn't complete her studies because she married and had 4 children who now work in Salaverry. She started her business with the small savings she had, selling fried chicken at her house in Salaverry, in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad. She wanted to expand her business and when a friend encouraged her to consider Manuela Ramos, she joined the "Las Emprendedoras" ("Enterprising Women") community bank.

With a first loan of S/.300 (300 Peruvian soles), she bought potatoes and cooking oil; that's how she was able to sell other dishes. With a S/.1500 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, she will buy cooking oil, pasta, potatoes, chicken and meat because she now makes a wiD. variety of dishes.

Despite her age, Margarita works with great enthusiasm and dreams of traveling and seeing different parts of Peru.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Margarita Gaudiosa tiene 65 años, es divorciada, estudió la carrera D. Obstetricia, pero no culminó sus estudios porque se casó, tiene 04 hijos, los cuales trabajan en Salaverry. La empresaria inició su negocio con un pequeño ahorro que tenía, empezó vendiendo pollo frito en su casa en el Distrito D. Salaverry en la Provincia D. Trujillo en el Departamento D. La libertad, pero la socia quería ampliar su negocio, hasta que un día una amiga la animó a participar en Manuela Ramos y ahora pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS EMPRENDEDORAS”.

Con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00, que recibió compró papa, aceite, y pudo así vender otros platos. Con el préstamo D. S/. 1,500.00 que cancelará en un plazo D. 06 meses, comprará aceite, fideos, papa, pollo y carne ya que actualmente prepara mucha variedad D. platos.

La señora Margarita pese a su edad trabaja con mucho entusiasmo y sueña con viajar y conocer diversos lugares del Perú.

loans.use: Buy supplies for food business.

loans.name: Milagrita Inocenta

texts.en:
Milagrita is a 27-year-old mother of one son and lives in her mother-in-law’s house. Milagrita sells vegetables, pickled vegetables, gelatins, and homemade lollipops. Her business is located in her mother-in-law’s small grocery store. Milagrita works at her business from seven in the morning to two in the afternoon and later does housework. She currently has a project to start selling candy in a small café near a high school.

Milagrita hopes to receive a loan of 900 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (US$ 325) to invest in carrots, tomatoes, onions, cookies, and caramels to further expand her business. Milagrito is a member of Las Entusiastas Village Bank.

Milagrita’s dream is to own her own home, to improve her business, and to provide a good education for her child.

loans.use: to invest in carrots, tomatoes, onions, cookies, and caramels to further expand her business

loans.name: Macedonia

texts.en:
Macedonia is a divorced, 51-year-old mother of six children. Macedonia works with a public institution that plants a variety of trees. In the next few months she will retire and hopes to work in other businesses. Macedonia sells firewood in her house with the help of her younger daughter. She gets her firewood from producers and delivers it to order for different households.

Macedonia needs a loan of 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (US$ 375) to invest in more firewood. Macedonia is a member of Las Entusiastas Village Bank.

Macedonia’s dream is to buy a car to transport her firewood from producers, to have other businesses, and that her children have an established occupation.

loans.use: to invest in more firewood for re-sale

loans.name: Melania

texts.en:
Melania is the married, 43-year-old mother of three children. Melania grows root crops and cereals on her land in the community of Sachabamba, a district of Chiara, located three hours from the city of Ayacucho. Melania plants her crops twice a year, during July for her small farm which she harvests in January and during November which she harvests in July. She sends her crops to the city of Lima and sells them to wholesalers with the help of her son. Furthermore, Melania has a car to transport her goods to the city of Ayacucho.

Melania needs a loan of 2,500 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (US$ 900) to invest in replacement resources and to maintain her car. Melania is a member of Las Entusiastas Bank.

Melania’s dream is to buy a trailer to transport her products and that her younger son finishes school and becomes a professional.

loans.use: to invest in replacement resources and to maintain her car

loans.name: Dina Natividad

texts.en:
Dina is a single, sixty-year-old mother of one son. Dina has been an educator and has already retired. She works as personal assistant for the director of a cosmetic line. Dina sells catalog cosmetics to various friends, family and co-workers. Furthermore, Dina makes beautiful sweaters to order for various clients.

Dina is a member of the Imasumacc Village Bank, meaning “How Beautiful” in Quechua, the native language of Peru. She has been a member for twelve years. She needs a loan of 1,500 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to invest in wool and various cosmetics.

Dina’s dream is to improve her business, to have her own home, and to provide the best for her own mother and her son.

loans.use: to invest in wool and various cosmetics

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a 47-year-old mother of four children. Flora sells gold and silver jewelry which she makes with her nephew. They buy their raw materials from merchants who bring the metals from Puerto Maldonado. Flora uses a jewelry catalog for her clients and they also sketch models that they desire. Her sales are on credit and she is paid twice a week in the afternoons.

Flora is a member of the Imasumacc Village Bank, meaning “How Beautiful” in Quechua, the native language of Peru. She needs a loan of 1,250 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to invest in gold and precious stones.

Flora´s dream is to have a stable store, to expand her business, and that her children study well and become professionals.

loans.use: to invest in gold and precious stones to make jewelry

loans.name: Mercedes Adela

texts.es:
Mercedes, 42, is married. She is a practical nurse and used to work at the health center in Salaverry, but left there after cut-backs. She has 4 children. Her 2 oldest are working and the younger two are still in school. She lives in Salaverry, a town in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad.

She began selling clothes to her friends at the health center, her daughter having often traveled to Tacna to buy merchandise there. She used to sell very little until a neighbor recommended that she join the "Las Emprendedoras" ("Enterprising Women") community bank. She's worked with Manuela Ramos for three years. With her first loan of S/.200 (200 Peruvian soles), she bought clothes for her customers. With the S/.1000 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, she will buy more wholesale supplies of clothes.

Mercedes belongs to the "Jesus de Nazareth" club where she's learning to make earrings.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman

La señora Mercedes Adela, tiene 42 años, está casada, ella es técnica en Enfermería, trabajaba en el centro de salud de Salaverry, pero por motivo de recorte de personal salió del trabajo. Tiene 04 hijos, sus 02 hijos mayores trabajan y los más pequeños estudian, vive en el distrito de Salaverry en la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad.

La empresaria empezó a vender ropa a sus amigas que trabajan en el centro de salud, su hija acostumbra viajar a Tacna para comprar la mercadería. Vendía poca ropa, hasta que una vecina la recomendó para que participe en el Banco Comunal “LAS EMPRENDEDORAS”, hace tres años viene trabajando con Manuela Ramos y con el primer préstamo de S/. 200.00, que recibió compró ropa según pedido de sus clientes. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 que cancelará en un plazo de 06 meses; seguirá comprando ropa al por mayor.

La socia participa en el Club de Madres “Jesús de Nazaret” donde está aprendiendo a confeccionar aretes.

loans.use: Buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Julio Ines

texts.es:
Mister Julio Ines S. is married, 45 years-old, with three children aged 6, 4 and 2 years respectively; one of them is in the first grade, and the other two still do not go to class. His wife works alongside him. Both live in the village Austria, Leon Nicaragua. His business is the purchase of pigs, and he sells on an itinerant basis in local markets.

The purpose of the credit is to increase his working capital to maintain sufficient inventory of pigs, with which he covers his needs and serves as breadwinner.

This man's dream is to improve his living conditions in terms of housing, as well as to buy a vehicle that will search for pigs and transport them for sale. His business serves as an alternative to unemployment. By lack of study, he was unable to develop professionally – a fate which he does not want for his children for it requires credit as a way to expand business and living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.
