El Señor Julio Ines S., es casado, tiene 45 años de edad, con tres hijos con edades entre los 6, 4 y 2 años respectivamente, uno de ellos esta estudiando el primer grado de primaria, los otros dos no van todavia a clase, su esposa trabaja en conjunto con él, ambos habitan en el reparto villa austria, leon nicaragua, su actividad economica es la compra de cerdos en pie para destace ya que ellos mismos lo realizan ambos comercializan de forma ambulante en los mercados locales.

El proposito del credito, ha sido para incrementar su capital de trabajo manteniendo inventario suficiente como es cerdos en pie, con el cual cubrir su demanda y llevar el sustento familiar.

Los sueños de este señor, es mejorar sus condiciones de vida en cuanto a su vivienda, así mismo poder comprar un vehiculo que le serviría para ir a buscar los cerdos, así como para poder trasladar su producto al mercado. Su negocio surge como una alternativa al desempleo que por falta de estudio no pudo desarrollarse profesionalmente, lo que no quiere para sus hijos en un futuro para ello requiere del credito como una manera de poder ampliar su negocio y condiciones de vidas.

loans.use: For the purchase of pigs

loans.name: Candy Selene

texts.es:
Candy, 26, studied nursing but ended her studies when she became engaged to marry; she has 2 children in elementary school and lives in Salaverry, a town in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad.

She began selling "marcianos" (a local summer treat made with frozen juices) but she didn't earn much from the business so she decided to sell cosmetics, as well. In addition, she earns money caring for a family's children and, with her mother, making stuffed figures and ornaments. Her mother encouraged her to join the "Las Emprendedoras" ("Enterprising Women") community bank; she's been working with Manuela Ramos for nine months and with a first loan of S/.300 (300 Peruvian soles) she invested in cosmetic products so that she could have them in stock and, consequently, sell on credit; in addition, buying the products on sale allowed her to get them at better prices.

With this S/.800 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, she will buy the materials she needs to make her stuffed figures and ornaments.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Candy Selene tiene 26 años, estudió hasta III ciclo de Enfermería, no pudo concluir sus estudios porque se comprometió con un joven, tiene 02 hijos, son estudiantes del nivel Primaria, vive en el distrito de Salaverry en la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad.

La empresaria empezó vendiendo marcianos, como se ganaba poco en este negocio decidió vender también productos cosméticos, además trabaja en una casa cuidando niños y confecciona muñecos y adornos junto con su madre. Su Mamá la animó a participar en el Banco Comunal “LAS EMPRENDEDORAS”, tiene nueve meses trabajando con Manuela Ramos y con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00, invirtió en la compra de productos cosméticos para poder tener stock y realizar así ventas al crédito además comprando los productos en oferta puede obtener mejores precios.

Con el préstamo de S/. 800.00 que cancelará en un plazo de 6 meses comprará telas, lana, caritas, cerámica para confeccionar adornos y muñecos

loans.use: Buy materials to make ornaments and stuffed figures.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: María Esperanza

texts.es:
Maria Esperanza is 46 years old and married. She studied through high school and supports 5 children, 2 of which are working while the other 3 are still students. She lives in the district of Salaverry in the Province of Trujillo, La Libertad. When she was studying high school she learned how to make purses. When she finished her studies she dedicated herself to this small business which she started thanks to a small amount of money she had saved. Later her friends encouraged her to participate in the Communal Bank “LAS EMPRENDEDORAS”. With her first loan of 200 Soles she purchased buckles, closures and other supplies to invest in her business. With a new loan for 1,700 Soles, to be repaid within 6 months, she will purchase decorative ribbons to make shirts and other hand sewn products for some children’s playcenters. She currently acts as Secretary of her Communal Bank and she is very happy to work with the other members. One of her goals is for her younger children to become professionals since her older children never had the opportunity to complete their studies.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

La señora María Esperanza está casada, tiene 46 años, estudió secundaria completa, tiene 05 hijos, 02 trabajan y 03 son estudiantes. Vive en el distrito D. Salaverry D. la Provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad. Cuando estudiaba secundaria aprendió en su colegio a confeccionar carteras así que cuando terminó D. estudiar se dedicó a este negocio gracias a un pequeño ahorro que tenía. Posteriormente sus amigas la animaron a participar en el Banco Comunal “LAS EMPRENDEDORAS”, y con el primer préstamo D. S/. 200.00, compró broches, cierres, para hacer manualidades e implementar el negocio. Con el préstamo D. S/. 1,700.00, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará bordados en cinta, confeccionara polos y elaborará algunas manualidades para algunos jardines D. la infancia. Actualmente tiene el cargo D. secretaria en el Banco Comunal al que pertenece y se siente muy contenta D. trabajar junto con el resto D. socias. Tiene como meta hacer profesionales a sus hijos menores ya que sus hijos mayores no tuvieron oportunidad D. estudiar.

loans.use: Compra de cintas.

loans.name: Victoria Ursula

texts.en:
Victoria is a 35-year-old mother of two children. She has a store located in the Santa Elena neighborhood where she sells household supplies, vegetables, meat, fruit, etc., with the help of her niece and children during their free time. Every day Victoria goes to the market at five in the morning to buy products that are out of stock.

Victoria is a member of the Imasumacc Village Bank, meaning “How Beautiful” in Quechua, the native language of Peru. She needs a loan of 3,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to invest in sugar, rice, cooking oil, noodles, and various soups.

Victoria’s dream is to construct a second floor for her house, to stock more products for her business, and to support her children until they become professionals.

loans.use: to invest in sugar, rice, cooking oil, noodles, and various soups

loans.name: Jeny Elizabeth

texts.es:
Jeny Elizabeth is 37 years old and is married. She studied to be an obstetrician, but was never able to practice her profession. She has 3 small children, all attending elementary school. She lives in the District of Moche in the province of Trujillo in the Department of La Libertad.

For about 8 years now, shes been preparing and selling food to relatives and acquaintances. She started this business out of necessity, to help with the household expenses, as her husband's income wasn't enough to meet all their expenses. A friend encouraged her to participate in the Manuela Ramos process and so she joined the Communal Bank "Our Lady of Fatima." The first loan she received was S /. 300.00, which she invested in the purchase of sugar, vegetables, etc.

. With this new loan of S /. 1000.00, which she plans to repay within 6 months, she plans to purchase dishes, tablecloths, silverware, and pots to replenish or replace what she currently owns.

Jeny Elizabeth dreams of having a large, well-decorated restaurant, and also wishes to give her children everything they need to set them up for life.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Jeny Elizabeth está casada, tiene 37 años, estudió la carrera de obstetricia, nunca pudo ejercer su profesión, tiene 03 hijos, son menores de edad, estudiantes del nivel primario. Vive en el Distrito de Moche en la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad. Desde hace 8 años prepara comida para vender a sus familiares y conocidos, se inicia en el negocio por necesidad; para ayudar al sustento del hogar ya que su esposo no tiene buenos ingresos que alcancen para cubrir todos los gastos. Una amiga la animó a participar en Manuela Ramos e ingresó al Banco Comunal “VIRGEN DE FATIMA”. El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/. 300.00, el cual lo invirtió en la compra de azúcar, verduras, etc. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 que cancelará en un plazo de 06 meses, comprará platos, manteles, cubiertos, ollas para renovar su vajilla. La señora Jeny Elizabeth, sueña con tener un restaurante grande y bien decorado además quiere dar a sus hijos todo lo que necesiten hasta verlos adultos y realizados.

loans.use: To purchase flatware, dishes and tablecloths (Compra de utencilios (platos, manteles, cubiertos).

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Jesabell

texts.es:
Together with her husbad Roger Chacon, who works as a FAMA salesperson, Mrs Castellon S. has established a small shop in her home. She sells clothes, shoes and cosmetics to her customers who pay in cash or in credit.

She has an eight year old child that attends second grade in elementary school. She directly takes care of her business and upon request, she also home delivers the products to her clients. Thanks to her efforts and hard work, Mrs Castellon Seballos’ customer-base has been steadily growing.

Today, she requests a loan in order to diversify her offer to include merchandise for children.

Mrs Castellon S.’ dream is to have a shop that will allow her to provide a better service to her customers and to improve the standard of living of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Castellon S. por esfuerzo propio y el de su marido Roger Chacon, quien labora como promotor de FAMA, han logrado establecer en su casa de habitación una tiendita de ropa nueva, zapato y cosmeticos, con clientelas de crédito y contado lo que ha venido fortaleciendo a trávez de trabajo y esfuerzo; hoy solicita un refinanciamiento para reforzar su pequeño negocio con oferta para niños. Tiene un niño de 8 años de edad, actualmente cursa su segundo grado de primaria. Su negocio es atendido personalmente por ella, ademas brinda atención a domicilio si el cliente así lo solicita; su sueño es montar una tienda que le permita garantizar condiciones para sus clientes y mejorar las condiciones de vida familiar.

loans.use: To diversify the products she sells and also includee merchandise for children

loans.name: Tarcila Rebeca

texts.en:
Rebeca is a 36-year-old mother of three children. Rebeca and her husband have a restaurant called Perú-China, located on a central street in Ayacucho. The restaurant specializes in chicken and Chinese food. Her husband is in charge of preparing the food with the help of three employees. Furthermore, Rebeca sells catalog cosmetics that she offers to friends and relatives.

Rebeca is a member of Las Entusiastas Village Bank. She needs a loan of 2,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to invest in cooking oil and cosmetics.

Rebeca’s dream is to expand her business, to have another business, own a home, and that her children become professionals.

loans.use: to invest in cooking oil and cosmetics

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es:
Doña María Elsa is 58-years-old. She lives in the Carlos Aguirre neighborhood. She has 5 children, and her life companion is a salesman.

Doña María Elsa makes and sells mirrors, which she makes herself by hand. She has been in this business for 5 years, and the difficulties that she has faced have been in periods of low sales due to the difficult economic situation in the country. She started this business with severance pay from her old job, all due to the attraction she felt for making mirrors, and she thought it could be a good business. The use of this loan will be the purchase of supplies so she can make her mirrors. She has large orders and doesn't have enough capital to satisfy the demand of her customers. She hopes to be able to keep working hard to grow her business and to make it stable.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Doña Maria Elsa tiene 58 años de edad, habita en el barrio Carlos Aguirre, tiene 5 hijos quienes son estudiantes, su compañero de vida es agente vendedor.

Doña Maria Elsa se dedica a la elaboración y venta de espejos, los cuales los hace ella misma y de forma artesanal. Tiene 5 años de estar en este negocio y las dificultades que ha encontrado son las épocas en que hay ventas bajas debido a la difícil situación económica del país. El negocio lo empezó con la liquidación del antiguo trabajo, todo debido a la atracción que sentía por la elaboración de espejos y pensó que podría ser un buen negocio. El uso del préstamo será la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de espejos, ya que tiene pedidos grandes y no cuenta con suficiente capital para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Espera poder seguir trabajando duro para hacer crecer su negocio y hacerlo más estable.

loans.use: To purchase supplies to make her mirrors

loans.name: Gladys And Magdalena Group

texts.en:
Gladys is a 34-year-old mother of one son. Gladys has a small store in her house where she sells house supplies and vegetables and is helped by her husband during his free time.

Meanwhile, Magdalena is a married, 52-year-old mother of six children. Magdalena is a fabric artisan, working with cloth to make blankets with the help of her husband. She sells her products in the city of Ayacucho and sometimes in the city of Huancayo.

Gladys and Magdalena are members of Las Entusiastas Village Bank. They need loans of 300 and 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles respectively to invest in rice, sugar, wool, and thread.

Gladys and Magdalena’s dream is to change their businesses to something more profitable, to improve their standard of living, and that their children become professionals.

loans.use: to invest in rice, sugar, wool, and thread

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is a married, 36-year-old mother of five children. Irma sells various clothing for all ages, footwear, traditional clothing, etc. that she acquires from Lima. She sells her products in a stand at the Carmen Alto Market. Furthermore, Irma travels every fifteen days to the community of Viscapalca where she purchases cheeses and sell them on credit to different institutions in the city of Ayacucho. Irma also plans to set up a new stall to sell baby and children’s clothing.

Irma is a member of the Florecer Village Bank. She needs a loan of 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (US$ 375) to invest in baby clothing sets, blankets and christening dresses.

Irma’s dream is to have a new successful business, to buy a car, and to have her children move forward.

loans.use: to invest in baby clothing sets, blankets and christening dresses

loans.name: Olimpia Garmendia

texts.es:
Doña Olimpia has a small grocery store in her house. She has 12 years of experience in this business. She started by selling tortillas and beans, and with her own savings, she was able to start and to work with her grocery store. She will use this loan to purchase basic grains and to invest in her store. She hopes to continue with the growth that her business has had and to make her store larger to have all of the products that her customers demand.

Doña Olimpia is 42-years-old and is a single mother of 3 children, one of whom is independent of her. She hopes to be able to always have work to support her two children in school.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Doña Olimpia tiene una pequeña pulpería en su casa de habitación, tiene 12 años de experiencia en el negocio, empezó vendiendo tortillas y frijoles y con ahorros propios pudo empezar a trabajar con la pulpería. El préstamo lo usará para la compra de granos básicos e invertirlos en el negocio. Espera tener seguir con el crecimiento que ha tenido y hacer su pulpería más grande para contar con todos los productos demandados por sus clientes.

Doña Olimpia tiene 42 años, es madre soltera de 3 hijos, de los cuales ya uno es independiente a ella, espera poder contar siempre con trabajo para apoyar a sus dos hijos en sus estudios.

loans.use: Purchase of basic grains to sell them in her grocery store

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonardo is a married 44-year-old mother of four children. She has a small restaurant in a rented location. She prepares various menus that she sells during the afternoon. Her usual customers are neighbors of the restaurant, and on Sundays she prepares traditional food. Her spouse also has a car repair shop in their house, though they will be moving. Leonarda will have the restaurant in their house because she believes she will be able to provide better service to her customers there. Furthermore, Leonarda travels to regional fairs where she buys cereals that she then resells at a market near her home.

Leonarda is a member of the Florecer Village Bank. She needs a loan of 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (US$ 375) to invest in various resources to restock in her business.

Leonarda’s dream is to expand her business, to have a large restaurant, to improve her home, and that her children become professionals.

loans.use: to invest in various resources to restock in her business

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
First loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=28871&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Nelly is a 30-year-old mother of one child and is expecting another son. Nelly sells candy from a cart in front of Condorcanqui High School in the district of Carmen Alto. She works from ten in the morning to three in the afternoon. Furthermore, at night Nelly sells salchipollos (sausage snacks) from a cart on a principal street of the district. Nelly also plans to start the construction of her house.

Nelly is a member of the Florecer Village Bank. She needs a loan of 1000 soles (US$ 375), to invest in cookies, caramels, oil, and scaffolding to make her house.

Nelly’s dream is to have her own home, get married, to improve her business, and educate her son.

loans.use: to invest in cookies, caramels, ,and scaffolding to make her house

loans.name: Soraida

texts.en:
First loan:

http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=24427&_tpos=3&_tpg=1

Soraida is a single, 32-year-old woman who sells imported clothing such as leather coats, shoes, zapatillas, pants, sheets, quilts, etc. She purchases these products from Puno and Tacna, where she goes every two months depending on her sales and working capital. Her sales are on credit, selling to friends, family, neighbors, and institutions. She begins every day at six in the morning working till six each night. Soraida currently has a project to start a new business to rent dresses.

Soraida is a member of the Imasumacc Village Bank, meaning “How Beautiful” in Quechua, the native language of Peru. She needs a loan of 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (US$ 375) to invest in mO. slippers and shoes.

Soraida’s dream is to have her own home and to have a stO. where she would rent out dresses.

loans.use: to invest in more slippers and shoes for re-sale

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maria del Carmen has 2 young children. She is married, and her husband is Supervisor of Security. Both she and her husband are responsible for the family's expenses.

For the past 5 years, Maria del Carmen has run a grocery store from her home. She began by selling soft drinks and refreshments. With the help of her husband she started the business and has been able to sustain it. Their goal is to expand and move her store where she'll be able to offer her customers more variety of products. With the proceeds from her sales, she expects to improve her family's future.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Maria del Carmen tiene 2 hijos menores de edad, es casado, su esposo es Supervisor de Seguridad y ambos tienen la responsabilidad de la manutención de la familia. Maria del Carmen tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación desde hace 5 años, empezó el negocio vendiendo gaseosas y refrescos. Con la ayuda de su esposo pudo iniciar el negocio y con su ayuda también lo ha podido mantener, sus planes son llegar a poner convertir su pulpería en una tienda donde pueda ofrecer más variedades a sus clientes. Con las ganancias obtenidas espera mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

loans.use: To expand her business in order to grow her profits. (Inversión en su negocio para ampliarlo)

loans.name: Orillas Del Lago Group

texts.es:
Agriculture is the principal activity of 16 people who work in a group called "Orillas del Lago" (Lake Shores). They all live in the community of Achocalla (in El Alto in La Paz), where the climate is perfect for the type of work that they do. They grow mainly vegetables, including potatoes and corn. They also sell flowers and plants. They sell all of these products within the community and also in the markets in the city of El Alto. They would like credits to strengthen their capital for their new harvests, and in this way ensure their sales and generate income that can help them with their family finances.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La agricultura es la actividad principal de 16 personas que trabajan organizados en un grupo bajo la denominación “Orillas del Lago” todos viven en la localidad de Achocalla (El alto –La Paz ) donde el clima es perfecto para el tipo de trabajo que ellos tienen, siembran principalmente verduras , papas, choclos y otros , también se dedican a la venta de flores y plantas. Todos estos productos los comercializan dentro la localidad y también los mercados de la ciudad de El Alto. Quieren créditos para reforzar su capital para las siguientes cosechas, de esta manera asegurar sus ventas y generar ingresos que puedan apoyar en la economía de sus hogares.

loans.use: They need credits to invest in new harvests.

loans.name: Luna Brillante Group

texts.es:
The association called “Luna Brillante” is part of the Pro-Mujer family. It is located in the Senkata neighborhood in the city of El Alto. To date it consists of 14 members that have proven to be an organized group when it comes to their loan payments and internal activities. Within the group, the majority of the women are married with children, almost all of whom are in school or attending university.

Trade is the principal activity of the "Luna Brillante" Association. In general, they all sell items like condiments and spices, cereals and light clothing. They purchase their products at wholesale prices and then sell to consumers. They want to invest capital to purchase more at wholesale to increase their profits and meet the obligations they each have with their families.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

La asociación denominada “Luna Brillante” forma parte de la familia de Pro-Mujer, esta se encuentra en la zona de Senkata, de la ciudad de El Alto, a la fecha cuenta con 14 miembros que han demostrado ser un grupo organizado en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito y actividades internas. Dentro el grupo la mayoría son casadas y con hijos, casi todos en edad escolar y también universitarios, el comercio es la actividad principal de la asociación Luna Brillante como ser la venta de condimentos y especies, de cereales ,venta de ropa ligera ,todos en general venden compran sus productos de mayoristas para luego ofrecerlos al detalle. Quieren invertir capital para realizar estas compras al por mayor para mejorar sus ganancias y cumplir con las obligaciones que todos tienen con sus familias

loans.use: Purchase products at wholesale prices

loans.name: Mujeres Del Futuro Group

texts.es:
Every morning, Mrs Silverio brings her merchandise to the market. There, she sells jackets in different models and colors for adults and children. In the afternoon, she sells the same jackets on request.

Mrs Silverio is part of the Association “Mujeres del Futuro – Women of the future” situated in the Adela quarter in the city of El Alto. The association gathers women with similar activities to those of Mrs Silverio.

As the members of this association would like to travel to some villages in order to offer their merchandise, they will need to fund an important stock of merchandise and finance their transportation costs.

The “Mujeres del Futuro” are sure that they will be able to generate better sales and pay back the loans they request.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Todas las mañanas muy temprano comienza su día la señora Silveria, llevando su mercadería a la feria de las mañaneras donde ofrece a la clientela chompas, para niños y adultos en variados modelos y colores por las tardes ofrece estos mismos productos a pedido.

Similar actividad tiene la asociación donde ella participa, denominada “Mujeres del futuro” que esta ubicada en la zona de villa Adela de la ciudad de El Alto.

Quisieran viajar a algunas poblaciones para ofrecer su mercadería por lo que necesitan capital para cubrir la compra de un stok mayor y tambien necesitan dinero para sus pasajes, están seguras que generaran mayores ingresos, con lo que podrán responder a sus créditos.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and finance their transportation costs

loans.name: Bolivia Nueva Group

texts.es:
In the city of El Alto you will find the Alto Lima Center. To it belongs the “Bolivia Nueva” Association made up of 13 women anxious to progress in their small businesses. The majority of the group is married and they affirm that they need to help their husbands economically because they have an average of five children each and their husbands’ salaries aren’t enough to cover their household expenses.

The main activity of the association is trade and they sell woven wool sweaters, food, natural fruit juices, cosmetics and other items depending on the season - products they can offer at the “16 de Julio” Market in the city of El Alto.

They need capital to increase the amount of merchandise and in that way generate larger incomes for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

En la ciudad de El Alto se encuentra el centro focal de de Alto Lima a éste pertenece, la asociación “Bolivia Nuevar”, integrada por 13 mujeres ansiosas de progresar en sus pequeños negocios. La mayoría en el grupo son casadas y afirman que necesitan ayudar a sus parejas en la economía del hogar, ya que tienen un promedio de 5 niños y el sueldo de sus esposos no les alcanza para los gastos que tienen en sus hogares. La actividad principal en la asociación es el comercio, venden chompas tejidas en lana, comida, jugos de fruta natural, cosméticos y otros dependiendo de la temporada. Productos que los ofrecen en la feria 16 de julio de la ciudad de El Alto. Ellas precisan capital para incrementar su mercadería de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para sus familias.

loans.use: Purchase additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Generación 2006 Group

texts.es:
In the Villa Exaltación neighborhood of the city of El Alto, there is a center located there with the same name and to it belongs the “Generación 2006” Association. It is a very friendly group who, along with their credit advisor, works with Pro-Mujer with a lot of enthusiasm and desire to improve their businesses. The majority of the women is married and has children of different ages. They tell us that their daily household expenses are increasing all the time and the income they have is not sufficient enough to cover minimum necessities.

This group works principally making handcrafted chocolates. They sell chocolate bars for breakfast, bon bons and chocolates that are cream-filled among others. The group is requesting additional credit to acquire raw materials to increase production and to purchase better quality packaging that their clients will like.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

En la zona de villa Exaltación de la ciudad de El Alto se encuentra ubicado el centro focal del mismo nombre, a este pertenece la asociación “Generación 2006 por socias. Un grupo muy simpático que junto a su asesora de créditos, trabajan con Pro-Mujer con mucho entusiasmo de mejorar en sus negocios. La mayoría de ellas son casadas y niños de distintas edades nos cuentan que los gastos diarios que tienen en sus hogares crecen cada vez mas y los ingresos que tienen ya no son suficientes para cubrir necesidades mínimas Este grupo se dedica principalmente a la fabricación de chocolates artesanales ofrecen chocolates en barra para el desayuno, bombones, chocolates rellenos y otros, desean mayor crédito para la adquisición de materia prima para ampliar su producción, además de comprar empaques de mejor calidad para el gusto del cliente.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials and packaging

loans.name: Saumu's Sharom Group

texts.en:
Saumu is a single woman with 3 children aged 20, 18, and 17. She owns a small shop which she started in 1994. Every day, she works from 7am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $45 from her sales.

Saumu now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses dealing with commodities sales in the market.

loans.use: To buy more items for her shop

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema is 30 years old. She is a single woman. She became a crops seller in 1997. Every day, she works from 7am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

In the past, Neema has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Neema now hopes for a loan to buy more crops like rice, maize, and millet for her business.

loans.use: To buy more crops for her business

loans.name: Edith's Mapinduzi Group

texts.en:
Edith is 48 years old. She is a married woman with 4 children aged 20, 18, 10, and 9. She became a charcoal seller in 1987. Every day, she works from 7am to 2pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

Edith now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, who has a small business dealing in fish.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena is 39 years old. She is a married woman with 4 children aged 19, 15, 14, and 12. She became a milk seller in 2006. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

In the past, Helena has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Helena now hopes for a loan to buy more milk for her business.

loans.use: to buy more milk for her business

loans.name: Zalika

texts.en:
Zalika is a married woman with 2 children aged 9 and 5. She became a bites seller in 1990. Every day, she works from 6:30am to 11pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $65 from her sales.

In the past, Zalika has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Zalika now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Suzana's Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Suzana is 37 years old. She is a married woman with 3 children aged 17,15, and 4. She became a cassava seller in 2005. Every day, she works from 7am to 1pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

In the past, Suzana has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Suzana now hopes for a loan to buy more cassava for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with clothes sales and groceries.

loans.use: To buy more cassava for her business

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with 3 children aged 16, 14, and 4. She became a food seller in 2004. Every day, she works from 8am to 1pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $145 from her sales.

In the past, Amina has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Amina now hopes for a loan to buy more food items like rice, maize flour, meat, vegetables, and bananas for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Scola

texts.en:
Scola is 37 years old. She is a married woman with 2 children aged 10 and 4. She owns and operates a restaurant. Every day, she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

Scola now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Leandra

texts.es:
Leandra is a very simple woman who has worked for many years in the trade of selling dogs. This activity helps her family pay for some of the necessary expenses that they have to survive. She lives in a house with two small rooms and only what is necessary, since it is a very humble and simple home in a far away area of the city.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Señora muy sencilla trabaja hace muchos años en el rubro de venta de perros esa actividad es la cual ayuda a su familia a poder solventar los gastos necesarios para sobrevivir, vive en una casa con dos pequeños cuartos con solo lo necesario, ya que es una vivienda muy humilde y sencilla en una zona muy alejada de la ciudad

loans.use: To increase her capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand and enlarge her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To enlarge her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To replenish her small clothing store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of clothing in bulk for her small business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in a large stock of goods for her small grocery store

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar H. is a 23-year-old young man who lives with his family in Ningarhar province. He is married and has two children. They are small and don't go to school yet. Omar lives with his brothers at one home and they support their family together. Omar is illiterate but he admires educated people. He thus advises his brothers to care more about their studying and to work hard.

Omar H. has been working as a farmer for the last several years on his own land. He doesn't have a lot of land but he is a very active and hardworking man. He grows wheat, tomatoes, eggplants, and other different kinds of vegetables. He takes them to the marketplace for sale. Actually his current income is just 300 Afghanis ($6) a day and it's too little to suffice for his household expenditures.

Omar says that he has fertile land in an area close to the city which is a great benefit logistically. But he is in need of cash to purchase seeds and fertilizers. He has therefore applied for a 30,000 Afghanis loan.

Omar H. hopes that after a few months he will see a lot of positive changes in his business and thus in his family conditions. He is also dreaming about enrolling his brothers in private educational schools which are much better than public schools. He promised that he will repay this loan in 24 months in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
MuhammadU. a 24-year-old married man. He has two children and he is the resident of Ningarhar province. Due to civil wars in Afghanistan, he was not able to go to school; he had to work to support his family. He therefore began a small business.

First, Muhammad made a small retail store in Jalalabad City and with the little capital that he had, he purchased some basic goods. Initially, his business went well and he attracted plenty of regular customers in short while. However, after a few months, because of skyrocketing costs of living, the retail store no longer sufficed for the household expenses. Gradually, he was losing customers because there were not enough goods in the shop.

But now he is looking for a 50,000 Afghanis loan to stand on his feet once more. He intends to purchase various goods for his shop and increase the number of his customers once again. His shop has a good location in the market and that is definitely a plus.

MuhammadU. hopes to become a great businessman in the future. He works hard to achieve that goal. He is already thankful to the lenders.

loans.use: To purchase various goods for his shop

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna started the business because she always wanted to work without neglecting her house, to be an independent person and to support her husband with the expenses. For these reasons she began 6 years ago making and selling tamales in her house, selling them chiefly to her neighbors, and little by little she gained more clients thanks to the recommendations that she received.

She needs a loan of $250, that will be repaid in 3 months, to buy a pair of steam trays to increase her production and to reduce her costs. With your aid Reyna will grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Reyna inició el negocio por que siempre quiso trabajar desde sin descuidar su casa, para ser una persona independiente y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos; por lo que comenzó hace 6 años con la elaboración y venta de tamales en su casa vendiéndole principalmente a sus vecinos, y poco a poco fue logrando mas clientes gracias a las recomendaciones que recibía.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar un par de vaporearas para incrementar su producción y reducir sus costos. Con tu ayuda Reyna hará crecer su negocio.

loans.use: To buy a pair of steam trays for her tamale business.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Verónica has 3 children. She decided to start her own business because she needed money to help her family cover the household expenses and improve her children’s quality of life. Three years ago, she started selling footwear outside her home. She currently sells her merchandise at the nearby flea markets.

She needs a loan of $250.00 USD, which she will repay in 3 months, in order to purchase merchandise because she is running out of footwear and she needs to keep investing in her business. With your help, Verónica will be able to get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Verónica tiene 3 hijos, ella decidió iniciar su negocio ya que necesitaba ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia con los gastos de la casa y darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Comenzó hace 3 años vendiendo calzado afuera de su casa y actualmente vende en mercados rodantes cercanos a su domicilio.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía ya que la que tenia se le esta acabando y necesita seguir invirtiendo. Con tu ayuda Verónica podrá salir adelante

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia started her own business because she needed the extra income to help her family with the household expenses and to improve her children’s quality of life. Three years ago, she started selling clothing outside her home. Little by little, however, her clientele kept increasing, which is why she currently sells her merchandise at the local flea markets.

She needs a loan of $250.00 USD, which she will repay in 3 months, in order to purchase a bundle of clothing, thus allowing her to continue with her business. With your help, this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Lucia inició el negocio porque necesitaba ingresos extras para sacar adelante a su familia con los gastos de la casa y darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Comenzó hace 3 años vendiendo ropa afuera de su domicilio, poco a poco se fue haciendo de clientes por lo que actualmente ya vende en mercados rodantes.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar una paca de ropa y así poder continuar con su negocio. Con tu ayuda esto será posible.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro started his business when he found himself unemployed and he had to obtain an income to support his family. He started a little more than 5 years ago helping a friend with a taxi. Little by little he progressed until today he rents a taxi that he has been working for several years.

He needs a loan of $400, which will be repaid in 5 months, to pay for some repairs that his taxi needs and to maintain it.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Pedro inicio su negocio ya que se había quedado desempleado y tenia que conseguir un ingreso para sacar adelante a su familia. comenzó hace un poco mas de 5 años ayudándole a un familiar con un taxi, poco a poco fue progresando hasta la actualidad que renta un taxi que es con el que ya tiene varios años trabajando.

El necesita un préstamo por US $400 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar algunas refacciones que su taxi necesita y darle mantenimiento.

loans.use: To pay for repairs and maintenance on his taxi.

loans.name: Rosa Magda

texts.es:
Rosa started her own business to get ahead because her husband did not make enough money to cover all the family expenses. She started her shoe sale business three years ago, selling footwear by catalogue and making small shoe demonstration parties amongst her friends and neighbors. She then started selling her merchandise both door-to-door and at the local markets.

She needs a loan of $800.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase more merchandise, make more shoe demonstration parties, and set up a shoe rack at the local flea markets.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa inició el negocio para salir adelante por necesidad dado que no era suficiente con lo que ganaba su esposo para cubrir los gastos familiares. Comenzó su negocio de venta de zapatos hace 3 años vendiendo solo sobre pedidos y haciendo pequeñas demostraciones entre los vecinos y amigas, después empezó con la venta casa por casa y en mercados.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $800 que pagara en 6 meses para comparar mercancía y poder realizar ya demostraciones así como poner un estante en los mercados rodantes.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maria Del Rocio

texts.es:
Roció started the business because of the need to support her partner given that they were not married and she wanted to support him by working for their account. She began 4 years ago making and selling foods in her house but now she also sells snacks in the schools, as part of the school board, which has permitted her to expand her profits.

She needs a loan of $1200, that will be repaid in 6 months, to buy a larger cooking surface and to install new shelves in her business.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Roció inició el negocio por necesidad para apoyar a su pareja dado que no estaban casados quise apoyarlo trabajando por su cuenta. Comenzó hace 4 años elaborando y vendiendo comidas en su casa pero ahora también venD. en los snacks D. las escuelas, como parte D. L. mesa directiva, lo que le ha permitido ampliar sus ganancias.

ElL. necesita un préstamo por US $1200 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar un quemador mas amplio y colocar estantería mas nueva en su negocio.

loans.use: To buy a larger cooking surface and shelves for her food business.

loans.name: Elena Anastacia

texts.es:
Elena is a married mother of 4 daughters, ages 20, 19, 12, and 10. She started her own business because one of her daughters, who was selling shoes by catalogue, convinced her to do so. Because her daughters were studying to be administrative assistants at a technical institute, and because the expenses were too big for her husband, she started selling footwear to help out with her children’s studies. She started 4 years ago and has been prosperous so far.

She needs a loan of $300.00 USD, which she will repay in 3 months, in order to purchase this season’s merchandise. With your help, she will get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Elena es casada y madre de 4 hijas de 20, 19, 12 y 10 años. Ella inició el negocio por una de sus hijas que al estar viendo un catalogo de zapatos, la animo a vender, y como sus hijas estaban estudiando para secretarias contador en un instituto técnico comercial y los gastos eran muy fuertes para su esposo, ella comenzó a vender para poder ayudar con los gastos de la escuela de sus hijos. Comenzó hace 4 años y hasta la fecha le ha ido bien.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 3 meses para poder comprar mercancía de temporada. Con tu ayuda ella saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Hortensia Estanislad

texts.es:
Hortensia started the business because of health problems that she had. She had bronchial asthma and, because of that, was under a lot of pressure. She started as a client of natural products and improved her health a lot. From there she became an independent distributor so that more people could achieve the benefits from the products. Since she is an example of what they can do to improve their health she gained many clients.

She needs a loan of $300 that will be repaid in 3 months, to be able to supply more merchandise, and to invite more people to use the products.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Hortensia inició el negocio por problemas de salud que ella tenia, tenia asma bronquial y a raíz de eso se le subía mucho la presión, empezó como cliente a consumir productos naturistas y mejoro mucho su salud, de ahí se hizo distribuidora independiente para que mas gente pueda aprovechar los beneficios de los productos y como ella es un ejemplo de lo que estos pueden hacer en pro de la salud ha logrado captar muchos clientes.

Elle necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 3 meses para poder surtir mas mercancía, e invitar a mas gente a que consuma los productos

loans.use: To buy merchandise and pay marketing expenses for her natural products business.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario started her own business in order to help with the household expenses, since her husband has never had a steady job. Because her husband has always worked for himself, there are times when Rosario is the one who has to support her son and the household. On her own initiative, she made a trip to León-Moroleón-San Juan de los Lagos with her husband, and she seized the opportunity to purchase some clothing and footwear so that she could sell it to her acquaintances. They liked her merchandise, so little by little, her sales have been increasing.

She needs a loan of $300.00 USD, which she will repay in 3 months, in order to purchase more clothing and footwear for the next season.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosario inició el negocio para ayudar con los gastos de la casa, ya que como su esposo nunca ha tenido un trabajo fijo, siempre ha trabajado por su cuenta hay ocasiones en que ella es la que tiene que sacar adelante a su hijo y de la casa; por iniciativa propia se fue con su esposo a un viaje León-Moroleón-San Juan de los Lagos, y aprovecho para comprar un poco de zapato y ropa que empezó a venderla con sus conocidos, le gusto y poco a poco ha ido incrementado el volumen de sus ventas.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 3 meses para poder surtir más ropa y zapato escolar para la próxima temporada.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina started her own business while facing the need to maintain her household and raise her 4 children—ages 11, 10, 7, and 6—on her own after her husband walked out on them. She started the business after being invited by a co-worker who sold jewelry because it was quite lucrative for her. Because of their financial necessity, she decided to invest her income in the purchase of merchandise. Little by little, she has been moving forward.

She needs a loan of $300.00 USD, which she will repay in 3 months, in order to purchase merchandise. With your support, she will help her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Martina inició el negocio ante la necesidad de tener que mantener la casa y sacar adelante a sus 4 hijos de 11, 10, 7 y 6 años, sola ya que su esposo los abandono; ella inicio su negocio por invitación de una compañera, a que vendiera joyería ya que esto le dejaba buenos ingresos a ella, ante la necesidad económica que vivía ella decidió invertir sus ingresos en mercancía y poco a poco ha salido adelante.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 3 meses para compra mercancía, con tu apoyo ella hará crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Filimon

texts.es:
Filimon is a married father of 2 children, ages 11 and 9. He started his own business 10 years ago. He and his wife, Aracely, started selling used clothing from home and at the flea market because the family expenses were quite high and they could not be covered with his salary alone. One year ago, when Filimon obtained the house, they opened up a small general store. Little by little, they hope to make it grow.

He needs a loan of $500.00 USD, which he will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase goods for their general store. With your help, he will get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Filimon es casado y tiene 2 hijos de 11 y 9 años. Inició el negocio hace 10 años, entre el y su esposa la Sra. Aracely empezaron vendiendo ropa usada en su casa y en el mercado sobre ruedas, porque los gastos eran muy elevados y con su sueldo no completaban, hace 1 año cuando le dieron la casa a su esposo pusieron una pequeña tienda de abarrotes y poco a poco la quieren hacer crecer.

El necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía para la tienda de abarrotes. Con tu ayuda el saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase goods

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business #58300

loans.name: Rosa Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia is a persevering woman who knows how to overcome the adversities of life and get ahead on her own. After getting a separation from her husband 12 years ago, she started working in factories. However, this forced her to spend less time with her children, which is why she started making and selling turnovers to her neighbors and to the local stores 11 years ago. Thanks to her business, she has been able to get ahead.

She needs a loan of $600.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase the ingredients needed to make more turnovers, as well as make pizzas, which is a new activity that she is taking on.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Claudia es una persona perseverante, que sabe sobreponerse a las adversidades y sale adelante por ella misma, después que se separo de su esposo hace ya mas de 12 años empezó trabajando en fabricas pero esto la orillaba a pasar poco tiempo con sus hijos, por lo que hace 11 años emprendió por su cuenta haciendo y vendiendo empanadas con sus vecinos y en las tiendas, y gracias a su negocio ha salido adelante.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $600 que pagara en 6 meses para compra materia prima para hacer mas empanadas y para elaborar pizzas, que es algo nuevo en lo que esta incursionando.

loans.use: Purchase turnover and pizza ingredients

loans.name: Teresa Carlota

texts.es:
Carlota started her own business because at that time, she did not have enough money to cover the household and family expenses. She started renting out movies more than 8 years ago. Because the business has been growing, it has become steady.

She needs a loan of $350.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to give maintenance to her business space.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Carlota inicio su negocio ya que en ese entonces no les alcanzaba el dinero para los gastos de su casa y la de sus hijos, comenzó hace mas de 8 años rentando películas, como fue creciendo su negocio, el negocio se volvió estable

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $350 que pagara en 6 meses para darle mantenimiento a su negocio.

loans.use: Business space maintenance

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhon L. is a beef seller in Preak Takeo Village in Kandal Province, while her husband, Mr. Sitha Nov, is a construction worker. They have two children, both attending school. Although she and her husband have businesses, they still cannot support their family well. Therefore, Mrs. Sokhon L. is requesting a loan to start a pig breeding business in order to improve her living conditions.

She previously obtained a loan from Acleda Bank to start her current business and has fully repaid it. Within the last two years, Mrs. Sokhon L. gave birth to her youngest child, and her medical expenses totaled $750. Starting a new business will enable the family to more readily deal with any future expenses. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To start a pig breeding business in order to improve her living conditions.

loans.name: Sokhan

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhan K. lives in Preak Tanop Village in Kandal Province, where she and her husband, Mr. Vuthy Phuong, farm and fish. They cultivate crops twice a year on their plantation, rice during the rainy season and vegetables during the dry season. Since the field is far from her water source, Mrs. Sokhan K. is requesting a loan to purchase a pump to water her field. She will also use part of the loan to buy fertilizers to support her crops. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase a pump to water her field and fertilizers to support her crop.

loans.name: Sokhang

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhang L., a resident of Preeak Thom Village in Kandal Province, is a fruit seller in the local market. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand, and so is requesting a loan to purchase a variety of fruit to resell.

Her husband, Mr. Sophal Saing, is a carpenter, and they have three children, two of whom are attending local school while the other is of preschool age. Mrs. Sokhang L. and her son are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of fruit to resell in order to improve her living conditions.

loans.name: Sokheng

texts.en: Mrs. Sokheng K., a drink seller in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province, is a 60-year-old widow with two children who help their mother's business in order to improve their living conditions. Since Mrs. Sokheng K.'s business is doing well, she wants to expand it  through a loan to purchase more soft drinks to resell.

loans.use: To purchase more soft drinks to resell in order to improve her living conditions.

loans.name: Sambath

texts.en: Mrs. Sambath T. lives in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province, where she is the 49-year-old mother of five children, one of whom is working as a construction worker while three others are attending school. The youngest one is of preschool age. Mrs. Sambath T. owns a small restaurant where she serves lunch. Since her business has improved, she wants to expand it through a loan to purchase additional ingredients to cook more delicious meals for her customers. Her husband, Mr. Chantha Saom, is a construction worker. Mrs. Sambath T. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients to cook more delicious food for her customers.

loans.name: Chhanthou

texts.en: Mrs. Chhanthou C. is a vegetable seller in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province. Since her business is doing well, she is requesting a loan to purchase a greater variety of vegetables to resell. With this loan she hopes to increase her business profits and improve her living conditions. Her husband, Mr. Amila Pok, is a motor-taxi driver who generates only a small income to support his family. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Ye

texts.en: Mrs. Ye O., a resident of Yok Bath Village in Kandal Province, is a vegetable seller. She is a widow with four children, one of whO. is employed in a garment factory while another one is a tailor. The remaining two are of preschool age. Mrs. Ye O.'s business is currently doing well, so she is requesting a loan to buy more vegetables to resell.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Channeary

texts.en:
Mrs. Channeary T., of Yok Bath Village in Kandal Province, is a 47-year-old widow with six children, one of whom is a tailor while another is employed in a garment factory. The third child is attending school while the remaining three are of preschool age.
Since her business as a vegetable seller in the local market is doing well, Mrs. Channeary T. is asking for a loan to purchase more vegetables to resell.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en: Mrs. Sarom Y., a 48-year-old widow with a child employed in a garment factory, is a healer in Yok Bath Village in Kandal Province.  Although she and her child have different businesses, they still live in poor conditions. Since her child's job is far from home, Mrs. Sarom Y. spends a lot of money on transportation, so she is requesting a loan to buy a motorbike for her child to travel to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her child to travel to work.

loans.name: Mrs. Hang's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thi Hang (ID: 11030026), aged 34, is an active and energetic woman. As her husband is a blue-collar worker overseas, Ms. Hang takes care of everything at home from raising her two young children to doing the farming works, breeding poultries (pigs and chickens). She once took out a loan from Vietnam Bank of Agriculture and Rural Development and fully paid it back. Mrs. Hang then learned about SEDA and its paying-back method, which really interest her. She has asked for a loan of 3.186.000 VND to purchase more food for her chickens.

Other members of her group include:

- Mrs. N. Thi Dan (ID: 11030027) would like to borrow a loan of 3.186.000 VND to purchase goods for her shop in the market.

- Mr. T. Dinh Duyen (ID: 11030028) would like to borrow a loan of 3.186.000 VND to purchase fishes.

- Mrs. N. Thi Hien (ID: 11030029) would like to borrow a loan of 3.186.000 VND to purchase pigs.

- Mrs. N. Thi Ngoc (ID: 11030034) would like to borrow a loan of 3.186.000 to purchase woods for her carpentry business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa N., Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Hằng (MS: 11030026), năm nay 34 tuổi. Chị là người rất năng động, tháo vát. Chồng chị đi xuất khẩu lao động ở nước ngoài nên mọi việc nhà đều do chị đảm nhiệm. Chị không chỉ chăm sóc hai con nhỏ mà còn làm ruộng cấy lúa, chăn nuôi lợn thịt và nuôi gà đẻ trứng.Trước đây chị đã vay vốn của ngân hàng nông nghiệp phát triển nông thôn và đã trả hết. Nay rất thích hình thức tiết kiệm để hoàn trả của chương trình nên chị đã tham gia vay 3.186.000 VND để bổ sung vốn mua cám gà.

Trong nhóm chị còn có:

  • Chị Nguyễn Thị Dần (MS: 11030027), vay 3.186.000 VND để buôn bán hàng ở chợ.
  • Anh Trần Đình Duyệt (MS: 11030028), vay 3.186.000 VND để mua cá thả.
  • Chị Nguyễn Thị Hiền (MS: 11030029), vay 3.186.000 VND để mua lợn giống.
  • Chị Nguyễn Thị Ngọc (MS: 11030034), vay 3.186.000 VND để mua gỗ phát triển nghề mộc.

loans.use: Chăn nuôi và buôn bán

loans.name: Ms. Thu's Group

texts.vi:
Ms. N. Thi Thu (ID: 09050034) is 33 years old. She works for an organization in her neighborhood. In the past, Ms. Thu had to request loans from many different sources. But when she learned about SEDA and its saving method to pay back the loans, Ms. Thu has decided to participate in the program. In the first round of loan, Ms. Thu asked for a loan of 2.006.000 VND to breed pigs; the profit helped her renovate the toilet facilities. In the next round of loan, Ms. Thu wishes to borrow 3.360.000 VND to purchase food for her poultries.

Other members of the group include:

- Ms. N. Thi Binh (ID: 09050027) would like to borrow 3.186.000 VND to invest in her pigs and silkworms.

- Ms. N. Thi Bac (ID: 09050089) would like to borrow 3.186.000 VND to invest in her business.

- Ms. N. Thi Giang (ID: 09050039) would like to borrow 3.360.000 VND to invest in her pigs and making tofu.

- Ms. C. Thi Giai (ID: 09050037) would like to borrow 3.360.000 to invest in breeding silkworms.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Ngô Thị Thư (MS: 09050034), năm nay 33 tuổi. Chị là cán bộ phụ nữ trong thôn. Để phát triển kinh tế gia đình chị đã từng phải vay từ nhiều nguồn vốn khác nhau như Ngân hàng Nhà Nước, Ngân hàng Chính Sách Xã Hội. Nhưng khi được biết đến nguồn vốn của chương trinh, với hình thức tiết kiệm để hoàn trả. Chị đã tham gia vay C. kỳ một với mức 2.006.000 VND để chăn nuôi lợn. Nhờ đó sau khi bán lợn gia đình chị đã sửa sang được công trình phụ. Nay chị tiếp tục vay 3.360.000 VND ở C. kỳ II để đầu tư mua cám lợn.

Các thành viên khác trong nhóm:

  • Chị Ngô Thị Bình (MS: 09050027), vay 3.186.000 VND để bổ sung vốn nuôi lợn, nuôi tằm.
  • Chị Ngô Thi Bắc (MS:09050089), vay 3.186.000 VND để bổ sung vốn đi chợ.
  • Chị Ngô Thị Giang (MS: 09050039), vay 3.360.000 VND để bổ sung vốn nuôi lợn làm đậu.
  • Chị C. Thị Giao (MS: 09050037), vay 3.360.000 VND để bổ sung vốn nuôi tằm làm tơ.

loans.use: Chăn nuôi và buôn bán

loans.name: Ms. Trang's Group

texts.vi:
Ms. N. Thi Trang (MS: 09050048), is 57 years old. Ms. Trang’s group has finished paying back the loan of the first round. In the next round of loan, Ms. Trang would like to borrow 3.808.000 VND to invest into breeding pigs.

In her group:

-Ms. N. Thi Muon (MS: 09050049), would like to borrow 3.808.000 VND to breed silkworms.

-Ms. N. Thi Nga (MS: 0900050), would like to borrow 3.808.000 VND to invest into her carpentry business.

-Ms. N. Thi Loan (MS: 09050047) would like to borrow 3.808.000 VND to breed poultries.

-Ms. C. Thi Xuyen (MS: 09050046) would like to borrow 3.808.000 VND to breed poultries (chickens and pigs)

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa N., Kiva volunteer.

Cô Ngô Thị Trang (MS: 09050048), năm nay 57 tuổi. Cả nhóm cô đã tham gia C. kỳ I và đã hoàn trả rất tốt. Lần này tham gia C. kỳ II cô vay 3.808.000 VND để phát triển chăn nuôi lợn.

Trong nhóm cô còn có:

  • Nguyễn Thị Muộn (MS: 09050049), vay 3.808.000 VND để nuôi tằm làm tơ.
  • Ngô Thị Nga (MS: 09050050), vay 3.808.000 VND để phát triển nghề mộc.
  • Ngô Thi Loan (MS: 09050047), vay 3.808.000 VND để đầu tư chăn nuôi.
  • C. Thị Xuyên (MS: 09050046), vay 3.808.000 VND để chăn nuôi bò, lợn.

loans.use: Chăn nuôi

loans.name: Thi Phuong Nam's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thi Phuong Nam (ID Number 09050003), 26 years old, is a kindergarten teacher. However, as a hardworking woman, she also performs agricultural tasks, raises chickens and tailors clothes at home. Her husband sells decorative plants for a living. She has already repaid fully the first loan. This time, she would like to borrow 3,808,000VND to invest in raising chickens and selling decorative plants. Her group also consists of:
  • Mrs. N. Thi Thuat (ID Number 09050001), borrows 3,360,000VND to purchase more pigs to breed
  • Mrs. D. Thi Thao (ID Number 09050005), borrows 3,360,000VND to purchase more pigs to breed
  • Mrs. N. Thi Tho (ID Number 09050004), borrows 3,360,000VND to purchase pig feed
  • Mrs. N. Thi Thu (ID Number 09050002), borrows 2,006,000VND to purchase pig feed
  • Mrs. N. Thi Tan (ID Number 09050085), borrows 2,006,000VND to purchase pig feed
  • Mrs. N. Thi Luong (ID Number 09050087), borrows 2,006,000VND to raise livestock

    • The total amount requested is 1,200USD

    Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

    Chị Nguyễn Thị Phương Nam (MS: 09050003), năm nay 26 tuổi. Chị vừa là giáo viên mầm non nhưng chị khá chăm chỉ làm thêm ruộng, chăn nuôi gà và máy khâu tại nhà… Chồng chị bán cây cảnh. Chị đã hoàn trả tốt chu kỳ I. Nay vay 3.808.000 VND để bổ sung vốn nuôi gà, buôn cây cảnh.

    Trong nhóm chị còn có:

  • Chị Ngô Thị Luật (MS: 09050001), vay 3.360.000 VND để mua lợn giống.
  • Chị Đỗ Thị Thạo (MS: 09050005), vay 3.360.000 VND để mua lợn giống.
  • Chị Ngô Thị Thơ (MS: 09050004), vay 3.360.000 VND để mua cám lợn.
  • Chị Ngô Thị Thu (MS: 09050002), vay 2.006.000 VND để mua cám lợn.
  • Chị Ngô Thị Tân (MS: 09050085), vay 2.006.000 VND để mua cám lợn
  • Chị Ngô Thị Lương (MS: 09050087), vay 2.006.000 VND để phát triển chăn nuôi.

loans.use: Raising livestock

loans.name: Thi Thuy's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thi Thuy (ID Number 09050012), 31 years old, has 2 children. As a active and energetic woman, besides farming, she also breeds pigs and sells rice. She borrowed once before and has already repaid fully.This time, she would like to borrow 3,808,000VND to invest in purchasing more rice for her business. Her group also consists of:
  • Mrs. N. Thi Ha (ID Number 09050014), borrows 2,478,000 to invest in raising livestock
  • Mrs. N. Thi Tan (ID Number 09050016), borrows 2,478,000 to invest in her general store
  • Mrs. P. Thi Ha (ID Number 09050013), borrows 3,186,000 to invest in her general store
  • Mrs. N. Thi May (ID Number 09050088), borrows 2,242,000 to purchase more soy bean to make tofu

    • The total amount requested is 850.00USD

    Translated from Vietnamese by P. Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

    Chị Ngô Thị Thúy (MS: 09050012), năm nay 31 tuổi. Chị có hai con. Là một người rất năng động, N.ài làm ruộng chị còn nuôi lơn và buôn bán gạo. Chị đã vay vốn và hoàn trả chu kỳ I. Nay chị vay 3.808.000 VND của chu ky II để thêm vốn mua gạo buôn bán.

    Thành viên khác trong nhóm:

  • Chị Ngô Thị Hà (MS: 09050014), vay 2.478.000 để phát triển chăn nuôi.
  • Chị Ngô Thị Tân (MS: 09050016), vay 2.478.000 VND để bán hàng tạp hóa.
  • Chị Phạm Thị Hà (MS 09050013), vay 3.186.000 VND để bán hàng tạp hóa.
  • Chị Ngô Thị Mây (MS: 09050088), vay 2.242.000 VND để mua đỗ làm đậu phụ.

loans.use: Selling rice

loans.name: Thi Dung

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thi Dung (ID Number 09050084), 34 years old, has 2 school-going children. Besides farming, she also raises chickens as well as silkworms to get the cocoons and pupa for sale. She has never borrowed from anywhere else, but because she likes the fact that by joining this Fund she can repay the loan on an installment basis, she would like to borrow 2,006,000VND (125 USD) to purchase more silkworms for her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Ngô Thị Dung (MS: 09050084), năm nay 34 tuổi. Chị có hai con còn đang đi học. Chị làm ruộng, nuôi gà mua tơ về cắt kén để bán nhộng, bán kén. Chị Chưa từng vay vốn ở đâu. Nay vì thích hình thức tiết kiệm để hoàn trả của chương trình nên đã tham gia vay 2.006.000 VND để bổ sung vốn mau kén về làm bán.

loans.use: Raising silkworms

loans.name: Abdunazar

texts.ru:
Abdunazar Davlaytov lives in the Rudaki region of Tajikistan. He is 42 years old and is married with three children. He has a university degree in agriculture. For the past five years Abdunazar has been working in animal husbandry. He grows cows. He buys bull calves and sends them to the pastures. After the bull calves return, Abdunazar sells them at a profit at the market. The profit helps him provide for his family. Abdunazar would like to use the loan for buying another bull calf. Abdunazar plans to repay the loan in the next three months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva volunteer.

Давлятов Абдуназар житель района Рудаки. Возраст 42 года, женат, имеет 3 детей. Образование высшее, по специальности агроном. Абдуназар занмается животноводством. Имеет опыт в этом бизнесе 5 лет. Он разводит крупны рогатый скот. Купив на рынке молодых бычков ,он отправляет их на пастбище .После их возвращения клиент продает их на рынке по более выгодно ему цене. На доход от этого бизнеса он содержит свою семью. Сейчас клиент хочет купить очередного бычка на кредит, а планирует погасить кредит в течение 3 месяцев.

loans.use: to buy a bull calf

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is a married woman. Every day, she works from 8am to 18pm at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $250.

In the past, Angela has taken out two successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Angela now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Rustamjon

texts.ru:
Rustamjon S. lives in the Rudaki region of Tajikistan. He is 50 years old and is married with 5 children. He has a university degree in construction engineering. For the past ten years he has been working in animal husbandry. He buys young bull calves and feeds them for about 40-45 days before selling them at a profit at the market. This work helps him provide for his big family. At present Rustamjon would like to buy another bull calf. Therefore he would like to obtain a loan for three months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva volunteer.

Шарипов Рустамджон - житель района Рудаки. Возраст 50 лет, женат , имеет 5 детей. Образование высшее, по специальности инженер-строитель.Клиент занимается животноводством более 10 лет. Он покупает на рынке молодых бычков и откармливает их 40-45 дней и прдает на рынке по выгодной ему цене. Этот вид деятельности позволяет ему содержать его большую семью. В данный момент клиент хочет купить еще одного бычка для откормки.Для этого он берет кредит сроком на 3 месяца.

loans.use: to buy a bull calf

loans.name: Ahmadjon

texts.ru:
Ahmadjon H. lives in the Rudaki region. He is 44 years old, is married and has 5 children. Ahmadjon has a college education and is a teacher by profession. He raises livestock and has 5 years of experience in this area. Ahmadjon purchases young calves at the market, fattens them and resells them at the market for a profit. This business is the sole source of income for his family. Ahmadjon’s wife is a housewife; she raises the children and takes care of the household.

Ahmadjon would like to by another calf to fatten and requires a loan. He has decided to take out a loan for a 3 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Хасанов Ахмаджон житель района Рудаки. Возраст 44 года,женат , имеет 5 детей.Образование высшее,по специальности учитель.Клиент занимается животноводством. Имеет опыт в этом деле более 5 лет.Ахмаджон покупает на рынке молодых бычков , откармливает их и перепродает на рынке по выгодной ему цене.Этот вид деятельности является единственым источником дохода его большой семьи.Так как жена клиента домохозяйка,она воспитывает детей и ведет хозяйство.Сейчас клиент хочет купить очередного бычка для откормки для чего ему нужны деньги.Ахмаджон решил взять кредит срокомна 3 месяца.

loans.use: Purchase a calf

loans.name: Raimbek

texts.ru:
Raimbek O. lives in the Rudaki region. He is married and has 4 children. Raimbek has a college education and is a teacher by profession. He does not work in his profession and instead purchases and sells fruits and melons. It is currently the season for melons and watermelons and Raimbek would like to purchase products for sale. After discussing it with those close to him, Raimbek decided to take out a 12 month loan. By filling his sales location with goods, Raimbek will increase his income.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Одинаев Раимбек житель района Рудаки. Женат ,имеет 4 детей. Образование высшее, по специальности учитель.Но по специальности на работает, клиент занимается кплей продажей фруктов и бахчевых культур.Так как сейчас сезон продажи дынь и арбузов клиент хочет закупить товар.Посоветовавшись с близкими клиент решил взять кредит сроком на 12 месяц.Пополнив товаром свою торговую точку Раимбек будет получать больше дохода .

loans.use: Purchase melons and watermelons for sale

loans.name: Safina's Mto Group

texts.en:
Safina is 49 years old. She is a married woman with three children aged 21, 19, and 15. She also takes care of three other children. She became a chicken seller in 1994. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $500.

In the past, Safina has taken out two successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Safina now hopes for a loan to buy more chickens for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with selling chickens, spears, vegetables, and milk.

loans.use: To buy more chicken for her business.

loans.name: Habohon

texts.ru:
Habohon A. lives in the Shahrinav region. She is 45 yeas old, is married and has 4 children. Habohon is a nurse by profession, but since nursing salaries are very small, she purchases and sells vegetables. She has a sales location at the market and has been in this business for 27 years. She purchases vegetables from peasants and resells them at retail prices.

Habohon would like to increase her product assortment. To do this she has applied for a 12 month loan.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Абдулоева Хабохон жительница района Шахринав.Возраст 45 лет , замужем ,имеет 4 детей.По образованию медицинская сестра. Но так как заработная плата очень маленькая ,клиентка занимается куплей продажей овощей .Она имеет торговую точку на рынке .Занимается этим видом деятельности более 27 лет . Она скупает у крестьян овощи и риелизует в розницу. В данныей момент клиентка хочет увеличить ассортимент торговой точки.Но для этого ей нужны деньги .Поэтому она решила взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase product assortment

loans.name: Rofiya

texts.ru:
Rofiya H. lives in the J. Rumy region. She is 46 years old, is a widow and has 3 children. Rofiya has a high school education. She purchases and sells food items. Rofiya has a small sales location at the central market. She has 6 years of experience in this business. Rofiya uses the income from her business to support her large family. She would like to increase the product selection at her sales location. Rofiya has decided to take out an 8 month loan for this purpose.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Хамидова Рофия жительница района Румй. Возраст 46 лет , вдова , имеет 3 детей.Образование среднее .Клиентка занимается куплей продажей продуктов питания. На центральном рынке района она имеет небольшую торговую точку. Имеет опыт в этом бизнесе более 6 лет . На доходы от этого бизнеса она содержит свою большую семью. В данный момент Рофия хочет увеличить ассортимент своей торговой точки.Для чего ей нужны деньги и она решилда взять кредит сроком на 8 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase product assortment

loans.name: Kuvondik

texts.ru:
Kuvondik T. lives in the J. Rumy region. He is 47 years old, is married and has 6 children. He has a high school education. For more than 23 years now he has been working in agriculture. Kuvondik loves his job very much, every year he collects two harvests on his plot of land. This business is the sole source of income for his large and happy family. He uses some of the harvest for his family and sells the rest at the market. He would like to take out a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Тагайназаров Кувондик Гулмахмадович житель района Румй.Возраст 47 лет , женат , имеет 6 детей.Образование среднее. Вот уже более 23 лет клиент занимается сельским хозяйством. Кувондик очень любит свою работу, каждый год на своем земельном участке он собирает по 2 урожая.Этот вид деятельности является единственным источником дохода его большой и дружной семьи. Нужное он использует в нуждах своей семьи , а остальной урожай реализует на рынке. В данный момент клиент хочет купить семена и минеральные удобрения для получения

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Zulfira

texts.ru:
Zulfira K. lives in the J. Rumy region. She is 44 years old, is married and has 4 children. Zulfira has a high school education. She has a sales location at the local market where she sells fruits and vegetables. This business is the only source of income for her large family. Zulfira purchases vegetables from wholesale suppliers and then sells them at a higher price. Local residents know that they can always purchase quality products from Zulfira. She would like to expand her business and needs a loan to do this. She has decided to take out a 3 month loan for this purpose.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Касумова Зульфира жительница района Руми .Возраст 44 года,замужем,имеет 4 детей.Образование среднее.Клиентка занимается имеет торговую точку на местном рынке.Где торгует овощами и фруктами. Этот вид деятельности является единственным и основным источником дохода ее большой семьи.Зульфира скупает у оптовых поставщиков овощи дешевле ,а затем реализует в розницу. Местные жители знают,что у Зульфиры всегда можно купить качественный товар. В данный момент клиентка хочет расширить свой бизнес, для чего ей нужны деньги .И она решила взять криедит сроком на 3 месяца.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Sioni

texts.en:
Sioni is a married woman with three children aged 4, 6, and 8. In 2002, she opened a small store with groceries and clothes. Every day, she works from 10am to 4pm at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

Sioni now hopes for a loan to buy more beer, soda. and clothes for her store.

loans.use: To buy more beer, soda, and clothes to increase her store.

loans.name: Magreth

texts.en:
Magreth is 32 years old. She is a married woman with two children aged 11 and 7. She owns a small shop which she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 6am to 9pm at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $400 from her sales.

Magreth now hopes for a loan to buy more items (such as rice, sugar, and kerosene) for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her shop.

loans.name: Fotima.

texts.ru:
Fotima Shokrirova lives in the are Rudaki. She is 36 years old, married and has 4 children. She has a high school education. To provide for her family she needs to work a lot. She owns a store, where she trades food products. She wants to increase commodity circulation, and wants to bring in new goods for the start of the school season. She wants to bring in writing goods. To be able to do this she plans to receive a loan that she will repay in 12 months. This will help her earn an income in the trade season and allow her to spend the money on her children.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Шокирова Фотима живет в районе Рудаки. Возраст 36 лет. Она замужем и имеет четверых детей.Образование среднее. Для того , чтобы обеспечить семью ей приходится много работать . Имеет магазин , где торгует продуктами питания. Хочет увеличить товарооборот.Привезти новый товар к школьному сезону. Хочет привезти канцелярские товары. Для этого она планирует получить кредит сроком на 12 месяцев. Это поможет ей заработать в сезон торговли , и заработанные деньги использовать для детей.

loans.use: Increase commodity circulation

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 46 years old. She is a married woman with seven children between the ages of 7 and 24. She became a snacks seller in 2006. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Amina now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Flora's Chapakazi Group

texts.en:
