Flora is 39 years old. She is a married woman with three children aged 20,14, and 12. She became a charcoal seller in 2002. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $200 from her sales.

Flora now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member who sells clothes and coconuts.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Apaikunda's Usa River Group

texts.en:
Apaikunda is 45 years old. She is a married woman with four children between the ages of 13 and 26. She became a food and fruits seller in 2005. Every day, she works from 8am to 7pm at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

Apaikunda now hopes for a loan to buy more food and fruits for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, who also has a kiosk business (mini shop) and sells bananas.

loans.use: To buy more food items and fruits to increase her stock.

loans.name: Gulnora.

texts.ru:
Gulnora S. lives in the are of Rudaki. She is married and has no children. She works as a teacher in the area's high school. In her spare time she is engaged in agriculture. Now she wants to receive a loan so that she can buy a cow. The cow is essential to receive milk for her elderly parents. She plans to repay the loan within 12 months. After the loan is payed the cow will stay with her and she will be able to engage in animal industries.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Шокирова Гульнора живет в районе Рудаки. Замужем , детей не имеет. Работает учителем в средней школе района. В свободное время занимается земледелием . А теперь хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы купить корову. Корова ей необходима для получения молока , для старых родителей. Погашать кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев. После погашения кредита корова останется у нее и она сможет занятся и животноводством .

loans.use: Purchase of a cow

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is 30 years old. She is a married woman with a 7 year-old child. She became a clothes seller in 2007. Every day, she works from 7am to 12pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Paulina now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.id:
Juliana (37), her husband, Mohammad Amin and their two children, Alfan and Heni live at Imam Bonjol Street, Denpasar, Bali. They rent a room to live in for IDR 175 thousand per month (around USD 22/month). Juliana sells cooked rice for living. Every morning she goes to local market to buy the ingredients such as vegetables, fish and chicken. She then cooks them and sells the cooked rice to the nearby places.

Her business calculation is very simple. She spends IDR 20 thousand per day and therefore she needs to earn more than that everyday.

She hopes she can expand her business by having the loan money. With it she is hoping to be able to send her children to school.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva volunteer.

Juliana (37) saat ini tinggal di Jl.Imam Bonjol Denpasar bersama suaminya Mohammad Amin dan 2 orang anaknya, Alfan dan Heni. Suaminya berprofesi sebagai disebuah perkantoran di Denpasar. Mereka mengontrak sebuah kamar dengan membayar 175.000 per bulan. Usaha yang dijalani oleh Juliana sehari-hari adalah sebagai penjual nasi bungkus. Pada pagi hari dia harus berangkat ke Pasar untuk belanja kabutuhan jualan, seperti sayur dan ikan atau daging ayam. Setelah itu dia pulang dan mulai memasak. Sampai sore dia menjajakan jualannya dengan berkeliling, atau menitipkan diwarung lain dengan membayar sesuai banyaknya nasi yang terjual. Untuk biaya hidup sehari-harinya, dia menghabiskan sekitar 20.000. Oleh karena itu dia harus bisa mendapatkan penghasilan bersih dalam satu hari lebih dari 20.000. Rencananya pinjaman kali akan dipakai sebagai modal tambahan untuk usahanya. Diharapkan, keuntungan yang didapat bisa dipakai untuk menyekolahkan anaknya.

loans.use: To add working capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for DINARI Foundation - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mrs. Mai V., a widowed resident of  Prerak Takeo Village in Kandal Province, is a grocer in the local market.   Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it and is therefore requesting a loan to buy more grocery goods to sell to her customers. Mrs. Mai V. hopes to increase her business profits and improve her living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Angelista's Bahati Group

texts.en:
Angelista is a married woman with three children aged 32, 39, and 24. She is a chicken seller. Every day, she works from 6am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $400 from her sales.

Angelista now hopes for a loan to buy more chickens for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member who has business dealing with hardware sales.

loans.use: To buy more chicken for her business.

loans.name: Van Tai's Group

texts.vi:
This is the first time Mr. N. Van Tai (ID Number 060035), 45 years old, joins the SEDA Fund. He would like to borrow 2,950,000VND to purchase more rice to seperate the husk from the rice. The rice bran is used as pig feed while Mr. Tai sells off the rice. As a active woM., his wife also helps him a lot in this. He has 2 children working as factory workers and thus, they contribute to the family's income. Mr. Tai really likes to join this Fund because he can repay the loan on an installment basis. His family's average daily income is about 150,000VND (about 9.50USD). His group also consists of:
  • Mrs. M. Thi Hoa (ID Number 060037), borrows 2,242,000VND to purchase wood to make furniture
  • Mrs. N. Thi Hue (ID Number 060036), borrows 2,006,000VND to purchase materials to tailor clothes
  • Mrs. N. Thi Minh (ID Number 060039), borrows 2,950,000VND to purchase pig feed
  • Mrs. M. Thi Luyen (ID Number 060038), borrows 2,950,000VND to purchase more food for her breakfast eatery

    • The total amount requested is 800USD

    Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

    Chú Nguyễn Văn Tài (MS: 060035), năm nay 45 tuổi. Chú tham gia vay vốn lần đầu tiên. Chú vay 2.950.000 VND về mua thóc xay sát để lấy cám nuôi lợn còn gạo để bán. Vợ anh là người rất năng động giúp anh rất nhiều trong công việc xay sát. Anh có hai con đang đi làm công nhân, cũng giúp gia đình anh có thêm thu nhập. Anh rất thích tham gia chương vay vốn vì được trả dần. Mức thu nhập của gia đình anh là khoảng 150.000 VND.

    Trong nhóm còn có:

  • Chị Mẫn Thị Hòa (MS: 060037), vay 2.242.000 VND để mua gỗ làm bàn ghế.
  • Chị Nguyễn Thị Huệ (MS: 060036), vay 2.006.000 VND để mua vải may quần áo bán.
  • Chị Nguyễn Thị Minh (MS: 060039), vay 2.950.000 VND để mua cám chăn nuôi lợn.
  • Chị Mẫn Thị Luyến (MS: 060038), vay 2.950.000 VND để mua đồ về bán hàng ăn sáng.

loans.use: Buying rice

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Mrs. Seng K. is a wedding chef in Preak Takeo Village in Kandal Province who very much enjoys her business of cooking delicious meals for wedding guests, while her husband, Mr. Thol Nov, is a house constructor in the  village. Although Mrs. Seng K. and her husband both have business activities, they still cannot afford to complete their new house. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to finish it. She and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To complete construction of her new house.

loans.name: Thi Hoat's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. T. Thi Hoat (ID Number 060040), 53 years old, would like to borrow 2,950,000VND to invest in rasing chickens. She has two children who are already working to add in to the family's income. Mrs. Hoat likes to join this Fund because she can repay the loan on an installment basis and so she can save. Her family's average daily income is about 130,000VND (about 8.30USD). Her group also consists of:
  • Mrs. M. Thi Thanh (ID Number 060041), wants to borrow 2,006,000VND to purchase wood to make furniture
  • Mrs. N. Thi Nga (ID Number 060042), wants to borrow 2,950,000VND to purchase pig feed
  • Mrs. N. Thi Dan (ID Number 060043), wants to borrow 2,950,000VND to purchase pig feed
  • Mr. M. Ba Nguyet (ID Number 060044), wants to borrow 2,950,000VND to raise pig and hens
  • The total amount requested is 825.00USD

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

    Cô Trương Thị Hoạt (MS: 060040), năm nay 53 tuổi. Cô vay 2.950.000 VND để về nuôi gà thịt. Cô có hai con đã đi làm tạo thêm thu nhập cho gia đình. Cô thích tham gia vì được trả dần và được tiết kiệm. Mức thu nhập của gia đình chị khoảng 130.000 VND/ ngày

    Trong nhóm còn có:

  • Chị Mẫn Thị Thanh (MS: 060041), vay 2.006.000 VND để mua gỗ đóng bàn ghế bán.
  • Chị Nguyễn Thị Nga (MS: 060042), vay 2.950.000 VND để mua cám chăn nuôi lợn.
  • Chị Nguyễn Thị Đản (MS: 060043), vay 2.950.000 VND về mua cám chăn nuôi lợn.
  • Anh Mẫn Bá Nguyệt (MS: 060044), vay 2.950.000 VND để chăn nuôi lợn thịt và gà đẻ trứng.

loans.use: Raising livestock

loans.name: Channa

texts.en: Mrs. Channa P., a 27-year-old mother of a  preschool-aged child, lives in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province, where she works in a garment factory. Her husband, Mr. Vicheka Saom, is a construction worker who has difficulty traveling to work because it is so far from his house. Thus, Mrs. Channa P. is  requesting a loan to buy a motorbike for him to commute to work.  Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to travel to work.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina is a married woman with a 6-year-old child. She became a clothes seller in 2002. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

Selina now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr:
Ousmane A. is 49 years old, married and the father of 3 children, all of whom attend school. He has lived for many years in Assahoun, a village located approximately 50 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. Being a food merchant, he wishes to use this loan to increase his business capital which will allow him to then increase his stock of merchandise. The profits from his business will allow him to meet the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer.

Ousmane A. est âgé de 49 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants tous à l’école. Il est depuis des années à Assahoun, un village situé à environ 50 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il souhaite par ce crédit augmenter son fond de commerce pouvant lui permettre de augmenter son stock de marchandises étant un particulier commerçant d’alimentation générale. Les gains issus de son activité permettront à monsieur Ousmane de réaliser plus de bénéfice et de faire face aux besoins de sa famille

loans.use: To increase his stock of merchandise

loans.name: Vath

texts.en: Mrs. Vath P., a mother of two children, one a driver and the other a garment factory employee, owns a small soup restaurant in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province.  Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it, and so is requesting a loan to buy more ingredients to cook delicious meals for her customers. Her husband, Mr. An Eth, is a government officer who can only generate a small salary to support his family. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients to cook delicious meals for her customers.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is single woman. She has a house keeping and retail business. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $130 from her sales.

Joyce now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items to increase her inventory

loans.name: Chanthol

texts.en: Mrs. Chanthol P., a mother of four children who all attend school, is a fruit seller in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province. Her husband, Mr. Vannary Suon, is a construction worker and motorbike-taxi driver. Although the family members have a variety of business activities, they still live in an old house. Therefore, Mrs. Chanthol P. has decided to ask for a loan to fix up her house in order to improve their living conditions. Her husband is on the right of the picture.

loans.use: To repair her house in order to improve her living conditions.

loans.name: Chany

texts.en: Mrs. Chany Y., a 35-year-old widow with three children who are all enrolled in school, lives in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province, where she sells dry fish in the local market. Since her business is doing well, she is asking for a loan to buy more dry fish to resell. With this loan, Mrs. Chany Y. hopes to increase her business profits and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more dry fish for resale.

loans.name: Nyinisaely's Chicken & Milk Seller Group

texts.en:
Nyinisaely is a single woman with five children between the ages of 28 and 39. She became a chicken and milk seller in 2000. Every day, she works from 7am to 12pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $150 from her sales.

Nyinisaely now hopes for a loan to buy more chickens and milk for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member who has business selling clothes.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and milk for her business.

loans.name: Norm

texts.en: Mrs. Norm P.,  of Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province, is a 42-year-old  mother of three children who are all attending school.   A tailor,  Mrs. Norm P. faces a small problem because her current sewing machine is very old and in need of repair.  Without it she cannot make any money, so she has decided to ask for a loan to purchase a new one in order to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Kun An, is a motorbike-taxi driver.  Mrs. Norm P. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine in order to support her family.

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr:
Komi N. is 52 years old, married and the father of 4 children. Mr. N. and his family have lived for a number of years in Assahoun, a village located approximately 50 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this third loan, he wishes to purchase a new motor in order to limit the expenditure created by his old one. By doing this he will be able to save more money and better provide for the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer.

Komi N. est âgé de 52 ans, marié et Père de 4 enfants. M. Komi et sa famille vivent depuis des années à Assahoun, un village situé à environ 50 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Avec ce troisième crédit, il désire acheter un nouveau moteur pour limiter les dépenses engendrées par ce dernier afin de mieux épargner pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: The purchase of a new motor

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr:
Akou A. is 37 years old, married and the mother of one child. For three years she has been buying and reselling jewelry in Assahoun, a village located approximately 50 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this second loan she would like to purchase more jewelry in order to meet the demand of her growing clientele. The profits she earns from this work will allow her to take care of some of the needs of her household.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer.

Akou A. est âgée de 37 ans, mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle achète et revend depuis 3 ans en détail des bijoux à Assahoun, un village situé à environ 50 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle souhaite par ce second crédit acheter de nouveaux bijoux pouvant répondre à l’attente de sa clientèle qui devient de plus en plus exigeante. Les profits tirés de son activité lui permettront de prendre en charge une partie des besoins de son foyer.

loans.use: To purchase more jewelry

loans.name: Jean

texts.fr:
Jean A. is a 42 year old married father of 3 children, 2 of whom are in apprenticeship and 1 who is in school. He works in the field of lumber and has owned, for a short time, his small timber business in Assahoun, a village located approximately 50 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. Jean is a faithful client of FECECAV and is requesting his second loan to purchase more timber for resale in order to earn more profits and care for the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

Jean A. est âgé de 42 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants dont 2 sont en apprentissage et 1 à l’école. Il est dans le bois et tient son petit commerce de planches depuis quelques temps à Assahoun, un village situé à environ 50 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Jean est un client fidèle de FECECAV car il est à son deuxième crédit et souhaite par ce dernier acheter plus de planches pour la revente afin de dégager plus de profits et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To purchase timber for resale

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr:
Ama V. is 40 years old, married and the mother of 3 children. She lives in Assahoun, a village located 50 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. For many years Mrs. V. has worked as a retail merchant of food products. With this second loan, she hopes to increase her stock of peanuts, millets, beans and other foods for resale and increase the capacity of her business. The profits from her work will allow her to better meet the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer.

Ama V. est âgée de 40 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Il habite à Assahoun, un village situé à environ 50 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Madame est revendeuse de produits vivriers depuis des années. Avec ce second crédit, elle souhaite faire davantage de stocks de arachide, de mil, du haricot et autres pour la revente et augmenter la capacité de son commerce. Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To increase stocks of peanuts, millets, beans and other foods for resale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FECECAV - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Roukéya

texts.fr:
Born in Kpalimé, a plateau town in Togo on December 31, 1972, Mrs. Roukéya A. is married and the mother of 4 children. She is a sales person and has a food service business in the Agoè district of Lomé.

She began this business in 2001 and has lots of customers since her business is situated where there is a bus station and a service station. Lots of motor-taxi drivers and chauffeurs eat at her place because she offers a wide selection of foods such as rice, beans, corn porridge, and drinks.

She is requesting this first loan to buy 5 sacks of rice, 3 sacks of dried beans, 15 cases of drinks, and condiments. In this way, she will be able to improve her service and earn a lot from her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née à Kpalimé, ville de la région des plateaux au Togo le 31 décembre 1972, madame A. Roukéya est une femme mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants. Elle est une revendeuse et exerce l’activité de restauration dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé.

Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 2001 et accueille beaucoup de clients car elle est située dans un endroit où sont localisées une gare routière et une station d’essence. Beaucoup de conducteurs de taxis-moto et des chauffeurs déjeunent chez elle car elle offre une gamme variée de nourriture telle le riz, le haricot, la pâte de maïs et la boisson.

Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter cinq (5) sacs de riz, trois (3) sacs du haricot, quinze (15) casiers de boissons et des condiments. Ainsi elle pourra améliorer son service et tirer beaucoup de revenus.

loans.use:
Purchase of rice, dried beans, and condiments

Achat de riz du haricot et de condiments

loans.name: Shamigul .

texts.ru:
Shamigul A. lives in the city of Yavan. She works at the marketplace "Tichorat". She trades womens clothing there. She has been engaged in this type of business for 7 years. For the school fair, Shamigul plans to receive a loan and purchase school supplies. This will help her earn money during the season, so that she can use the income to help her family. She is the sole provider for her four children, because her husband does not work and it is essential for her to develop her business. She plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Алиева Шамигуль проживает в городе Яван. Работает на рынке «Тичорат». Торгует женской одеждой.Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже семь лет. К школьной ярмарке Шамигуль планирует получить кредит и привезти школьный товар. Это поможет заработать в сезон . Прибыль использует для семьи . Ведь она одна обеспечивает четверых детей. Муж нигде не работает и ей нкеобходимо развивать свой бизнес для того . Полгасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase commodity circulation

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 29 years old. She is a married woman with 1 child, age 4. She became a battery seller in 2000. Every day she works from 8:00 AM to 12:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

Martha now hopes for a loan to buy more batteries for her business.

loans.use: To buy more batteries for her business

loans.name: Mavludahon

texts.ru:
Mavludahon J. lives in the area of Rudaki. She is married and has 4 children, and has a high school education. She is 32 years old and lives with her family, and the parents of her husband. To be able to help her husband provide for his family, she is engaged in plant growing and animal raising. She want to prepare the land for the new planting season and that is why she wishes to take out a loan so that she can purchase seed and fertilizer. She plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Джолматова Мавлюдахон проживает а районе Рудаки. Замужем и имеет четверых детей. Образование среднее . Возраст 32 года. Живет со своей семьей. Замужем и имеет четверых детей. Кроме того с ней живут родители мужа. Для того , чтобы помочь мужу обеспечивать семью , занимается растениеводством и животноводством.Хочет подготовить земли к новому посевному сезону. Поэтому решила получить кредит для закупки семян и удобрений. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Musayam

texts.ru:
Musayam Tolivov lives in the city of Yavan. Since he was 16 years old he has been engaged in business to help his mother feed his large family, which consists of 5 other sisters and brothers. In the current moment he is married, and is waiting for the birth of his child. To be able to provide for his family he has engaged in trade. He owns a shop, where he trades spare parts for cars. He wants to receive a loan so that he can increase his assortment of spare parts. He plans to obtain building materials. He plans to repay the loan within 8 months. This will help him receive additional income and also provide his town with needed materials.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Толибов Мусаям житель города Яван. С 16 лет занялся бизнесом для того , чтобы помогать матери прокормить большую семью . Ведь у него кроме него имеется пятеро сестер и братьев. В данный момент он женился и ждет своего ребенка . Для того , чтобы обеспечивать семью занимается торговлей. Имеет магазин , где торгует запасными частями для легковых автомобилей. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы увеличить ассортимент товара. Планирует завести стройматериалы. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 8 месяцев. Это поможет получить дополнительную прибыль и кроме того обеспечить население необходимыми товарами.

loans.use: Increase Commodity Circulation

loans.name: Happiness's Nyoya Njema Group

texts.en:
Happiness is 38 years old. She is a married woman with 4 children, ages 15, 13, 11, and 7. She also takes care of 2 other people, ages 32 and 7. She owns a minivan and taxi. Every day she works from 5:00 AM to 9:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $350 from her sales.

Happiness now hopes for a loan to start a new business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, who has a business dealing with clothing and vegetable sales.

loans.use: To start a new business (a clothing shop)

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 44 years old and is married with five children. Among her children, three have completed their senior high school. Josephine is a very resourceful wife and mother whose hard work brings increased livelihood to her family. Josephine supports her husband in providing for the household through the sale of used clothing.

There is a very big market for used clothing in Ghana as brand new clothes are too expensive for the economically poor. As such, there is a market for many women like Josephine who sell used clothing. Josephine wants a loan to buy more bales of used clothing to increase her inventory. She believes this loan would help her save for her children’s future and would also allow her to rent a trading store. She is member of the community trust group called “Ebe ba mu” (It has shall come pass.) Members agree to guarantee loans for each other via social collateral and assist one another in repaying the loans.

loans.use: To buy bales of used clothing to increase inventory.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida is married with two school-aged children. She is 32 years old and owns and operates a grocery shop in the local market. Vida sells items such as rice, evaporated milk, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, washing powder, toilet soaps, candies, and biscuits. She wants a loan to buy bulk supplies of rice, canned foods and drinks, milk, assorted food spices, washing soaps and powders to expand her business.

Vida hopes to increase her income from the expanded business in order to provide her children with a quality education. She belongs to the community trust group called “Ebe ba mu” (It shall come to pass.) The group guarantees loans through shared repayment pledges and provides assistance for members to repay their loans.

loans.use: To purchase bulk supply groceries such as rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, canned foods, peanuts, and evaporated milk to expand her business.

loans.name: Irna

texts.en:
Irna is a 24 year old woman from the village Tojsici, near the town Kolesija. She is married with one 2 year old child. Her husband works, but his income is less than $400 USD a month, and this is not enough to meet their monthly living expenses. As such, Irna has decided to start her own business selling cosmetics through Avon.

She will use this loan to buy a good selection of makeup, lotions, face creams, and other products to sell around town. Initially, Irna will save part of her loan to make sure that if these sales don’t work out she can invest the money in something else more profitable. If sales do well in the next few months, Irna will invest the remainder of the loan in buying more cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: To start a cosmetic sales business.

loans.name: Anna's Wema Group

texts.en:
Anna is 24 years old. She is a married woman with 1 child, age 1. She owns a small shop, which she started in 2007. Every day she works from 8:00 AM to 12:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Anna now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with fish sales and vegetable sales.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr:
Mr. Yao A. was born on December 31, 1967 in Attitogon in the Lake Prefecture in the south of Togo. He is married and the father of 3 children. He sells frozen foods in the Bè district of Lomé.

The location of his shop causes him to do a brisk business since he was the first to open this sort of fish shop in his neighborhood.

This first loan that he is requesting will allow him to purchase 12 cases of fish so that he can expand his stock and better serve his customers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur A. Yao est né le 31 décembre 1967 à Attitogon dans la préfecture des lacs au sud du Togo. Il est marié et père de trois (3) enfants. Il est revendeur des produits congelés dans le quartier de Bè à Lomé.

Sa situation géographique lui permet de bien vendre car il est le premier à ouvert ce genre de poissonnerie dans son quartier.

Ce premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter douze (12) cartons de poissons afin d’augmenter son stock et de mieux servir ses clients.

loans.use:
Purchase of frozen fish

Achat de poissons congélés

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a single woman with 1 child, age 10. She owns a small grocery, which she started in 2007. Every day she works from 10:00 AM to 11:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Esther now hopes for a loan to buy more grocery items (beer) for her business.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items to increase her stock

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is 50 years old. He is married with eight children who are all in school. He is an electric welder and a retailer of car spare parts and scrap metal. He buys his supplies from spare parts dealers and then sells them to his customers. He enjoys his trade very much, but he is lacking in adequate working capital to allow him to expand his business. He therefore needs a loan to inject additional capital into his business to cover his funding challenges.

Timothy wants to use the loan to buy additional stock of spare parts and scrap metal to serve his customers. Timothy hopes to increase his savings to pay for his children's education. He is a member of the community trust group called “Ebe ba mu” (It shall come to pass.) In this group, members guarantee loans for one another via social collateral and assist one another in repaying the loans. In the photo, Timothy is attending a Ebe ba mu group meeting.

loans.use: To buy additional spare parts and scrap metal to expand his business.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is thirty eight years old. He is married with two children aged 6 and 4 years old. Eric has been a block layer for the past five years. Eric's work is the main source of livelihood for his family. He owns a block laying station where he takes customers' orders.

Eric desires a loan to enable him to procure additional block laying tools and materials such as shovels, wooden boxes, and laying machines to expand his operations. He believes this will help him to increase his savings and take care of his children's schooling. He belongs to the community trust group called “Ebe ba mu” (meaning it shall come to pass.) In this group, members help guarantee loans for one another through social collateral and assist one another in repaying the loans.

loans.use:
To procure additional block laying tools and materials such as shovels, wooden 
boxes, and laying machines.

loans.name: Sedika

texts.en:
Sedika is a 46 year old woman from Puracić, located near the town Lukavac. She is married with one son, who is pictured here and will be entering the 5th grade next year. While her husband is employed, he was recently injured and is temporarily on sick leave. He receives some compensation while he misses work, but not his full monthly salary.

This is Sedika’s first loan with Žene za Žene, and she has requested 1200 KM. She will use this loan to buy land where she can cultivate strawberries. Sedika already has a small stretch of land where she grows strawberries currently, but she wants to plant and grow more on a regular basis. However she doesn’t want to rent land, as she believes that renting will be a waste of money in the long run. Sedika hopes that using this loan to buy more land will be a good investment for her and her family’s future.

loans.use: To buy a new field for planting and growing strawberries.

loans.name: Tatu's Nuru Group

texts.en:
Tatu is 25 years old. She is a married woman with 2 children, ages 6 and 2. She owns a clothing shop, which she started in 1999. Every day she works from 8:00 AM to 10:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $350 from her sales.

Tatu now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, who has a business dealing with snack sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Lucy's Kanan Group

texts.en:
Lucy is 39 years old. She is a married woman with 3 children, ages 13, 12, and 6. She owns a small salon, which she started in 2001. Every day she works from 8:00 AM to 10:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

Lucy now hopes for a loan to buy more salon items (cosmetics) for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with a shop, a salon, clothes sales, and tailoring.

loans.use: To buy more salon items (cosmetics) for her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Mersija

texts.en:
Mersija is a 33 year old woman from Tojsici, a small village outside the town Kolesija. She is married and has two children, aged 11 and 13 years old. Mersija and her husband run a small convenience store. Like many Bosnians, Mersija also practices subsistence farming—growing food in her home garden to feed her family. She and her husband also raise cattle and breed poultry to earn additional income.

For her first loan from Zene za Zene, Mersija has requested 1000 KM. Part of this loan she will use to buy more chickens to fatten and sell, and the rest she will use to purchase additional inventory for her small shop. Mersijia hopes these investments will increase their overall family income. With two growing kids it seems their expenses go up every year, and she wants to make sure their earnings can keep up.

loans.use: To buy chickens and other goods to increase the inventory of her convenience store.

loans.name: Towanou Mathieu

texts.fr:
Born on July 16, 1966 in the village of Kpékplémé in the prefecture of Haho, Mr. Towanou Mathieu D. is married and the father of three children. He is a salesman and lives in the Agbalépédo neighborhood of Lomé. He sells curtains, fabrics, bed sheets and towels. Generally this type of business is operated by women, but for him it is a passion. He has benefited from one loan and fully reimbursed it. He is requesting this second loan to buy 14 rolls of fabric, one box of sheets and some towels. He gets his supplies at the large market in Lomé and sells them in his own neighborhood in order to make a profit and earn a living.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer.

Né le 16 juillet 1966 dans le village de Kpékplémé dans la préfecture de Haho, monsieur D. Towanou Mathieu est marié et père de trois (3) enfants. Il est revendeur et réside dans le quartier d’Agbalépédo à Lomé. Il vend des rideaux, des tissus, des draps et des serviettes. Généralement ce commerce est exercé par les femmes mais constitue pour lui une passion. Il a une fois bénéficié du crédit et a bien remboursé. Il sollicite ce second crédit pour acheter 14 rouleaux de tissus, 1 carton de draps et des serviettes. Il s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et revend dans son quartier de provenance afin de tirer des bénéfices et de pouvoir gagner sa vie.

loans.use: Purchase of fabrics and sheets.

loans.name: Aisha's Bidii Group

texts.en:
Aisha is 26 years old. She is a single woman with 3 children, ages 13, 10, and 1. She became a food seller in 2007. Every day she works from 8:00 AM to 12:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

Aisha now hopes for a loan to buy more rice, maize flour, meat, vegetables, and bananas for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, who has a business dealing with vegetable sales.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Sophia's Mkombozi Group

texts.en:
Sophia is a married woman with 3 children, ages 17, 13, and 9; she also takes care of 1 other child, age 18. She became a food and clothes seller in 2006. Every day she works from 6:00 AM to 9:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

Sophia now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with tailoring, food sales, and clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes for her business

loans.name: Ayaovi

texts.fr:
Monsieur F. Ayaovi est né le 04 mars 1982 à Lomé. il est marié et père d'un enfant. Il a pour activité principale la vente des articles de quincaillerie dans le quartier d'Agoè. Il fait beaucoup de vente car son lieu de vente est un quartier en construction et beaucoup de clients préfère acheter auprès de lui afin d'éviter le paiement des frais de déplacement. 
Ce premier crédit qu'il sollicite lui permettra de s'approvisionner par l'achat de 10 cartons de boites de peinture, 40 sachets de chaux et 22 bidons de diluant. Ainsi avec ce nouveau stock, il pourra attirer plus de clients et bien vendre.

loans.use: Achat des articles de quincaillerie

loans.name: Nefija

texts.en:
Nefija is a 34 year old woman from the town of Lukavac. She is a widow and raising her two children on her own. Nefija receives some government assistance for her kids and some money from her husband’s pension, but this comes to only $320 a month and it is not enough to support them all.

To supplement their income, Nefjia sells clothing at the local market. She wants to use her first loan from Žene za Žene to invest in increased inventory for her store. Nefija believes that if she can offer more items to her customers, she can increase her overall earnings. Nefija hopes that this loan will allow her to expand her business and will help her to provide a better life for her children.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to increase her inventory and expand her business.

loans.name: Frida's Group

texts.en:
Frida is 28 years old. She is a married woman with 2 children, ages 11 and 1. She became a charcoal and vegetable seller in 2006. Every day she works from 6:00 AM to 9:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

Frida now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, who owns a shop.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Martha's Malaika Group

texts.en:
Martha is a married woman with 3 children, ages 18, 16, and 3. She became a tailor in 2005. Every day she works from 8:00 AM to 12:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

Martha now hopes for a loan to buy more tailoring items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with a salon, tailoring, clothes sales, and wood sales.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring items to increase her stock

loans.name: Messan Délali

texts.fr:
Mr. Messan Délali A. was born April 18, 1983 in Lomé.  He is single and sells phone cards in Lomé as his trade.  He has been running this business since 2005 and has clients to whom he delivers these cards.  Given the large number of clients, he is unable to satisfy them all.  It is for this reason that his is requesting this first loan to buy two boxes of phone cards.
Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur A. Messan Délali est né le 18 avril 1983 à Lomé. Il est célibataire et a pour activité la vente des cartes de recharge à Lomé. Il a commencé ce commerce depuis l’année 2005 et a des clients à qui il livre ces cartes. 
Compte tenu du nombre important de ses clients, il n’arrive pas à les satisfaire. A cet effet, il sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter deux (2) cartons de cartes de recharge.

loans.use: Purchase of phone cards

loans.name: Dorah's Malaika Group

texts.en:
Dorah is 43 years old. She is a married woman with 4 children, ages 25, 23, 20, and 18. She became a chicken seller in 2000. Every day she works from 8:00 AM to 12:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

Dorah now hopes for a loan to buy more chickens for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Adelina and Rukia, who have businesses dealing with tailoring and clothes and fish sales.

loans.use: To buy more chickens for her business

loans.name: Mahadia's Maendeleo Group

texts.en:
Mahadia is 33 years old. She is a married woman with 2 children, ages 10 and 7. She became a vegetable seller in 2007. Every day she works from 8:00 AM to 12:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

Mahadia now hopes for a loan to buy more vegetables for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with clothes and food sales.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for her business

loans.name: Mary's Kanan Group

texts.en:
Mary is 21 years old. She is a married woman with 1 child, age 4. She own a small beauty salon, which she started in 2007. Every day she works from 9:00 AM to 9:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $800 from her sales.

Mary now hopes for a loan to buy a dryer for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with fish and cassava sales, a grocery, and rice sales.

loans.use: To buy more salon items (a dryer) for her business

loans.name: Yuryi

texts.en:
Yuryi B. is an entrepreneur from Khoost. He runs a small business selling children’s clothing in one of the local markets. He started his venture three years ago. Currently, he is making about $800 in income. His business is characterized by stable expansion and profitability.

Yuryi is the only breadwinner in the family. He has to put much effort in this business to make it sustainable and profitable. Yuryi would like to receive a loan of 3000 Grivnas to increase his inventory. Yuryi has promptly repaid all loans from Nadiya Ukraine. We believe his integrity, responsibility, and strong will can help him succeed and repay the current loan without any problems.

loans.use: To increase his clothing stock

loans.name: Pavlo

texts.en:
Pavlo is married. He lives in Khoost and works as a taxi driver. He has been in this business for five years. His monthly income is about $500. One of the most outstanding characteristics of his venture has been its stability and consistent growth.

Pavlo is requesting a loan of 3500 Grivnas to cover expenses connected with paperwork he needs to prepare in order to install a gas equipment system in his vehicle. Pavlo has been planning to make these changes for awhile because he wanted to decrease his fuel costs and make his business more efficient. Pavlo has proved to be a responsible client with Nadiya Ukraine. We believe his drive for success and increased profits will be the best motivation for prompt loan repayment and further development of his business.

loans.use: To get all paperwork and install gas equipment

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia started her own business out of financial necessity. One of her children needed medical treatment because she was born with a medical condition, but the treatment was too expensive. On top of that, she needed to pay the household expenses. At that time, since she was not able to get a job, she decided to open up a beauty salon because she had experience in cutting, styling, and dyeing hair. Thanks to this business, she has been able to raise her two children.

She needs a loan of $800.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase beauty salon furniture that she needs for manicures and acrylic nails.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Claudia inicio el negocio por necesidades económicas esto fue que los tratamientos que necesitaba uno de sus hijos por que nació delicada de salud eran muy caros, además que necesitaba pagar sola los gastos de su casa, en ese momento porque no podía conseguir trabajo y teniendo la experiencia de cortes, peinados, tintes etc. decidió poner su negocio. Gracias a este ha podido sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $800 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar muebles que necesita para la aplicación de uñas acrílicas.

loans.use: Purchase beauty salon furniture

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
Rubén lives with his wife. Both are a little over 50 years of age. He was initially a bricklayer, but because of his age, it was difficult to continue with that job, so he decided to sell cahuamanta (a manta ray and shrimp soup from Sonora) for a living. He started 5 years ago, setting up his cart on a corner until he was able to obtain a permit from the municipality so that he could establish his business and operate during fixed business hours.

He needs a loan of $500.00 USD, which he will repay in 6 months, in order to repair the vehicle with which he tows his business cart.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Rubén vive solo con su esposa tienen un poco mas de 50 años , el origen de su negocio fue que el era albañil y por su edad ya le era difícil continuar con este oficio y decidió poner su negocio de venta de cahuamanta. Comenzó hace 5 años poniéndose en las esquinas hasta que logro conseguir un permiso del municipio para poner su negocio estable con su horario correspondiente.

El necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses el cual le servirá para reparar su automóvil con el que remolcan la carreta de su negocio.

loans.use: Repair work vehicle

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business #58387

loans.name: Alma Angelica

texts.es:
Alma started the business to support her children and husband, who was in poor health because of an accident he suffered at work. Faced with this situation she needed to have an income to be able to eat and buy medicines for her husband, because he did not have medical insurance. She started her own business in her house four years ago, buying fish from the co-workers of her husband, who sold it to her at a reduced price. In this way she was able to earn money for family expenses and to buy medicines for her husband, and so tend to and care for her sick husband and their 3 children.

She needs a loan of $500, which will be repaid in 6 months, to buy a freezer in order to keep her products well refrigerated without fear of losing them to the high temperatures that they have in that city.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Alma inició el negocio para sacar adelante a sus hijos y esposo que se encontraba mal de salud debido a que sufrió un accidente en el trabajo, ante esta situación ella necesitaba tener un ingreso para poder comer y comprar medicinas para su esposo, debido a que no tenia seguro medico, inicio su propio negocio en casa, hace 4 años comprando pescado, con los compañeros de trabajo de su esposo, ya que se lo vendían a bajo precio. Fue así que pudo tener dinero para el gasto familiar y poder comprar medicinas para su esposo y así atender y cuidar a su esposo enfermo y a sus 3 hijos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para en comprar un congelador, y así poder tener sus productos bien refrigerados sin temor de que se le echen a perder, por las altas temperaturas que se presentan en esta ciudad.

loans.use: To buy a freezer to protect her fish products from the heat.

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business #58388

loans.name: Jesus Francisco

texts.es:
Jesús began the business to be able to tend to the sickness of his wife. The medicines are too expensive and, with only one income, he could not afford them. In addition to selling hot dogs, he sells pastries in his house. He began 5 years ago renting a cart from a friend but in time he decided to buy it and in this way be the boss of his own business to help his wife and support their children.

He needs a loan of $1,000, which will be repaid in 6 months, to put together the cart and complete a trailer to haul it.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Jesús emprendió el negocio para poder atender la enfermedad de su esposa, los medicamentos son demasiados caros y con un solo sueldo no alcanzaba a solventarlos, además de vender hot dogs, vende tortas en su casa, empezó hace 5 años rentando una carreta a un amigo pero ya con el tiempo decidió comprársela y así ser dueño de su propio negocio para ayudar a su esposa y sacar adelante a sus hijos.

El necesita un préstamo por US $1,000 que pagara en 6 meses para componer la carreta y completar el total de una batanga para jalarla.

loans.use: To build a cart with a trailer for his food business.

loans.name: Mujeres De Fe- Group4

texts.en:
Senaida A. has a business in which she buys and resells clothing that she has been operating for about 2½ years now with the help of loans from Esperanza. She has two children, 41 and 38, whom do not live with Mrs. A.. When not working with her clothing shop, she enjoys going to the beach and cooking, arroz con carne (rice with meat) being one of her favorite dishes. As Mrs. A. is in her elder years and has fully grown children, she simply wishes to sustain her business to support her and her husband.

Mrs. Senaida A. is a member of an eight person group, Group 4, that is part of a larger micro-bank called Mujeres D. Fe, "Women of Faith" in English. In the picture, Mrs. A. is third from the right along with members of her group and some others of Mujeres D. Fe. Her story is just one of a list of men and women who are improving their quality of life through the help of micro-credit loans of Esperanza. Together, this group has united with a common vision of a better life with faith and hope in their hearts and an unbreakable spirit. The concept of group lending is to have loans paid in a group to reduce the risk of a person defaulting, as others pick up where a person may lag to receive the next loan. Each of the associates in this bank has a similar business whether it is a motor taxi service or selling cosmetics. Thank you for your support and awareness of this issue, and it is your concern and efforts that is able to bring a difference to the lives of people such as Mrs. A..

loans.use: This group of women would like a loan for their various businesses, from buying clothing and cosmetics for resale to operating a motor taxi service.

loans.name: Norma Lidia

texts.es:
Norma is divorced. She started the business to obtain an income and to be able to pay some debts that she had. She began 3 years ago selling lunches and some foods. Little by little she increased her sales and in this way has been able to support her family.

She needs a loan of $500, that will be repaid in 6 months, to buy an industrial stove. With your support Norma will grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Norma es divorciada, inició el negocio para obtener ingresos y poder pagar algunas deudas que tenia, empezó hace 3 años vendiendo lonches y algunas comidas, poco a poco fue incrementando sus ventas y es así como ha podido sacar adelante a su familia.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar una estufa industrial. Con tu apoyo Norma hará crecer su negocio.

loans.use: to buy an industrial stove for her food business.

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business #58391

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma is divorced and has 2 children: one age 13 and one age 11. She started the business to be able to pay for the studies of her two daughters. At that time her need was to obtain a larger income for the support of her family. For this she began a year ago selling jewelry to her friends and acquaintances. Little by little she grew her list of clients, which has allowed her to obtain a better income in order to offer a better quality of life to her children.

She needs a loan of $600, which will be repaid in 6 months, to buy a display case to exhibit her jewelry products. With your help Irma will move ahead.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Irma es divorciada y tiene 2 hijos uno de 13 y uno de 11, inicio el negocio para poder pagar el estudio de sus dos hijas, en aquel entonces su necesidad era obtener un mayor ingreso para el sustento de su familia, por lo que empezó hace un año vendiendo joyería a sus amigos y familiares, poco a poco ha ido incrementado su cartera de clientes, lo que le ha permitido obtener mejores ingresos para ofrecerles mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $600 que pagara en 6 meses para compra una vitrina y exhibir sus productos de joyería. Con tu ayuda Irma saldrá adelante.

loans.use: To buy a display case for her jewelry.

loans.name: San Valentin Group

texts.es:
El Grupo San Valentín es un antiguo grupo cliente de Emprender, Ha sufrido en el transcurso del tiempo, diversas modificaciones en sus integrantes por diversas razones. La última conformación del grupo San Valentín, conformado por 4 personas, lleva con nosotros algo más de un año, demostrando mucha eficiencia en sus labores.

Desde sus inicios este grupo se ha caracterizado, porque sus integrantes tienen actividades parecidas o relacionadas entre sí, lo cual ha fortalecido el lazo de amistad que los ha unido en este grupo.

La jefe de grupo es la señora Julia L., que se dedica a la comercialización de lubricantes para automotores, labor que le permite ser ecónomicamente activa en la manutención de su hogar, quien junto a su marido atienden cariñosamente a sus hijos procurando que no les falte nada. Además administra con mucha eficiencia los desembolsos y pago de las cuotas de su grupo, por este motivo todos en el grupo San Valentín la consideran jefe de grupo, y la tratan con mucho respeto.

El señor Eugenio B. es cerrajero, fue fundador del grupo, pero por motivos personales decidió retirarse del grupo hace dos años, sin embargo, la oportunidad de ser beneficiado por el financiamiento de Kiva lo motivó a retornar al grupo en esta oprtunidad.

El Señor Antonio C., es mecánico, su trabajo relacionado a la reparación de automotores, en especial, dedicados al transporte público, lo relacionó con el grupo, y forma parte de este desde hace un año. Es un padre responsable y ama mucho su trabajo.

El señor Roberto C. es transportista, se dedica a la conducción de vehículo de transporte público, trabajo que realiza con mucho esmero, es un cliente tambien fundador del grupo y se destaca por su responsabilidad.

La relación del grupo es de amistad la señora julia, el señor Eugenio y el señor Antonio tienen sus negocios frente a frente y el señor Roberto, es muchas veces cliente de ellos.
texts.en:
The San Valentin Group is an old client of Emprender. Over time there have been changes in the group members for various reasons. The most recent group configuration of the San Valentin Group has existed for a bit over a year and they have proven their efficiency in their tasks.

From its beginnings this group has been formed by members with very similar activities or activities which are related. This has strengthened the links between the group members. The group leader is Mrs. Julia L., she sells automotive lubricants. Her job has allowed her to be an active collaborator in the family finances. Together with her husband they lovingly take care of their children to ensure they have all their needs met.

She also efficiently manages the microloan repayment for her group, which is why all members of the San Valentín group consider her the group leader and treat her with a lot of respect.

Mr. Eugenio B. is a locksmith and was the founder of the group. For personal reasons he decided to leave the group two years ago. However, the opportunity to benefit from Kiva´s financing motivated him to return to the group to seize this opportunity.

Mr. Antonio C. is a car mechanic and specializes in vehicles destined to public transport. He has been with the group for a year and is a responsible father who really loves his work.

Mr. Roberto C. is a bus driver and he puts a lot of care into his job. He is also a founding member of the group and stands out for his responsible attitude.

There is a friendly atmosphere within the group. Mrs.Julia, Mr.Eugenio and Mr.Antonio have their businesses facing each other in the same street and Mr.Roberto often utilizes their services.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business investments

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario is married and has two children, Juan, age 16, and Karina, age 8. His wife is a homemaker. Ever since he was a child, he has liked to work in carpentry. He wanted to provide his family with a better quality of life than the one that he had, so he started his own business 7 years ago. He makes bed frames and other furniture in his patio, and little by little, thanks to his efforts, he has been able to help his business grow by increasing his clientele.

He needs a loan of $500.00 USD, which he will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase lumber to make more furniture. With your support, Mario will continue with his business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Mario es casado, su esposa se dedica al hogar, tiene dos hijos uno de 16 años se llama Juan y una de 8 años llamada Karina,. Le gusta trabajar en la carpintería desde niño había deseado que cuando tuviera su familia les daría una mejor calidad vida que la que el tuvo, comenzó su negocio hace 7 años en el patio de su casa fabricando bases para cama, y otros muebles, poco a poco y gracias a su esfuerzo ha podido hacer crecer su negocio incrementado sus clientes.

El necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar madera para producir más muebles. Con tu apoyo Mario seguirá con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase lumber

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business #58394

loans.name: Cleta

texts.es:
Mrs. Cleta H. Mamani has worked with the San Alberto group for 5 loan cycles and has since started to work alone and is currently on her 6th loan. She is a very responsible client.

Her husband is a transporter and they have two small children of school-going age. Her file shows a very good credit history and she is very responsible as she has had to work from a very young age due to not having the means to study. This is why she instills the values and responsibility of going to school in her children, so that they do not have to go through the same thing she did.

Both she and her husband are young and their file shows that they pay their loans off together.

Translated from Portuguese by Inês Teles, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Cleta H. Mamani trabajo en el grupo San Alberto en 5 secuencias, posteriormente se individualizo y actualmente se encuentra en su 6ta. Secuencia, es una cliente muy responsable, su esposo es transportista y tienen dos hijos pequeños en edad escolar, a la fecha presenta un historial muy bueno ya que la Sra. es muy responsable porque se vio en la necesidad de trabajar desde muy pequeña ya que no tenia los medios para estudiar y es que por eso que les inculca responsabilidad a sus hijos para que no sufran las necesidades que ella tuvo que pasar ambos esposos son jóvenes y se colaboran en los pagos del crédito en las fechas señaladas.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries, chicken and for their transportation

loans.name: Cristo Viene- Group 4

texts.en:
Paulina S. is a cheerful lady who is known by others in her group for loving to talk, sharing stories, and expressing her opinion. She is the mother of five children, ages 14-21, all of whom live with Mrs. S. except for the eldest who is married. She runs a shop where she sells clothing as well as a number of other personal items. When asked what her favorite food was, she laughs and says all types of meat, chicken, beef, fish, etc. In the future, Mrs. S. hopes to be able to focus her shop in one area and specialize in a particular item. She says that right now she sells a wide variety of things because there isn’t enough money in any one field to support her and her family.

Mrs. Paulina S. is a member of a 5 person group, Group 4, which is part of a larger micro-bank called Cristo Viene, "Christ Comes" in English. In the picture, Mrs. S. is in the center in the very back with a white shirt on along with members of her group and some others of Cristo Viene. Her story is just one of a list of men and women who are improving their quality of life through the help of micro-credit loans of Esperanza. Together, this group has united with a common vision of a better life with faith and hope in their hearts and an unbreakable spirit. The concept of group lending is to have loans paid in a group to reduce the risk of a person defaulting, as others pick up where a person may lag to receive the next loan. Each of the associates in this bank has a similar business whether it is a motor taxi service or selling clothing. Thank you for your support and awareness of this issue, and it is your concern and efforts that is able to bring a difference to the lives of people such as Mrs. S..

loans.use: This group would like to improve their businesses, such as Paulina, who would like to improve her clothing store.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Mrs. Angela S., a client since 2005 who is in her sixth loan cycle, demonstrated her punctuality and responsibility in her credits. Her husband signs as her co-guarantor and he is the owner of a cargo truck, a business that both of them work in to support their household composed of their 5 school-age children. The loans go to increase their working capital and to save for the purchase of a house as they now have no relatives in the city and want to leave something for their children in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Angela S., cliente desde el año 2005, se enuentra en su sexta secuencia, demostró en sus créditos puntualidad y responsabilidad. Su esposo firma como codeudor, el es dueño de un transporte y ambos trabajan para mantener su hogar conformado por 5 hijos en edad escolar. Los créditos destinan para el aumento de su capital de trabajo y poder ahorras para la compra de una casita ya que no tienen familiares en la ciudad y quieren dejar algo para el futuro de sus hijos

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve her pig raising business

loans.name: Abdul K's Group

texts.en:
Abdul K. M., Emmanuel B. S., Lansana F., Hassan K. and Abu Bakarr K. are all soldiers based in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first time they have applied for a loan from SMT. With a loan, they will be able to tackle their immediate needs and then repay gradually with their monthly salaries.

Their leader, Abdul, is 46. He was born in Sanda Taindaran, a village neighboring Makeni, and he is married with 8 children.These five have different reasons for seeking a loan from SMT. Abdul and Abu Bakarr want to buy corrugated iron zincs. Emmanuel wants to pay his children's school fees and other charges. Lansana and Hassan would like to invest in their wives' businesses. They are requesting a loan of Le 5,000,000.

loans.use: Buy corrugated iron zincs.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is married, with two wives and seven children. He has so far been unable to educate, feed, and clothe his children properly. He feels he cannot provide them with a good home, and he hates thinking about his incapacity as a man in providing for his family. In 1998, George joined GHAPE as a way to improve his situation. It was a turning point when he was able to borrow and repay his loan in ten consecutive installments without any difficulty.

George is requesting a loan of $250 to continue his business. He has been raising pigs for the past ten years and has also done some industrial work. He believes he is going to succeed because he has already been in this business for several years now..

He knows he is going to help the community with his trade because it will provide people with meat. George is also going to help to teach other locals his trade. He prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the low interest rate and other benefits of being a member, like learning on how to use a loan to the full benefit..

loans.use: Raising pigs, industrial work, and some tailoring

loans.name: La Revolucion- Group 1

texts.en:
Jacqueline N. M. is a married mother of three children, ages 8, 10, and 12, who is trying to improve her life for herself and her children through loans from Esperanza. She has been working with loans for about 1½ years now in her business where she runs a small seafood restaurant. Her business specializes in seafood, but when asked what she enjoys eating most she says, “Me gusta toda” (I like everything). She is an avid churchgoer and a firm believer in Christ. In the future, Mrs. N. M. hopes to see her business grow and move forward to provide for herself and her young children.

Mrs. N. M. is a member of a 7 person group, Group 1, which is part of a larger micro-bank called La Revolucion, "The Revolution" in English. In the picture, Mrs. N. M. is in third from the right in the back with a blue shirt on along with members of her group and some others of La Revolucion. Her story is just one of a list of men and women who are improving their quality of life through the help of micro-credit loans of Esperanza. Together, this group has united with a common vision of a better life with faith and hope in their hearts and an unbreakable spirit. The concept of group lending is to have loans paid in a group to reduce the risk of a person defaulting, as others pick up where a person may lag to receive the next loan. Each of the associates in this bank has a similar business such as a restaurant or selling clothing. Thank you for your support and awareness of this issue, and it is your concern and efforts that is able to bring a difference to the lives of people such as Mrs. N. M..

loans.use: This group would like to improve their various businesses, like Jacqueline who would like to improve her restaurant.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel N. was born in 1960 is not married. He has three children. Samuel is requesting a loan of $250 with which he intends to buy poultry, sprayers, seedlings, and medicine. He is convinced this activity will succeed because he will take care of his animals and crops, and the urban population and his local town will provide a ready market for his eggs, chicken and vegetables. His business will help the community by providing, among other things, spices and tomatoes, which are staples for people in his area. 

With the profit realized from this activity, Samuel intends to eat well, live in a better house, increase the size of his farm and provide himself and his family with medication in times of ill health. He has borrowed and repaid GHAPE loans six times without any problems. He is requesting a loan from GHAPE because training is offered on income generating activities and GHAPE charges a lower interest rate than he would be offered elsewhere.

loans.use: Poultry and gardening

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George A. Warden sells provisions and fishing items. He is married, but his wife's income is not sufficient for George and his 4 children. Demand for his goods is high, and he is looking to expand his business to increase his profits.

He is asking for additional capital to expand his business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand his business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emanuel is married and has eight children. Emmanuel has recently been greatly impacted by thieves that harassed him and stole his belongings and the small capital he had accrued. His family has also been seriously affected by illness, which has made life very difficult. He does not like to dwell on these issues in his life.

Faced with these numerous difficulties, Emmanuel discovered that GHAPE could be a way out and joined the organization in 1999. Since then he has been able to manage and repay six different loans with no repayment difficulties. Emmanuel is requesting a loan of $400 to improve his provision store. He believes he will succeed because he will personally carry out his activities and there will be no other provisions stores in his neighborhood. His business will help the community by providing them with basic commodities and other goods.

Emmanuel will use his profit to provide for his family, pay his children’s school fees and reinvest in his business for future expansion. He prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the three-month investment period, low interest rate and the fact that GHAPE inspires him to be a more active businessman.

loans.use: Provisions store

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias N. was born in 1945. He is married and the father of six children, three of whom are below the ages of 15. Due to the death of his parents and family problems like land disputes, Elias was unable to go to secondary school. He was introduced to farming by friends.


Elias became a member of GHAPE in 2001 and has borrowed and repaid loans five times, totaling $730. He invested these loans in raising poultry, fish farming, and growing crops like cassava. The profit of these loans was used to pay school fees, send his son to learn a trade, dig fish ponds and pay a dowry for his son’s wife. 


Elias is requesting a loan of $600. He plans to use this loan to increase his fish farm by digging more ponds and adding more fish. He also intends to grow crops like cassava, maize and corn. He is convinced that his business is going to be successful because he has experience in the business and enough land for farming. In addition, demand for fish in his community is very high, especially during the Christmas season. He plans to use the profit from this loan to build a house for his family, pay school fees, pay his son’s apprentice fee, and provide other basic needs for the family. 


He has 24 months to repay this loan and the first repayment installment begins on the fourth month after disbursement.

loans.use: Raising pigs and fish

loans.name: Alberta

texts.es:
Ms. Alberta A. has had her business for about 10 years, and she runs it alone, since her husband works as a contractor and travels a lot. The couple has five children of whom two are already married and live in their own places, the rest still live with their parents since they are still young.

Ms. Alberta asked for a loan to be able to increase the variety of merchandise at her business, especially the butcher shop. The merchandise she will acquire is: cold cuts, sausage, pate, ham, etc. and distinct types of meat like loin, chicken, pork, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Alberta A. tiene su despensa hace aproximadamente 10 años, ella lo maneja sola pues su marido trabaja como contratista de obras (albañil) y viaja mucho. El matrimonio tiene 5 hijos de los cuales dos ya están casados y viven en sus propios hogares, los demás aún viven con la pareja pues son menores aún.

La señora Alberta solicitó el crédito para poder ampliar la variedad de mercaderías del negocio, especialmente la carnicería. Las mercaderías a adquirir son: fiambre, chorizo, paté, jamón, etc. y distintos tipos de carnes como carnaza, puchero, lomo, pollo, cerdo, etc.

loans.use: Buying more meat to sell

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela Zorilla is a humble and hardworking woman. She lives in the lower zone of the city of Asuncion, always works hard and is singleand already retired. She receives a monthly pension for her retirement, but this money is not sufficient to maintain her house.

Gabriela works together with her daughter who lives with her, they are both single and take care of each other. Their primary activity is the creation and sale of all types of food. Their customers come to their house during the breakfast and lunch hours to enjoy their delicious plates.

To increase their income, she also prepares fast foods like empanadas, Milanese sandwiches, mbeyu (a traditional food), and other food to go and sell around the neighborhood in her basket.

She is asking for a loan that will let her buy ingredients in large quantities to increase her production. They include: meat, flour, milk, eggs, and vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva volunteer.

Gabriela Z., es una persona humilde y trabajadora, ella vive en una zona baja de la Cuidad de Asunción, siempre trabajo duro, es soltera y docente pero ya jubilada. Ella cobra una pensión mensual por su jubilación pero ese dinero no es suficiente para mantener la casa.

Gabriela trabaja junto con su hija quien vive con ella, ambas son solteras y se cuidan mutuamente. Su actividad principal es la elaboración y venta de comidas de todo tipo. Sus clientes van hasta su casa en los horarios de desayuno y almuerzo para disfrutar de sus deliciosos platos.

Para aumentar sus ingresos, ella también prepara comidas rápidas como empanadas, milanesas, mbeyu (comida típica) y otra cosas mas para salir a vender por el barrio recorriendo con su canasto.

Ella solicita un crédito que le permitirá comprar ingredientes en grandes cantidades para asi aumentar su producción. Entre ellos citamos: carne, harina, leche, huevos, verduras.

loans.use: Purchase of meat, flour, milk, eggs and vegetables

loans.name: Diana Fri

texts.en:
Diana Fri B. was born in 1960. She is a widow and the mother of 3 children. Poverty due to lack of education, insufficient resources to learn a trade, the death of her father who was doing odd jobs like clearing of farms in order to raise daily income for the family, and the death of her husband, which was a great shock, have made her life extremely difficult.

She was motivated by all these circumstances to become a member of GHAPE in 2005. GHAPE trained her how to start a business and manage it. She has already successfully managed loans amounting to $120 in which she invested in buying and selling palm oil, raising animals like pigs and poultry, and farming crops like cassava. She was able to use the profit from these loans to barter for the school needs of her children, clothing, and some basic necessities for her family.

Diana is now requesting a loan of $725, which she plans to invest in growing cassava, raising pigs and poultry, and buying and selling palm oil. She says her business is going to succeed because she has been farming since the age of five when her parents began to teach her. In addition, she has enough land for farming and rearing animals, and the demand for them is high.

She plans to repay this loan in 18 months and the first installment repayment begins four months after disbursement.

loans.use: Growing cassava, raising pigs and poultry, and selling palm oil

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina M. cooks rice to sell. She is married, but her husband's income is not sufficient for Angelina and her 5 children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana A. was born in 1950. She is one of three wives and a mother of eight children, all of whom are above the age of 15. “My son and his wife died leaving me with a young baby”, she further explains, “So my husband and I are left to take care of the family. My children are not doing anything to bring in a living and my husband is a subsistence farmer who brings no income to the family.”

Diana has been a member of GHAPE for three years now and has successfully repaid two loans, both of which she invested in buying and selling palm oil, pigs, and farming crops like beans, maize, cassava, corn, and potatoes. The profits have helped her to pay school fees for her children and to take care of some of her family’s other basic needs.

Diana is requesting a loan of $300 to expand her palm oil and pig businesses and to increase the size of her farm by adding more land. She is convinced that her business is going to succeed because nearly all households need palm oil to cook, and people come from far and near to buy them. Her farm currently provides her family with all the staple crops they need, and if she farms more land, she may be able to sell the surplus.

She plans to repay this loan in 18 months and the first installment repayment begins four months after disbursement.

loans.use: Farming cassava, pigs and poultry. Buying and selling palm oil.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia E. is a fishmonger. She is married, but her husband's income as a fisherman is not sufficient for Cecilia and her 3 children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Justice B.

texts.en:
Justice B. F. operates a pub. He is married, but his wife's income as a fishmonger is not sufficient for Justice and his 5 children. Demand for his goods is high, and he is looking to expand his business to increase his profits.

He is asking for additional capital to expand his business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand his business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Mujeres En Acción Group

texts.es:
The members of this committee are dedicated to varied activities, among which can be counted the sale of clothes, fast foods like empanadas, tortillas, small roasted meat croquettes, etc.; others are dedicated to the recycling of cardboard, plastic and all types of metals. In addition to running their small business, the majority of them are also the heads of their households and are in charge of administering the finances, the education of their children, and the care of their homes.

This committee is actually in its sixth cycle in our program, which demonstrates that it is a well organized and solid group. The hopes of progress which each of the members has is the most important ingredient in maintaining the success of them all. They hoep that their children don’t have to face the same work and educational limitations that they had when they were younger, and because of this, they work doubly hard to be able to give their children the opportunity of progress.
